reviews.text: First time there in over 6 months.<br>It was lots of social distancing but it took quite a long time to bring out our entrées. Didn&#39;t even get a refill of water. The server was sweet but wasn&#39;t listening so everything was not brought out correctly but we just dealt with it.<br>The mall closes early so you have to pretty much park outside for three dollars.

I don&#39;t know why the memory of this place filled me with such nostalgia. I don&#39;t know why I remember Cheesecake Factory from my college days being good. I don&#39;t know where I got this thinking from but this place is terrible. First of all, they&#39;re supposed to offer you complimentary bread. They didn&#39;t offer us that. We felt rushed to order. There wasn&#39;t any recommendations when we asked for some. We ended up getting the some of their pastas and it tasted horrible. Also got their samosas for appetizers, also not good. Also got the margarita, don&#39;t know what I was thinking but terrible! Will not be returning ever! This definitely cured me of all the college nostalgia I had of this place!

This was our date night.  My wife wanted to go to Cheese Cake Factory.  I&#39;m glad we came.  Our waitress was Fran.  She was absolutely great.  Great conversation.  Great customer service.  The order was great and she gave us some GREAT recommendations.  If I could give her a raise I would.  We will be coming back and hopefully Fran will help is again.

I have been here on two occasions and I leave satisfied with the food every time. This place is extremely busy on certain days so I always expect to have to wait for either a table, the food to come back, or both. Unfortunately it took a really long time just to get our bread out. Luckily, I wasn&#39;t too upset considering the bread came out nice and warm. I ended up ordering a delicious steak dish with a pineapple upside down cheesecake. Both equally amazing in flavor! I don&#39;t live nearby but I try to go when I am in the area!

Service is slow and unappealing. They will take your order. Disappear. Bring food and disappear for good. The bread was cold and OLD. That sourdough is already hard enough when it&#39;s fresh but let it sit in the &#34;box&#34; for any good length of time and forget it. I just cannot in good conscience give this location a good review at this time. With all the competition around them in the galleria you would think they would be on their game at all times, but I guess not. Food doesn&#39;t just sell itself unless you&#39;re a vending machine.
Awesome place.. food and decor amazing.  Servers are great.  It&#39;s a must if you can get out

I brought two of my students here for a nice treat before the Rockets game. We walked in and I was excited to show off to them a nicer restaurant than usual. <br><br>We were seated and they were immediately grossed out when they opened their menus. More than one page on both of their menus were coved in food. I was so disappointed!!<br><br>The bread came out at least 10 minutes after we ordered our drinks were delivered. The girls enjoyed it and the huge dish of butter. <br><br>One student ordered the steak tacos. She said the rice did not have any flavor and the tacos had too much sauce on them for her. I tasted the rice and it was crunchy. <br><br>Another student got the fried shrimp. She said they were sweet and shaped odd. She ate most of it, so I guess she enjoyed it! <br><br>My Farefalle pasta with chicken was incredible!! The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious!! I would get that again!

I had ordered a 6in Fresh strawberry Chsck, opened the box at and home and I see An original chsck.<br>Was so excited to buy a cake for my husbands surprise birthday dinner tonight and this is what I get,when I called the restaurant and spoke to a manager, Manager Justin wanted me to come back with the cake, suggested me to keep the Cake frozen/cold. So he could fix the same cake with some strawberries to make it look pretty? Wow! Great management!! Thanks server Zachary and Manager Justin for ruining my husbands birthday dinner and our night. <br>Never going back!

One of the great restaurants in the Galleria area with a HUGE menu. They serve an assortment of choices for anyone. I have had their hamburger sliders, the Chicken Coatoletta and their pork chop. And the desserts??? Tons of cheesecake but I actually enjoy their Blackout Chocolate Cake.

I haven&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory in quite a while but I was invited to a birthday celebration at the Galleria area location and we decided to go and dine. It was a pretty large party of like 15 people. We didn&#39;t wait long at all before we were seated. Our waitress was so sweet and I kept making her chuckle with my ordering humor. She made a couple of great drink and food recommendations. I had Tex mex eggs rolls and the buffalo chicken bites. The buffalo chicken bites were beyond amazing! I also had a mai tai cocktail and my entree was the Honey truffle chicken served with mashed potatoes and asparagus. It was a very good dish. My husband had the Cobb salad and it looked amazing. We had a wonderful time. The ambiance, food quality  and service went far beyond my expectations!

What a disappointment. We thought a chain would get us some familiar comfort food. My husband was successful but I was not. The restaurant was packed as usual when we arrived. We are at the bar downstairs so we didn&#39;t have to wait. Our server, Kayla, was pleasant and tried her best. She couldn&#39;t make up for the kitchen. We tried to order the combo egg rolls as an appetizer only to be informed that they were out of 2 of the 3 varieties for the item (no avocado or cheeseburger).  So we settled on tex mex.  They came out popping hot. They were absolutely excellent!<br><br>Ordered shrimp scampi for my entree.  What a mess. Took 30 minutes to arrive cold. Even worse, barely any pasta. If you eat here regularly, you know they are known for large portions. In fact, I was reluctant to order the scampi because we were staying at the hotel I. The Galleria and did not want to deal with the leftovers. Well they took care of that by not providing more than 2 TBSP of pasta. <br>At least the manager came and offered to remake the horrible entree but after waiting so o ou ng doe the initial order, I don&#39;t want to deal with it.<br><br>My husband convinced me to order cheesecake to try to salvage the meal. We ordered Dulce de leche.<br><br>If it had not been for our server trying so hard this rating would have been a 2.  Her effort to make it right gained a point. We eat at Cheesecake factory so regularly that this snafu has made me so upset.  I appreciate her as she was the only pleasant part of the visit.

Food was pretty good, I got the spaghetti and it was decent, though it is more famous for the cheesecake--honestly I would rather eat lunch somewhere cheap and then just come for the cheesecake. The hershey&#39;s cheesecake was great, though it is pretty rich so people who don&#39;t want super sweet things probably shouldn&#39;t get a chocolate flavored cheesecake.

I took out delivery due to the disgusting atmosphere of the restaurant, turns out I should have just ate somewhere else all together. The food was cold and made incorrectly. The bread was hard as a rock. Waste of money.

My goodness, one of the best things on the menu are the avocado spring rolls as well as the fried Mac and cheese balls. Their portion sizes are very big especially when you order the pasta! &#34;The Oreo cheesecake was heavenly&#34; if you let my husband explain it (giggles). The food is seasoned to perfection. No dryness with just the right amount of juiciness! <br><br>For myself, I also ordered the all time BEST, strawberry cheesecake. Let&#39;s just say it was wonderful, flavorful, and delightful all in one of many bites. Tonight was my first time eating cheesecake ever, and I&#39;ve been begging to come here. I&#39;ve heard great/bad things but my experience was optimum.<br><br>For the setting, it is relaxed with mid-low lighting. Casual dressing is normal for this spot. We were seated with little to no waiting time (no reservations made). Groups are welcomed, there was a graduation family of 10+ seated near us. This location is inside the galleria, so feel free to go shop and walk some of those calories off (1000 calorie cheesecake). But this is definitely the place for dates, events, and family time. I will be coming back soon.

Atmosphere: As always, the ambience is very elegant and fancy. I love coming here because it is a happy medium between boujie vibes and guilty pleasures. The service was absolutely phenomenal, down to the staff that refilled our drinks. The server attended to all of our needs with a calm and southern vibe. His assistant never let our drinks get below half way full, kept bread on the table, and pre-bussed the table frequently. <br><br>Food: The food and drinks were to die for. My mom got a green Apple martini made with patron and I got a mojito. We loved our drinks! I ordered the shrimp scampi and steak and it was beyond delicious. The buttery, wine scampi sauce was so delectable! The steak was cooked perfectly and had a nice, natural sauce as well. But the best part of all, THE MASHED POTATOES!! I&#39;ve never had mashed potatoes this good. All I can say is WOW! <br><br>10/10 recommend!

While the food is very good and portions as big as their menu, the service was not very good this evening.  I checked in at the downstairs host as a single and she handed me a piece of paper with my table number and told me to go upstairs and turned and walked away.  I do have arthritis that is exacerbated by damp weather which we had this evening.  I assume there was no elevator as the option was not give nor did I get the chance to mention I needed an elevator.  When she gave me the slip of paper, I had no other directions than to go upstairs.  That meant once I was able to ascend the stairs, I was left to my own resources to find the upstairs hostess.  I know I am being hard on this, but I majored in hotel restaurant management and was in customer service for 35+ years.  Once I finally found the upstairs host, I was seated.  Now I must say, as a single diner I know I get the worst seat in the house.  My slip of paper stated Table 92.  That is a two top booth behind the upstairs hostess station meaning every time the go into their storage cabinet which is right against table 92 they slam the door closed and sounds like they are coming through the wall.  If they ever try to sit you here, ask to be moved.  I spoke to the manager on this and it improved somewhat.  I had four different servers serving me so I really don&#39;t know who was my waiter.  Out of the four of them, none of them checked on me to see how everything was until they dropped the check.  For the record, it should be after the diner takes a bite or two, not when they are done.  At that point it is too late.  Once I signed my check, one of the four servers sort of hovered at my table waiting to take my signed check.  I moved it up against the wall as a way of saying, &#34;not yet.&#34;  NEVER collect the check from a diner while they are still sitting finishing their food a drink.  It comes across like they are saying, &#34;what did you give me? What did you give me?&#34;
Parking is a hassle. The valet seem sketchy. Food is good, large portions with huge menu. Liked that it&#39;s in the mall. Cheesecake was delicious though  3 Stars

I ordered online thinking it would be done properly when I got there my food would be ready since the restaurants sends you a notification. I arrive my food isn&#39;t ready for another 15 minutes, then the order is wrong, then I had to wait 15 minutes for them to &#34;fix&#34; it, when she brought it back it was still wrong and had to wait ANOTHER 20 minutes!!!! I&#39;ve been here about an hour waiting on them to correct they&#39;re wrongs! No priority no compensation just my evening wasted when I had a lot of work to do. Unsatisfied.

When we got there we expected a wait but we were seated right away. Service was so nice they offered  great suggestions. I was pregnant the last time I went so I couldn&#39;t decide I ordered Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. I also got pizza flatbread and a banana cheesecake. I couldn&#39;t  walk after but my baby was happy. It was nice end to a shopping day. I would definitely recommend.

I had a horrible experience at this location. The waiter was rude and he had an attitude. The manger did not do his job he was not managing. We order 8:30. It is now 9:40. It has been over an hour and the food was burnt with no toppings. I do not recommend this restaurant at all.
The food was subpar &amp; they have a nat problem. The service was good if you don&#39;t mind fending off nats while you try to eat.

We dined in on a Friday evening and was seated within 15 min. The place had a good amount of diners. Our server was Jay and he was awesome! Dining with kids can be a bit of work and usually anything that is quick is the best option. Jay was friendly and awesome with all 3 of my kiddos. After placing our order he asked if they had any food allergies. Shortly after he came back with our drinks, bread, and treats for each of the kids to keep them occupied. That was very nice of him and definitely did the job. They sat there snacking away and when they finished, their kids menu order arrived. Jay came and told us he put the kids order in 1st to make sure it came out fairly quick. Very considerate of him to do so. He came around to check on us multiple times. I know he wasn&#39;t our assigned server for the table we sat at and he was covering for our server who was on break. Even working his own tables and adding us to his load he was very attentive, friendly and quick.

It was my first time at Cheesecake Factory since 1.) I don&#39;t like &#34;American&#34; food and 2.) I don&#39;t like cheesecake. However, I had a great experience and while food is overpriced, it is kind of worth because of the atmosphere inside. It&#39;s gaudy, but fancy, and everybody is chatting. Certainly not a good place if you dislike loud restaurants because it was LOUDDD. <br><br>First off, our waiter was great and very friendly. He was also vegetarian!!! So he was able to bond with our family well haha. We stared off with the free bread which is really good and I wish I had the recipe for it. I ordered penne with garlic sauce and subbed it with angel hair. It was so good and the next out of all the dishes!!! It was a little pricey at $17.95 but that&#39;s just how Cheesecake Factory is. I also got to try Thai chicken curry, Cajun jambalaya, and shrimp with angel hair. They were alright but I liked mine the best. It was creamy, flavorful, and pretty worth.  We ended up ordering two cheesecakes: mango key lime and lemon raspberry cream cheesecake. For someone who doesn&#39;t like cheesecake, I ate a substantial amount because the cheesecake is nice and fluffy.

After a very long and hard work week, I decided to order from The Chessecake Factory via Door Dash before heading home. I had had little sleep and looked forward to getting home, eating and going straight to bed. <br><br>I placed my order at 4pm and it took awhile to get a response it had gone through. The driver contacted me shortly after that she was at the restaurant and waiting for my food. She sat there waiting for an hour. This pisses me off, not because I had to wait, but she did. People do not work food delivery out of the kindness of their hearts. Times are tough and they are doing what they can to make ends meet. They have other jobs and do this in their spare time. She could have taken a couple orders in the time she was made to wait for mine and I find this incredibly inconsiderate of The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I believe the problem is that of management and ownership. Staff better. Pay people better so they want to work for you and do a good job. If at 4pm you were backed up an HOUR for a single entree and already prepared dessert, you were understaffed and that is the fault of the owners and management. You wouldn&#39;t do this to a customer in your establishment I would hope, so don&#39;t do this to those ordering delivery paying the same damn amount. <br><br>When I finally received my order around 5:30pm, the driver had actually called me to tell me she was on her way so I know it was not an issue on her part. When I received my delivery, there was no dessert. My food was cold. Far too cold for her drive over. The green beans weren&#39;t even in my entree container at all. Nope. No green beans. My mashed potatoes were a hard glop of congealed mush. Had my food merely just been sitting in the window while the driver and I both waited? I don&#39;t know. Maybe she held my container up to the a/c as she rushed it to me. Who knows. I know my food had no trace of warmth at all. <br><br>My drink&#39;s ice had already melted, I&#39;m guessing it was poured early on and sat there and melted? So I had half and half soda and water. That wasn&#39;t cold either. <br><br>All of this leads me to believe that this is a serious management issue. Either they were very busy and understaffed or they have not properly trained staff to carry out basic restaurant duties to efficiently get a single entree out in under an hour.<br><br>Yes, I get this is a popular place with hundreds of guests an hour. I totally understand that my food was not the only food that was prepared that day. Quantity should not affect quality though. Properly staffed and trained and even the busiest of restaurants will work like a well oiled machine. I&#39;ve been in the restaurant industry 21 years and I can ascertain what went wrong.

We typically love the Cheesecake Factory. Tonight we had quite possibly the worst service we&#39;ve ever had while dining. Customer satisfaction is clearly not a priority at this restaurant - and it comes from the top down.<br><br>My husband&#39;s filet mignon was almost entirely fat - it was mostly inedible. His entree was served with the incorrect side, which was so undercooked the vegetables were basically raw.<br><br>He ordered hot tea with honey and lemon and was served a cup of hot water. He had to track down the waiter to obtain a tea bag. Then, when he requested a second cup of tea. The waiter, reused the same tea bag, did not provide fresh lemons and did not include honey. <br><br>We waited nearly 20 minutes for our check. The waiter rarely checked on our table. The waiter passed our table after our meal was finished and then did not return until I asked the hostess to track down our waiter for the bill. When he arrived he did not offer us dessert - and let&#39;s be honest, the only reason you go to the Cheesecake Factory is for dessert - and he did not acknowledge or apologize for the delay. He literally said nothing and left the check on the table.<br><br>We don&#39;t typically complain or send food back, but at the end of the meal we asked the hostess if we could speak to the manager. The hostess said he would get her attention. After the hostess spoke to the manager, she immediately walked past us. My husband had to stop her and ask to speak to her. He was polite and she apologized. It did not seem sincere as she did not even inquire as to who our server was nor did she offer to remedy the situation whatsoever. Her apology seemed apathetic and insincere, like she knew we were tourists and would not return regardless of her response/actions. <br><br>Highly dissatisfied.

If you&#39;re eating at Cheesecake Factory you already know what you&#39;re getting into. Ate here this weekend and was pleasantly surprised at the service and food. Of all the Houston locations, I like this one the most.<br><br>Service was quick and food was actually pretty good. We ordered Mac cheese, burger, and pot pie. You can skip the pot pie but the max and cheese was pretty good. Not too cheesy. The best item we got was the Korean fried cauliflower, really delicious!

Three solid stars for this restaurant. Why three? It&#39;s a chain restaurant and felt like a normal Cheesecake Factory experience. <br><br>We walked in on a Sunday afternoon to order a slice of Tiramisu. It was packed in here! There were guests waiting for a table near the entrance and guests in line at the to go counter. Once we ordered it was quick to get our $9 dollar specialty dessert slice of Tiramisu cake. The cake was good. Just enough moisture to not be soggy and the side of whip cream was enough. The ground chocolate was yummy! Sorry no pic of the Tiramisu slice as we devoured it.<br><br>Hats off to the folks working the counter. They answer phones, get slices for guests dining in and complete the orders for the to go consumers or delivery services (Postmates). They are good at multitasking there!

Yesterday, I ordered through takeout, the chicken Madeira and steak Diane as well as the Herb crusted Salmon. We were very disappointed and to be fully honest, with the little we ate, ended up with stomachaches.<br>The asparagus was hard and cold. I&#39;m not sure if it was baked or fried. Either or, it was not good. The steaks were not well done as we ordered, more like medium rare. The salmon and the chicken were not completely cooked. <br>Whether it was the chef, being takeout, or whichever is the excuse, we will never order takeout from here again. It was a waste of my money, time, and it ruined the rest of my evening.
They&#39;re service is terrible .. and there is too many GNATS ! Never plan on returning. We spoke to the manager was not understanding when we told him about how we felt .

I went in for dinner on a Friday evening with a friend and there was no wait so that was good.<br><br>I ordered the spicy chicken chipotle. I was in on time for the lunch special I&#39;ve decided to grab the full-size cuz I like to have leftovers. I really love this dish! It was absolutely perfect just like every single time I order it.<br><br>My friend had the orange chicken with brown rice. he said it was amazing as well.<br><br>For dessert we ordered the key lime mango cheesecake. It was amazing!<br><br>aside from a long wait time during peak hours being a bad experience, hi normally never have a bad experience when it comes to food in this place.<br><br> I will definitely be back over and over again if it keeps up like this.

Came here for a late Christmas Eve brunch. I really appreciate the feel of this restaurant. It&#39;s casual yet well put together at the same time. <br><br>I ordered the egg roll sampler and the chicken samosas. They&#39;re both technically appetizers, but together they were more than enough for me. The sampler is basically one of each of their egg rolls. The cool part is that they let you trade one out for a roll that you enjoy more, so I traded the Cuban egg roll for another Tex Mex. it was a great decision. The rolls were delicious, and they paired well with the sauces that accompanied them. You get four large egg roll for $11. The samosas were also super good. You get four good-sized ones for $7. <br><br>My sister got enchiladas with black beans, and she seemed to like it a lot. My mom ordered the pineapple chicken and shrimp wth rice. She doesn&#39;t like eating out that much, but she said that she enjoyed the meal.<br><br>The service was the best part of the outing. Our waitress, Alexis, was amazing! She had a great, amicable personality and was very helpful. She kept the free bread coming as well and checked on us often. Definitely one of the best servers I&#39;ve ever encountered.

First time to Houston- walked over from my hotel for their brunch.<br><br>i ordered the brûlée&#39;d french toast and the eggs with the home fries and english muffin. <br><br>i was seated by a pleasant hostess, but that and the taller big white guy who ended up as a server after the short pregnant girl with the tattoos on her arm and wrist was switched to the back, as he stated. <br><br>the service was slow and not attentive from the beginning and a couple got their order put in and ate by the time i got my water and they came after me. Food comes, and i asked for butter and ketchup, oh and some extra syrup and it never came from those who took the request and they walked back pass me several times. the &#34;new&#34; server came and brought it after he walked by a couple times and asked if i was ok, which i thought was odd and nice since he wasn&#39;t my server at the time. the french toast wasn&#39;t cooked all the way, everything else isn&#39;t hard to make and was ok. i guess i should have chose a non chain restaurant to eat at. This was a waste of time and money

Honestly, I have never liked Cheesecake Factory any of the times I&#39;ve been and I&#39;ve been sure to try a different dish every time to give them the benefit of the doubt. Their take on simple dishes from fish tacos to gumbo to simple Chinese inspired dishes are just overwhelming in flavor and not in a good way. Either it&#39;s intensely salty or another extreme. I had the crispy chicken and shrimp in pineapple sauce today and it was just way too strong in flavor. My sister and I ordered the same dish and she couldn&#39;t even bring herself to take more than 3 bites. Asked if she wanted it to go and she said &#34;if I didn&#39;t like it here I&#39;m not going to like it at home.&#34; <br><br>Also our waitress was talking and cursing at about something behind us. Weird experience.

What can I say? Good food and good cheesecake. I had a really nice waiter, I didn&#39;t get his name but it was the black guy with gray/green eyes. Really good service and good food. As good as it can get for a chain restaurant.

The food was very well and the portions where pretty sizable in my opinion. Personally the food took way too long to come out, and my waitress was barely around for refills and other items requested. The food was good, warm but the whole service experience was not the best. Really wish i didn&#39;t have to have a whole meal and be in there for close to three hours all together. All in all, food is good, sizable, but it might take a while for you to receive any help or food in time.

I don&#39;t have 1 complaint for a change ! <br>Awesome atmosphere and drinks, I have learned not to come during the day when they are short staffed and have the worst waiters ever, instead I come for happy hour or late night drinks at the downstairs bar where I am treated like a queen! <br>The cosmopolitans are good and strong and the menu after a few drinks looks like heaven ! <br>I like places when you understand the times, you will pull your hair out during the day, but let it down at night !<br><br>Enjoy ask for Jahi, he will make you a TRUE cosmo, I get like I was in NYC again ! <br><br>See ya soon Cheesecake, only late night and downstairs !

We have ate at this Cheesecake Factory location for dinner previously. It was dinner rush and the staff made sure guests were seated in a timely manner. The hostess was friendly. The restaurant was clean and neat.Our server was friendly and attentive. The have a bar and our drinks were brought out quickly.The server took our orders and our food came out hot and fresh. Sometimes I make modifications to my entree and my entree was made exactly as I asked. Our to go order are made fast.

Went in for lunch yesterday. Ordered the Skinnylicious Turkey Burger. This burger may have been low in calories but it was off the chart in flavor. Had the right balance of toppings and was cooked perfectly. Service was adequate. Overall it was a pleasant dining experience

Can&#39;t go wrong with cheesecake. This location is a little trick to get to and the parking is confusing but the service is very friendly. <br><br>I&#39;m so glad they&#39;re open late. One of the few places close to where I live that closes after 11 pm.<br><br>I had the Asian salad from the skinnylicious menu. It was good and filling. Didn&#39;t have room for awesome cheesecake. Although my favorite one is the tuxedo one. Chocolately but not too much.

Stopped in for a quick lunch before work! Fast, friendly, and attentive! Patrick was my server. He was awesome! I told him I had to eat and run! Food came out less than 10 minutes for two skinny dishes. <br><br>Beet &amp; goat cheese salad &amp; shrimp spring rolls.  Not my Mommas spring rolls but very Americanized. Lots of veggies and noodles. The dip is Amazing!!! I loved it! I think it&#39;s Americanized peanut sauce. That&#39;s how it taste. <br><br>Enjoyed CheeseCake Galleria!

Disappointed and shocked. My husband and I visited Baybrook location and our glasses were dirty! Fingerprints and lipstick on them! When I mentioned to waiter he said he wasn&#39;t surprised. Couldn&#39;t believe especially during these times with Covid this restaurant was not cleaning the way they should. Also when they clean tables waiter used same gloves to clean and serve food. It use to be a fav place of mine don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be back.

I love coming to this place the food is good and the service as well but today it was the worst service ever out server was LAUREN C first I ask her if we could get some bread she said yes after 30 minutes she went to tell us that they didn&#39;t have any bread but we seen a waitress taking bread to other tables then when they brought me my food they drop my drink all over me and they only thing they did was take me napkins like that was going to solve the problem, my daughter pasta with marinara was hard I would not recommend this place after this service .

We very much enjoy dining at this Cheesecake Factory. However, we ordered two entrees and hired Doordash for a total cost of $60. We did not receive the sides and called the store immediately after delivery to try to receive the food. We spoke to three different people and finally hung up after being placed on hold for over 20 minutes. My advice is to go in-person to dine and not to order take out.

Horrible pick up experience. Ordered online and there was an issue with their communication issue. Manager then said he would put a high priority on the order and would be done in about 15 minutes. Ended up taking 30 minutes and they don&#39;t verify the order because they forgot 5 items. I then asked for some bread since the hey provide that before the meal in the restaurant and she said there was some in the bag. When I looked, they only gave me a section of bread enough for one person to eat when my to go order had 7 entrees.

Francisco is an incredible manager.  He was supportive to the staff on this busy Saturday.  Even when he was treated rudely by the table across from us he still provided excellent customer service.  From picking up finished plates, getting drink refills, bringing bread and checking in with the staff to stopping by the tables to see if anything else was needed.  <br><br>The food was great, the service was awesome and as a long time CF visitor this location did not disappoint!<br><br>Thank you to Francisco for not allowing us to feel the impact of the jam packed restaurant.

I ordered from here through DoorDash and at some point I will go in here and have a meal. The Cheesecake factory is a great place to go for date night because there is something here for everybody! I ordered their spicy Jamaican shrimp as it is my 2nd favorite after the barbecue chicken salad. I wish the plantains were cut a little smaller and fried harder but the shrimp were plentiful and juicy! The spice level could go up but it was tasty nonetheless! I also had a piece of chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake which is really, really good! Creamy cheesecake fillled with chocolate chips, walnuts, and cookie dough! Yum!!

I ordered from DoorDash and it was SO NOT worth the money. Skimpiest kids meals I&#39;ve ever seen, every menu item was super overpriced and just not fulfilling or quality. I definitely won&#39;t be ordering from here again. Perhaps it&#39;s better in store, or maybe if you are just going for dessert, but as for a meal, not worth the price.

Very disappointed in the service this evening. While our waitstaff was friendly, there was a delay being seated as they lost our reservation. Once we ordered two people were served their main meal before the other was even served her dinner salad. One manager came by and said one meal was delayed by a few minutes. 20 minutes later the burger came out and it was not even cooked as ordered. The next manager offered to have something else made but everyone else was through by that point.  Comped one meal but still paid for iced tea and left with only having bread to eat. The entire experience took over 75 minutes from being seated to leaving. There were no drinks to wait on, nor were there desserts... just three simple meals.  Very disappointed.

Went for weekend brunch while back-to-school shopping with the kiddos.  We got there around 1:45 and brunch is over at 2, so we asked the waiter to hurry and put in an order for Chicken &amp; Waffles (minus the benedict) for starters.  The waffle was rock hard and burnt, the chicken was over-crispy and hard.  Never again will I order this entree&#39; near the end of brunch, gross.  The syrup had no flavor, it was just oil (or butter idk) and it coagulated once it sat a few mins which is disgusting.<br><br>I usually eat at The Cheesecake Factory regularly and have visited this location only a couple of times, but this was the 1st I went for brunch.  Not feeling their brunch or the Galleria location.  We had a great spot for people-watching though.  <br><br>Wait time was minimal (less than 5 mins) and it was pretty packed on a Saturday.  The restaurant is 2 stories so there&#39;s plenty of seating.

Above and Beyond!!! Tiny Hannah K (there&#39;s 2 lol) is literally the best waitress at cheese cake factory! She&#39;s so sweet and attentive to her customers. I have had the pleasure of having her twice and it was been phenomenal service both times! Ask for her when you come to have a great service!
This may be one of the best restaurants that I have ever been to! I would come again and tell my friends about it! Ask for Demi, she&#39;s tall and blonde! ;)

So I know it&#39;s not a culinary star stop, but I haven&#39;t had a cheesecake I didn&#39;t like there!  I just love their lettuce wraps (app) as my meal.  It&#39;s a great casual place to meet up with friends/family and count on tasty treats and bites.  The drinks are a-ok too.  sometimes I just want the comfort an consistency of a chain-for me, they&#39;ve never failed.  The menu is SO EXTENSIVE, there is something for everyone.  Weeknights aren&#39;t crowded at all, so that&#39;s the time to go.

I love coming to Cheesecake Factory every time I&#39;m in town. The food and service is always great. Although my service was just as great this time around, I did come across an inconvenience. As I was using my butter knife to apply butter on my bread, I noticed it was dirty and still had food from previously being used. It was very disturbing as it made me not want to eat my food anymore. My waitress was very kind about the situation and immediately brought me a new knife. No manager came to check on us or apologize which I think a situation like this should be addressed since it is due to sanitation purposes. Oh well. Will just have to be extra careful if I&#39;m ever in town again.

I&#39;ve been here a few times now and I&#39;ve liked the service every time! I ordered the Chicken Riesling and it was very light and delicious. My friend ordered the Chicken Parmesan-Pizza style it was also very flavorful. I recommend this place if you&#39;re in the Galleria area.

So I feel kinda Bad leaving this two star review because I&#39;ve been to cheesecake many times and had a great meal start to finish. This review by no means is representative of the average experience there, but I just felt I had to share this in hopes that management sees this and does something about this mango situation they have going on. Last night I ordered the grilled chicken, avocado, and mango salad, and was SORELY disappointed by its quality. The dressing was whack af and the mango had something seriously wrong with it. I&#39;ve never had mango I didn&#39;t like before, but this shit honestLy didn&#39;t even taste like mango. It&#39;s obviously frozen and thawed out but something must have gone wrong in this process because that shit was straight up NASTY. I also have felt queasy today and I can&#39;t help but think that messed up mango had something to do with it. Mango has always been mY favorite fruit but just the thought of it is enough to make me nauseous  right now because of my experience last night. I love Cheesecake Factory and theY have many great dIshes but that salad needs to go. If they don&#39;t want to straight up get rid of it, they need to switch up that dressing and start using fresh  mango. For almost twenty dollars you would thiink it wouldn&#39;t kill them to invest a little in some fresh produce that would actually resemble the fruit it&#39;s supposed to be. You can do better Cheesecake Factory... please fix this <br>I am actually at the granny luxe cafe right now o because I  needeD to renew my faith in this company. It&#39;s working. This red fish is amazing. Ain&#39;t trying to go back to cheesecake until they fix this salad.

Want to hear a funny, but really not funny review? Want to experience the hilarity of this review? Just go the Cheesecake Factory Galleria location! <br><br>My mom and I decided to meet one day for lunch here. It&#39;s a rare occasion, so we were pretty excited about the time to spend enjoying lunch.<br><br>I got to the restaurant first, and pretty early. I was sitting outside the restaurant in the small waiting area and a manager (I got his name, and I want to say that it was David, but *disclaimer* that might be totally incorrect, however that is what I will call him for the sake of this review. Either way, he was bald, about 5&#39;11&#34;, and light skinned with an accent.) approached me and asked me &#34;can I help you?&#34; Sort of arrogantly. I said &#34;no&#34; just as arrogantly back. He looked at me like he was offended, and I thought to myself, &#34;well, I&#39;d be offended too.&#34; But I kept that thought to myself and told him &#34;I&#39;m waiting on someone.&#34;<br><br>While I was waiting, I noticed there was a gift card promotion going on - buy a gift card, get a free cheesecake. I approached the host stand to ask about it, but all I was able to say was &#34;I have a question about the gift card promotion.&#34; Before the hostess cut me off, and pointed to the to go counter and said &#34;Gift cards that way.&#34; And went back to tapping away on her little host screen. <br><br>I begrudgingly went to the to go counter and got my answer about the gift cards, went back outside to sit, and waited for my mom. Once she got there, we went inside and were greeted by a much nicer hostess who walked us to our table. <br><br>Our server, Tony, came and greeted us after a few minutes of us sitting there. He was a good server, I want to emphasize that. It wasn&#39;t his fault about what happened next. <br><br>He brought us butter and bread. Frozen butter. And cold bread. We were cool with the cold bread, but my mom couldn&#39;t handle the frozen, unspreadable butter so she sent it back. When tony returned with the 2nd butter, it too, was frozen. She handed him back the butter, and the 3rd time he brought it, it was finally melted enough to spread.<br><br>Then my mom received her coke. She could tell by tasting it that it was Diet Coke. She pulled Tony aside and asked him why he&#39;d brought her a Diet Coke, and he said &#34;how can you tell?!&#34; Wow. Anyways, he went to the kitchen and came back a few minutes later to apologize to her and explained that &#34;someone&#34; in the kitchen had switched the connections between the coke nozzle and Diet Coke nozzle but that it was being fixed. He brought her a new coke once the machine was corrected. It was flat. 100% broke-down, on the side of the road, flat. <br><br>We called over the manager, David, and he seemed like we disturbed him from his very busy shift. He nodded and acted interested while my mom told him about our experience thus far. He didn&#39;t apologize, he made excuses. While we was making excuses to my mom, I was observing him, and I noticed something strange: he had on a rubber bracelet- the kind that are given out at events with words printed on them. His said in big bold white letters &#34;Don&#39;t be a little b*tch!!!&#34; <br><br>I interrupted his excuses and said to him &#34;Nice bracelet.&#34; I&#39;ve never seen someone go so rigid and panicky as they came to the realization of their error. He slowly reached down to this wrist and turned the bracelet inside out. He nodded and remained speechless for the first time in minutes. I told him I&#39;d once worked in the restaurant industry for quite some time, and that his behavior and presentation was completely unacceptable. He asked me &#34;oh yeah? What restaurant?&#34; Again, no apologies. He changed the subject to something that was irrelevant, and then he excused himself from the table. <br><br>At the end of our meal, when Tony dropped off the check, I put my debit card in the check presenter. David came by quickly, took my debit card out, slid it towards me, and said &#34;Sorry it didn&#39;t go so well today.&#34; And as he was walking off refusing to make eye contact with me, I heard him mutter &#34;maybe next times better.&#34;<br><br>I&#39;m sorry, but paying for my food doesn&#39;t make me forget about the bracelet or the experience. This review needs to be seen by corporate, and that manager needs to be reprimanded and written up. That&#39;s all there is to say about that.
Signature with an Outstanding class, been to different Cheesecake Factory locations and they do a great job.

We stopped in to do a post dinner dessert option because I was really craving cheesecake. No wait, sat at the upstairs bar and enjoyed Grand Marnier and Turtle Cheesecake.<br><br>Our drinks were fair in portion and the cheesecake was absolutely fabulous. I love how many options they have for desert. Lucia, our bartender was very busy with drinks but luckily we aren&#39;t needy and knew exactly what we needed. She chatted with us for a little while and enjoyed each other&#39;s company. <br><br>The only reason I&#39;m leaving 3 stars is because of all of the disgusting fruit flies. I mean it was ridiculous, so bad we had to move down a few seats. At one point, there was one in my cake! How disappointing. I won&#39;t let that affect my visits here in the future, but advice to management - that issue needs to be corrected immediately.
Great place. Food took longer than usual but great service and food. <br><br>If you are in the galleria I suggest this place.

I wish I could give this restaurant zero stars. We were visiting from Dallas and decided to go eat here. It was our first time at a Cheesecake Factory, and we had high hopes for it. The waitress was very kind, but she forgot to come get our order. There was people around that arrived after us, and was already eating. The food was stale and our fries were almost raw. The bread was completely inedible, it was so hard and rubbery. We almost broke our jaws trying to bite it, but we were starving. By the way, the brought in the bread twenty mins of us being already seated. Also, the waitress forgot to refill my strawberry lemonade, and she literally asked me if I wanted a refill when we asked for to go boxes. What really infuriated us was this.... THERE WAS A CRITTER IN MY CHEESECAKE! And this is the type of critter that doesn&#39;t fly... makes me wonder how it got there... This was such a horrifying experience... By the time the check rolled around, we were too tired of waiting so long and having been there so long that we didn&#39;t bother to complain to the manager, even though all they did was take off the cheesecake from the bill... even though it makes me wonder what goes on in their kitchen and how dirty it must be.... customers... be aware....

This is my first visit ever to a cheesecake factory restaurant. I can say the ambience was beautiful. The service was pretty good and his food was decent. I wasn&#39;t impressed like I thought I would be but overall it was a OK restaurant the food was Priced decently so I won&#39;t complain about that the bathrooms could have been nicer oil cleaner but overall it was OK again I don&#39;t know if I would want to come back though
Awesome service &amp; good food. Short wait time!!! Fried macaroni was awesome!!!! Great waiter!

Love Cheesecake Factory! Been here numerous time, finally getting a chance to write a review. Let&#39;s just say you Can never go wrong with this place... great variety of food on the menu. You can bring big group and don&#39;t have to worry if everyone will enjoy the food. There is different cuisines on the. Sub that they offer. So really can&#39;t go wrong!!! I have tried their Avocado egg rolls, burgers, and my favorite dish is the bang bang chicken and shrimp. It&#39;s a Thai inspired dish which has a very good flavor . Last but not least the CHEESECAKE....  so good! Even if I don&#39;t have space for dessert, I always get it to go. My favorites are the  turtle, Godiva, dulce de leche and tuxedo chocolate!

Never order this from DoorDash when Cheesecake Factory has a promo going on!! Waited 4 hours to get my food. The driver wait 3.5 hours to get my order from them. Couldn&#39;t even enjoy my lunch because I had to leave for the day. Waste of my money. <br><br>Btw Cheese Cake factory, I got my free slice but I ordered at 11:20am and didn&#39;t get my order until 340pm. Is that acceptable on your side?

What a mess. First time at the Cheesecake Factory and it was absolutely horrible. From the Women&#39;s restrooms overflowing to the terrible service.. please avoid and go somewhere else! Plenty of better options at the Galleria.<br><br>First, the toilets in the Women&#39;s restroom were overflowing. Had to go out into the mall to use the restroom. Our waiter forgot our appetizer and we asked multiple times where it was and he said he was going to check on it (it was just spinach dip..) Eventually we told him to forget about it because we were already done with our entrees and were ready for dessert. Manager was also not familiar with the Slice of Joy promo from Black Friday so waste of time and money trying to explain it to him lol. Never again!
Our server Mariah P was great. If she wasn&#39;t i would&#39;ve given her the business lol. So I have to give credit where credit is due.

NOT Cheesecake Factory standards<br>My co-worker and I ordered all the way from the Med Ctr. We were looking forward to celebrating an accomplishment with a nice lunch. Order was wrong, sauces not included, fries were cold and the worse part- they forgot the cheesecake! But ofcourse charged us for everything. This is definitely not the standards I am used to when dining at the Cheesecake factory. Called the restaurant to allow them the opportunity for service recovery and they failed at that as well. Nothing could be done...<br><br>Really? There is always something that can be done. You just chose not to. My reviews are always positive and highlight the good, but this was just utterly disappointing. Will not be back at this location.

I&#39;ve been coming to this Cheesecake Factory since high school and I graduated in 2007  I&#39;ve never had a bad experience and the waiters are always on point. The food is always good and I just love this location.  <br>Plates of choice would be the chicken chipotle pasta, the chicken and biscuits, the avocado egg rolls, the jambalaya pasta, and the Cuban sandwich. Those are a few.

Maybe I&#39;m just not a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. The food is overrated just like the entire restaurant. Over priced for no reason other than the great cheesecake. The only reason i gave it two stars is because of the cheesecake and how good it is other than that the food here sucks.

Never been to the Houston Galleria CF - oversight on my part. My wife and I had a big dinner planned for later, so we were looking for a tasty cocktail and appetizer. FOUND. Wife ordered a LOVED a drink called Whiskey Smash, while I really enjoyed a Long Island Iced Tea with spicy chicken nachos. Yummy.<br><br>We really enjoyed the second (or lower) floor of the restaurant, since to top floor was rather hectic and loud - good for the younger set (which we ain&#39;t).<br><br>Great service, decent prices, fun place to go - especially if you love cheesecake!

Food was 4-5 star.<br>Service 2 star (being nice to server).<br><br>My friend and I decided to meet up here for dinner in Houston.  It was during the work week and I arrived at 7pm.  The restaurant was about 1/3 full.  Upon arriving the pleasant male host seated me in a nice booth and got my server.  I ordered the complimentary bread with lots of butter.   My friend arrived by 7:15 which at that time she also asked for pumpernickel or the brown bread.  We ordered our drinks and my fave fried avocado egg rolls as an app with an unique Asian flavored dipping sauce 4.5 star.<br><br>We asked several times to 3 people at least about our bread.  It finally arrived 1 hour later at 8pm, after I first ordered it from our server.  Freakin 1 hour!!!  Is there a bread shortage in this restaurant or did our server want a smaller tip??<br><br>We wanted to sit, talk and catch up but it would of been nice to have some food!  <br><br>I ordered my fave Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp with white rice.  It&#39;s like an Asian fusion entree complimented with coconut, crumbled peanuts, green onions and an Asian peanut sauce...5 stars!<br><br>My friend ordered the American hamburger and fries and would order it again so I guess 4 stars for that entree.  <br><br>I got a slice of the Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cheesecake to go also...4.5 star.  <br><br>They had 2 large cases of cheesecakes of all different kinds from basic to very unique.  They also had about 3 10&#34; tall cakes if you wanted a large slice of cake.<br><br>The menu is still large with so many apps and entrees to please just about everyone.  If you need to charge your phone there is no plug available in the bar area.  There was one available on our floor in another area but you would need at least a 4 ft extension cord.  Just FYI.  <br><br>We had to wait to pay also.  It started getting real annoying because it was going on 3 hours.  Whenever I go to a Cheesecake Factory the food has always been real good but the servers are almost always slow or disorganized.<br><br>Parking is free underneath.  <br><br>Yelp Review #361

If i could give zero stars i would, stay away from here. Food is bland. They dont serve the bread right away like they used to, i had to ask several times before the waitress brought it in. I asked for lunch portion of my Salmon and they charged me for a full order. The appetizer i ordered came after my food came. Just terrible service. Period

Solid 3 stars. Everybody knows this place, and it&#39;s super popular. <br><br>For those of you who don&#39;t: the portions here are HUGE, for starters. The menu is massive, and you&#39;ll feel trapped because there is always at least something else you want to try. The cheesecake is divine, per its reputation and name. The food is average, sometimes dips below. I think it&#39;s more that this place is family friendly and the portions are enormous that it&#39;s so popular. Also, the drinks are pretty average. <br><br>I think this is a great place to go in a clutch, when you feel too lazy and just want a casual place to go to, especially if you&#39;re in the area. Very convenient, but service is pretty slow bc it&#39;s always crowded and so popular.
Food never goes wrong here. I feel like you can order anything from the menu and there is never a miss. Cheesecakes are always a must here.

I should hate the Cheesecake Factory. The food is the absolute epitome of corporate chain fare, the atmosphere is perfect for where you&#39;re most likely to find them - in or next two a major shopping mall - and you will never encounter a cocktail that hasn&#39;t been carefully planned and focus-tested at the bar.<br><br>But when you have a waiter as enthusiastic as ours who does such a good job, and the rest of the place holds up its end of the bargain ... I just can&#39;t help it. I can justify it under the mediocrity principle,* since one of the reasons chains became popular in the first place is poor quality control among independent restaurants in the pre-McDonald&#39;s era. If you have never been to a Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ll probably think it&#39;s fine, and if you&#39;re a return customer, you already know if you&#39;ll like it or not.<br><br>This is an excellent Cheesecake Factory judged on its own terms, and the staff are great. I&#39;ll vote for a million other spots in Houston, but I&#39;ll say yes every time someone else wants to come here.<br><br>* ref. Dave Barry&#39;s &#34;Mr. Mediocre&#34; restaurant chain idea.
Food was excellent and service was great! Jesus was an excellent waiter. Restrooms were clean and everyone had a smile on their face.

I love this location and the food is always amazing. Service depends on the time of day you come. But overall there is so much to choose from the menu that no matter who you with you are guaranteed to satisfy every pallet. Usually order for the Madera chicken or the Cobb salad and of course to finish it off with a Godiva cheesecake<br>Today the service was slow and a waitress never came back to check up on up also forgot to give us utensils. But I guess she was a little bit too busy... but she was super super sweet so she made up for it

The Skinny Chopped Salad and the service I received here on my last visit have made this place more of a 4 than a 3 for me.<br><br>I absolutely adore that they have a skinny menu, and their chopped salad is plentiful and delicious and for less than 600 calories. I seriously do not see how you can go wrong. The price is a bit steep for a salad, but I seriously crave this one and their dressing. And since we&#39;re being good, we can splurge on a slice (or 3) of the pumpernickel bread.<br><br>Onto the service, the last time I came I was out to lunch with my team, and we were in a rush. My supervisor ordered the salmon, my co-worker a pasta dish, and I of course ordered my salad. When the pasta and salad came out, the waiter told us that the salmon was not placed due to a mistake in the back, but he apologized profusely and offered to bring her a soup to keep her waiting. She agreed and took the tortilla soup, and after this, the manager stopped by to also apologize and make sure she got something to eat while she was waiting.<br><br>She enjoyed the tortilla soup, and the salmon came not too long after, and the waiter knew we were in a rush so he brought us all to-go containers and bags ahead of time. Every restaurant has mistakes happen, and Cheesecake Factory demonstrated EXACTLY how every restaurant should handle every mistake and delay in service to keep customers happy and coming back.<br><br>I&#39;ll happily be back, although it&#39;s worth noting that this, like all stores in the Galleria, gets super crowded at peak times, so plan accordingly.

I came to this Cheesecake Factory because I checked into a nearby hotel and wanted something easy and quick...I found neither to be true of this location. The restaurant had a few tables eating here and there...but the staff was handling it as if this were a soft opening on Bar Rescue. I stood downstairs for about 5 full minutes...all while the servers diverted their eyes so as not to make eye contact. I then see a sign instructing patrons to go to the second floor. <br>I approached the host/hostess stand and it was a bit of chaos..two or three people working to seat a party in front of me, no biggie I will wait. I am told that somebody will be right there. When a gentleman arrives to (I am assuming) seat me he asks me how many in my party. I reply &#34;one&#34; to which he responds with&#34;We do not have any tables available&#34; and he instructs me to go ...downstairs (where I had been previously). When I brought this to his attention, he greeted the party behind me (two people) and then he tells me that he can seat me. <br><br>At this point I left.

Attempted to dine at this establishment Sunday 9/1/2019 around 3:00pm<br><br>Arrived with a group of 7 or a birthday dinner, waiting longer than 30 minutes for drink order to be taken. <br><br>Decided to order drinks, appetizers, and main course all at the same time because we were not sure when the waiter would be back.<br><br>Received drinks (one drink tasted like mold), waited another 30 minutes then asked the waiter to check on the appetizers. The response was &#34;What were you&#39;re appetizers?&#34;<br><br>Sorry, no one wants to wait for more than an hour to get appetizers or even someone to care about decent service. Restaurant was maybe 25% full at 3:00pm. We had to walk out and go somewhere else.
It was a rough night for service on our last visit, but management is engaged and took steps to make things right.  It is much appreciated.
I love this place I love  sweets so this is the perfect place to chose any cakeand enjoy with friends and family

Came for an early dinner recently after getting my husband&#39;s glasses at the mall. Our first time at a Cheesecake Factory and I couldn&#39;t believe how many items were on the menu! What a huge variety - the menu was like a book. <br><br>We both ordered fish and chips, with a fire roasted artichoke as an appetizer. The food was delicious! Especially the artichoke! Server was friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. Since then we&#39;ve ordered to-go and the food was great. Definitely on our list!

The worst location ever the manager walks around all night and when I tried to speak to him he&#39;s nowhere to be found. Everyone except one person in my party got their food and is done and she still hasn&#39;t gotten her dinner. The waitress has been sitting on her phone in the corner and never brought a refill back so ridiculous. I will not be back.

Decided to eat here after a day of shopping and really wish we didn&#39;t, for an empty place the service was slow as can be! I was looking to have happy hour drinks but they took forever just to bring us the first drinks. The appetizers we ordered were not fresh at all, when I got up to use the ladies room I couldn&#39;t believe the amount of paper on the floor, clogged toilets, no toilet paper on the rolls at all! It was just a very un pleasant experience.

Our waiter was the sweetest girl she was so attentive and would bring us refills when she saw we we&#39;re running low and she brought us only brown bread which we all appreciated cause we only like the brown bread. The food was also really good.

I seriously don&#39;t get the negative reviews here. Working in an office in the Galleria Tower, we come here quite often (because they have a burger that&#39;s ridiculously good,) and we ALWAYS have great service. Every time. <br><br>And what&#39;s up with the review that criticized the cheesecake menu, first saying the selection was great but then knocking it because &#34;one slice is way too much for one person.&#34; Seriously? That&#39;s why people share... or take leftovers home to enjoy later. How is that a BAD thing? And then she says that they&#39;re &#34;too flavored&#34; (wth?) and says that Luby&#39;s does it better? Ummmm... okay.<br><br>Look, this place became famous for their cheesecakes for a reason, so for anyone to criticize THAT here is just silly.<br><br>But back to MY experience... yes, they have a menu that is the War and Peace of restaurant menus. I&#39;ve said it before, if you&#39;re going out with a large group of picky people, this is a great choice, because everyone&#39;s bound to find something they like.<br><br>I, for one, return over and over again because they do a particular burger so well, it&#39;s the only thing I ever order: The Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger. I order it lettuce-wrapped, and it is divine. The well-seasoned burger is topped with two kinds of bacon, and it&#39;s nicely offset with the crispness of the lettuce, the tart juicy tomato, and I drizzle balsamic vinegar on it, which adds a zip that takes it to the next level. I can&#39;t even say it&#39;s the best thing on the menu, because I&#39;ve never ordered anything else, especially when it&#39;s THAT burger that brings me back ;)<br><br>If I could change one thing, I&#39;d improve the wine selection... it&#39;s remained the same for a while, and the could use a couple of good cabs.

The Cheesecake Factory is just what you expect. Large portions, prompt service, and cheesecake so good that you feel guilty if you don&#39;t finish your slice...which is often tempting. <br><br>My husband and I returned to The Cheesecake Factory for our 9 year dating anniversary, 9, I know! Our waitress, Artesia, turned to my husband and said, &#34;have you proposed yet?&#34; And, we both laughed and let her know we&#39;ve been married for a while now. Her sense of humor, hands-off approach, and cheery personality was just perfect for our mini-celebration.  <br><br>Since our anniversary fell on a Monday, we were surprised to see how busy it was! On a Monday! But, we couldn&#39;t get a booth in which to sit since they had closed off some sections.  <br><br>I ordered from their &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu and had their steak medallions with asparagus and potatoes. The steak wasn&#39;t the best, but I really wasn&#39;t here for the meat. <br><br>For dessert, we had the tuxedo cheesecake, and I felt the guilt kicking in when my stomach started to push back against the cake.  My husband jokingly reminded me that 9 years ago, we could each finish a slice. We are no longer that young and had to share a piece this time...and that was difficult.  <br><br>All that said, this place is great for a choosy guest, hungry kids, and those who prefer chains.
Thai lettuce wrap - A+++++....nachos, chicken avocado sandwich and BBQ salad C-<br>Service ok, but so disappointed with the food.<br>Would not return.
Honestly every time I go to the galleria, I make sure to stop by. I have yet to  have anything that I didn&#39;t like.

Just had lunch here. I knew I left my juul/ecig at my table for a fact. I dropped it and my boyfriend picked it up and put it on the table and I never grabbed it when we were leaving. Called 30 minutes later and they said no one has turned it in. Which means our server or bus person stole it. I would appreciate management reaching out about this because this is completely unnecessary. Lunch shift, I sat at a 2 person half booth half table with an African American server that was pretty quiet. Thank you.
Always good food. Second time at this particular one. The waitress was very friendly. My food tasted pretty good. The drinks were on point. It wasn&#39;t too crowded for a Friday night.

Was in the Houston area for a long Memorial Day weekend and the family ate there a few times! Great service and food. I&#39;ve been going to CF forever abs never tried the &#34;Lasagna Verde&#34; and it&#39;s absolutely amazing!

Nice appearance, restaurant has plenty of parking as directly within a mall. However, not impressed with menu selections / quality of food. Ordered the Factory Meatloaf, Sheppard pie, and Chicken wings as an appetizer. Everything felt slightly dry and definitely not the meal we we&#39;re expecting to enjoy especially for the price. The items were from lunch specials, and still basically $14 a plate for ground beef. The positive were the two cheesecakes we ordered to go, great selection on different delicious cheesecakes although each did cost over $7/$8 a slice. Would not return, if do, maybe for just dessert.

I only gave this review one star, because it would not allow me to submit it without clicking something.  I ordered from this restaurant via Door Dash.  They &#34;ran out&#34; of one of the food items and told the driver once he arrived.  They asked if I wanted to exchange the item and when I made a suggestion, they told me that I would have to go back through Door Dash.  The other food items were ready and would have been cold while I waited for this exchange item to be prepared.  <br><br>Once the driver arrived to deliver the food, another item (a piece of cheesecake) was missing from the bag.  Again, I called the restaurant and they told me to contact Door Dash.  This is the worst customer service that I have ever received from a Cheesecake Factory.  I will not visit this location, nor place another order for delivery from this restaurant.

Visited this location and was my first visit ever! The staff was wondeful , very pleasant,  professional, neat and courteous. The food was amazing! I had this cajun pasta and co-worker another pasta forgot what it was. Mine was great and boy it was a large portion. Came here fir lunch just before my flight back to Arizona. I really enjoyed food and service. I will be back when in Houston again. I  Wanted to try  cheesecake but no room for it maybe next time.Looking forward to my next visit!

WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!!! I love the Cheesecake Factory. This is my go to spot because I love cheesecake. I enjoy it so much that even when I travel I will go. This location however is awful and has completely turn me off.  The wait is always long and they never get my order right.

I was in the Galleria, desperate to have lunch and feed my baby. I couldn&#39;t get down to the food court because of multiple reasons that just got me super frustrated. I finally decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory! I sat in a hidden corner booth so I could feed my baby, and my server ended up being Tony. Tony was super sweet and attentive, filled up my water bottle, got me my food as fast as possible, and held the door open for me when I was done so I could get the stroller out. The food was great as always (the fried mac and cheese is so good) but this review is mainly for Tony!

Love this location Best to come in early in Friday since it does get packed fairly fast<br>They have great variety if you are a vegetarian . We always get great service <br>I especially like their skinny menu and usually order a salad with grilled salmon <br>So far live it here

This restaurant chain is always a great spot for friends to get together. No matter where I&#39;ve been in the US, the decor is spectacular, food is good and the facility is clean. <br><br>We were celebrating a coworker&#39;s birthday during work hours. The waitress got us in and out in a timely manner and was very attentive. I ordered the teriyaki chicken breast. The chicken was moist and flavorful. <br><br>The only drawback with this particular location is parking. You can spend 10 minutes looking for parking in the garage or you can pay to valet.

Ive always been a huge Cheesecake Factory fan because I order the exact same, simple meal every single time- pesto angel hair pasta. I had a birthday gift card to use so my fiancé and I decided to head out to the factory on a Thursday night. There was very few people in the restaurant and our waiter gave us a lot of attention because of this which was great! However, when my dishes arrived it was so soggy. Not just in texture but in appearance too. I took one bite and was immediately let down. I&#39;ve never had noodles that soggy. I chose to say something to the waiter and request a new meal- she was quick to respond and completely agree with me, which was appreciated yet I still feel the mistake should have been caught initially. It took about 15 minutes to get a new meal and it was cooked perfectly the second time. <br><br>My fiancé had an equally disappointing experiencing. He requested a medium rare steak that was definitely more raw than the former or the latter. He even got a stomach ache afterwards :( <br><br>Never met a Cheesecake Factory I didn&#39;t like but we won&#39;t be returning to this, despite the great service. <br><br>TL:DR- service is great but cooking was DANGEROUS.

Restaurant is in a great location, service &amp; food is really good. Sit at the bar, if you want to avoid the wait. Club sandwich &amp; fish tacos are really good. Great alternative to room service if your staying at the Westin. Restaurant is connected to hotel &amp; stays open late.

Finding a good place for lunch isn&#39;t a easy task especially if your located in the Galleria surrounded by so many great restaurants.  I personally like to go go with what I know.  I love enjoying lunch at the Cheesecake Factory is great.  I&#39;m pretty much a regular here and I love the ambiance here.  The restaurant is two levels. You can enter the restaurant from the second floor of the mall or you can park outside the mall and walk directly into the restaurant. The only parking next to the restaurant are Valet Parking or pay meter.  Me and a co worked came to enjoy a little lunch after helping volunteer at the George R Brown center during hurricane Harvey!  You can always count on this place not being overly crowded for lunch and being able to enjoy a great conversation with some really cool friends or family.  <br><br>I&#39;m a pasta lover and the Cheesecake Factory is the boss of all pastas!!!  I normally order the Cajun Jambalaya but I order the Louisiana Cajun Chicken pasta!!  It was delicious I&#39;m not a big fan of really spicy foods but the Cajun pastas here seems to be more Cajun spice rub more so than a spicy sauce..  <br><br>The Louisiana Cajun pasta was not spicy but did have a little kick not too much.  It comes with diced peppers (yellow and green) sautéed and mushrooms I order my pasta without the mushrooms because of food allergy. None the less it was perfect the chicken was lightly fried with a bit of crispy batter and the chicken was not dry at all.  <br><br>My meal was great, and my Pineapple Mojito was so good and just right!!! My only flaw and I&#39;ll make sure to tell my waiter the next time please! light on the mint!!!! Other than that this is the best place for lunch with friends.  The restaurant is clean, the waiters are familiar with the menu and everyone who works there seems to be happy and very friendly <br><br>Hope you get to do lunch here soon!!

Visited the Cheesecake Factory in the Galleria Mall with my mother. I would have to say that this has been the best Cheesecake Factory experience I have ever had. The food was good, but the service was even better. <br><br>Our server was Justin Cyrus, and was awesome on so many different levels. His service definitely overshadowed the food and cheesecake. Justin is so friendly and you can tell that he takes pride in his job and customers. Justin never missed a beat, our order was precise and he constantly checked to see how we were doing. He is very personable; being able to hold a conversation with his customers and he able to relate to his customers. I have been to the Cheesecake Factory in Chicago and did not receive service as this. <br><br>Justin is truly one of a kind. When you come in, please ask for Justin, he will make your Cheesecake Factory experience worth while. Justin is an excellent server with an awesome personality. Kudos to you Justin!

Bartender was not attentive at all my glass was dirty that my wine was in. Never got bread no refills... service left a lot to be desired so did the food it was mediocre at best. This is not a normal  Cheesecake Factory experience. Manager was behind the bar never checked on us and never asked if we where ok horrible customer service and they where not even that busy!

TBH This place is hyped up because if the location. Been here twice and the food just not of what I expected this past Friday I ordered the Louisiana&#39;s breaded chicken pasta <br>The chicken breast was dry and unseasoned the pasta taste like it was cool In oil no spices added. I had to asked the waiter for Alfredo sauce just to give it some sort of tanks and I was there for a graduation dinner and my friends father ordered steak and shrimp in the steak is very dry as well and the portions were large for that type of price but I want to go to Pappaudeaux my first time here I had the wings they were trying to be different and cook them another way but it wasn&#39;t tasty at all

For my first time coming to the Cheesecake Factory, I had pretty high expectations. Unfortunately, I was a bit let down by my experience here. For starters, the wait time to get seated was about 20 minutes, and between getting seated and receiving our food, we probably waited another hour, which wasn&#39;t ideal.<br><br>Moreover, the Tomato Basil Pasta I had was pretty disappointing. It came with grilled chicken and mozzarella, but in very small pieces and quantity. Instead of pairing with the pasta, I felt that the chicken and mozzarella pieces were drowning in a sea of bland penne and diced tomatoes. Again, the portion size was absolutely massive (I barely ate half of the dish), but bigger is not better if the flavour isn&#39;t there. <br><br>Luckily, their strawberry cheesecake saved the day! It was creamy, rich, and as delicious as I imagined it would be. The strawberries and whipped cream on top complemented it really well and made for a decadent dessert. If dinners had MVPs, this would be it. <br><br>In all honesty, I probably won&#39;t be coming back here again for their entrees. However, their cheesecake is pretty amazing and I&#39;ll be stopping by a Cheesecake Factory for dessert whenever I get the craving!

We are visiting from California and assumed that Cheesecake Factory will be an ok option for dinner. N.O. I think we got served leftovers from other customers food, but  I will start from the beginning.    <br><br>The waiter was rude and ignorant. He came to us after 20 minutes. When he brought our drinks he left so quickly I had not have a chance to ask him for milk and sugar for my tea. He brought our daughter &#39;s appetizer and again left extremely quickly, so we won&#39;t be able to discuss with him anything. When she&#39;s started to eat, instead of croutons she had French fries. She got read of them and tried to eat salad. <br><br>Our food, hibachi stake was an old skirt stake cooked under soy sauce. It was unevenly cut, some pieces are burnt, some are almost raw. It tasted fairly bad. But the waiter disappeared. He came to ask how was the food literally when we were completely done with it (whatever we could eat- we were extremely tired and hungry and didn&#39;t want scandal, so we ate what we could...).<br><br>Our daughter&#39;s fillet minion was the only thing that was freshly cooked, it was not minion cut, just a simple stake piece, burnt. But edible in comparison to the hibachi meat. Mushed potato was not mushed at all. <br><br>We tried to tell the waiter that the food was not ok, he graciously brushed us off with the desert menu. The cheesecake was good. The only thing that was truly enjoyable. Conclusion: avoid.

So yes, this is a chain and all but I&#39;d be lying if I said I didn&#39;t like it. This location especially. Something about the galleria one always brings nostalgia considering I&#39;ve been coming here for years. Both the service and the food never disappoints. The portions are large so I always share my entree. Cheesecake wise, they&#39;re supposed to be known for it but to be honest, it&#39;s just &#34;ok&#34;. I&#39;ve had better cheesecake and the variety of choices not only is overwhelming, but dilutes the quality of the cheesecake overalls Another downside is that if you&#39;re coming during dinner, expect to wait a bit.

I love this location. Keep in mind that it is busy all of the time. This is a two story cheesecake factory. The to go ordering as well as the cheesecake is located on the second floor. The hostess stand is also located on the second floor. Even though this location is very busy all of the time, if you place a to go order it will always take about 15 to 20 minutes which isn&#39;t bad. The staff is super nice and pleasant to work with. The food is super tasty and You can pretty much create whatever type of dish that you want to create. I chose the favorite pasta dish it has no meat but I switched out the mushrooms for broccoli and I also added the Creole sauce that comes on the Louisiana chicken pasta. I must say it is the absolute best pasta that I have ever had from cheesecake factory. I will be coming to this location and ordering again.

This is my first time here today. Loved it!! The restaurant is beautiful and elegant.  I ordered the tropical Tiki punch, bourbon and honey, Farfalle with chicken and Roasted garlic, mango, key lime cheese cake, and cappuccino.  My husband got the seared ahi tuna.  EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. Our waitress Tania T was on top of things. Polite and friendly.

Bad service, bad food. I was shopping with 2 friends in the galleria and called to get a table. Lady answering said sure we can have a table in 10 minutes. We walked from Macy&#39;s to TCF and no table. I said I called- answer was- rather tart- u are not in our system- we were told to wait 10 minutes. 10 minutes later we asked what was happening - we were told to wait by the stairs-- we should have walked down and out.. we did get a table after waiting some more. Our server, Tabatha- who was delightful-but she had a huge section. She Did her best but service was slow. 2 People order salads, 1 a burger- medium. Took 15-20 min and 2 of us get salads.  No burger in site- by the time we finish our salads the burger shows up- about 35 min after we ordered. Could not have been more well done- I go get the manager. A young man in a white shirt shows up, I don&#39;t think he was the manager, says I&#39;m sorry, do you want anything else? My friend is over it so she says no. He says ok and walks off. No attempt to remedy. Didn&#39;t care. Bill comes and they charge her for her ice tea. My salad was ok, but the other person who ordered An Asian salad had sliced chicken deli meat in it. When we left- out of all the tables we passed we saw 2 with food. All others had drinks and people eating bread. We will not go back- not enough staff, and a restaurant should manage to cook a burger right in less than 35 minutes. Disappointing- have had totally different experiences before here and in other cities.

This was my first time to try the cheesecake here,and I&#39;m so in love with it,I would love to go here everyday after dinner time(just kidding but it&#39;s true),the staffs are very friendly and well,I will come back very soon

Could a bartender be less friendly? Probably not. I used to come here to eat a lunch salad and swirl lemonade often (small bar area upstairs). Today, seemed my sitting down was an annoyance...no smile, how&#39;s your day, nothing. And she looked at me like I was crazy when I asked her for the combination strawberry-regular lemonade. Had to remind twice for bread. Food is always good, thus two stars.

Not sure what kind of aesthetic you&#39;re going for here. Too tacky to be glamorous but too many columns to be a typical restaurant. This is the girl that tries so hard to emulate the popular girls that she fails.<br><br>Of their namesake, you&#39;d think their cheesecakes would be good. I gotta say, the selection is great; there are at least 20 different cheesecakes you can choose from. But even one slice is way too much for one person to eat.
