Way too heavy, too flavored, seems cheap. Even Luby&#39;s does it better.<br><br>The food follows suit. Too rich and fatty. This is where you go if Shake Shack has lines that are too long. No, don&#39;t come here. Wait in line. Get yoself a burger, hunny.
Perfect. I enjoyed the brown bread they bring to the table. I ate some Jamaican shrimp something and it was soooooooooo good. The cook definitely did good with this one.

The Cheesecake Factory is on the decline when it comes to the food. The Cheesecakes are still their specialty and are great. But for my last two deliveries with DoorDash my food has arrived cold. Hopefully they can work out kinks and time management. I had Crispy Crab Bites, Thai Lettuce Wraps and Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake. The next time I had the jamacian chicken and shrimp with strawberry cheese cake.

First off, parking here is HORRIBLE, but it&#39;s the Galleria so what do you really expect? Second, this place always seems to be busy so it was no surprise that the service wasn&#39;t great. <br><br>Our waitress tried to attend to us as much as possible but the timing of the drinks/food was terrible. We were seated right away (that was a bonus) but we had ordered drinks and it took about 15-25 minutes for each drink to come out. The food timing was okay but we still had to wait a few minutes for our last party member to receive his meal. We split the chicken carbonara, which sadly wasn&#39;t too great. It was my first time trying it so we upgraded ($4) for the chicken and it wasn&#39;t anything special. Honestly that I don&#39;t even think there was a full breast in there, definitely NOT worth the $4 upgrade for chicken pieces. <br><br>We ordered two drinks (10.50 ea.), one chicken carbonara ($20+) and one cheese cake ($7+) so our bill was $53+ soooo...very expensive and food quality wasn&#39;t up to par (even using two gift cards lol). Overall, best part of the meal was the bread and the drinks.
The service was great and the staff was very courteous and friendly. The food was delicious, as well. Don&#39;t let the cheesecake menu overwhelm you though. Embrace it and enjoy!

I came here with some friends for a birthday dinner.  It was a ridiculously bad experience.  We were told there was a short wait and we&#39;d be seated in 15 minutes.  20 minutes later, we checked and were told we&#39;d be seated within another 15 minutes.  Another 20 minutes later (40 total), we checked in again and were told we&#39;d be seated shortly.  It was literally an hour-long wait.  We&#39;d told them we&#39;d go elsewhere if there was going to be too long a wait, but they never once had the courtesy to be honest with us.<br><br>They crammed the five of us into an awkwardly shaped table on the end of a curved half-booth that wasn&#39;t even big enough for four people.  We were cramped and service was slow, even though the restaurant didn&#39;t seem that crowded.  The server had little interest in taking care of us in a timely manner.  The food came out hot and tasted just fine, but the experience as a whole was just plain bad.  He ended up adding gratuity to the bill, probably because he knew we were pissed off and wouldn&#39;t be tipping well after the terrible service we received.  We were going to argue the added gratuity, but just paid it and decided that we&#39;d never come back.

Although they replaced my burger. the server asked &#34;do you think it&#39;s cause you got your burger medwell, it came out DRY?&#34; if I recall medwell is slight pink, not all the way well done and dry. And then she wants to stare at me and say &#34;what do you think I should do?&#34; Ummm perhaps address the issue to the manger and fix the problem??? This was probably the worst service i have ever received at a Cheesecake Factory...what a shame...

We decided to eat at this location and were seated in a corner table next to the kitchen where we did not receive menus nor service. We sat there waiting for some customer service that did not arrive. We left after 30 minutes of no service. Will not be returning!!!

WTF ?! Like how in the hell are y&#39;all still business. Like let me start off by saying how dumb it is to bring the whole table food SEPARATELY !!! Like we waited 10-30minutes waiting for each dish . The waitress kept coming back and saying it&#39;ll be out . And let me tell you It was annoying AS FUCK ! I&#39;m very aggravated at the fact that now they remake some of the dishes because they were COLD !!! Like now my pancake is cold . You guys think it&#39;s okay because you&#39;re in a mall . Well I&#39;m not buying that . I&#39;ll won&#39;t be returning no time soon.

Hey, boo! Yes, Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m talking to you! This is my place, chile! The food is overall good, it&#39;s usually a lively scene and service is good. <br><br>I first stumble across the CF when I was a 10 years old. I remember what I ordered, too. I had the Thai lettuce wraps for an app and the Jamaican black shrimp for an entree. (Yes, I was fancy). And now that I am 21*** I still love this place and frequent with family and friends.<br><br>My favorite apps are the avocado rolls, the aforementioned Thai lettuce wraps, and I use to enjoy the pot stickers-when it was on the menu. My favorite entrees are the Jamaican black shrimp, any of the pasta dishes, and the baked salmon.<br><br>My favorite dessert is the always dependable strawberry cheesecake and the sweet and velvety red velvet cheesecake. mmm, boy!<br><br>Now, I&#39;m keeping my review at 5 stars but, I have to admit, I&#39;ve had some bad meals here and there. But this is not high class fine dining, and I&#39;ve had many more good meal experiences than bad. So CF is still A-ok in my novella. :)<br><br>Oh, and that complimentary brown and sourdough bread is the <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbomb.org&amp;s=1347db2e7d3a9b93bbb4098eec475f1f484368c2ca71eb7ab3241db0dfebaa85" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">bomb.org</a>.<br><br>***objects in mirror may be older than they appear.

I just wanted to purchase a piece of cheesecake to go, so I went to the counter to do so. I was ignored by the servers when I entered the restaurant. I was standing right by the cash register. They saw me but didn&#39;t say anything to me for 5 minutes. After that amount of time I felt like an idiot for standing there and I left. What a waste of time. I probably didn&#39;t need the cheesecake anyway.

Ordered the pasta napoletana, to go, tonight.  When i got home i had received a big plate of pasta with various meats on top.  No sauce.  Just dry pasta, pepperoni and meatballs.  When i called cheesecake factory, i explained what had happened to find out if maybe i had misunderstood what i had ordered.  The pure dismissive nature of the person that answered the phone was horrendous.  <br><br>Me:  &#34;yes, i ordered your pasta napolatena and i had a question.  I received my order and i thought it came with a sauce on it.&#34;<br><br>Host:  &#34;ok?&#34;<br><br>Me:  &#34;sorry, im asking, does it usually have a sauce on it?&#34;<br><br>Host:  &#34;im not sure, let me check.  Yeah, it has a tomato sauce on it.&#34;<br><br>Me:  &#34;oh ok, because i dont think mine came with it.  Its just pasta with some meatballs and pepperoni on top.&#34;<br><br>Host: &#34;ok.&#34;<br><br>Me:  &#34;umm, ok.......well, i guess maybe you can let your chef know for quality control purposes?&#34;<br><br>Host:  &#34;ok, i will.&#34;  (Click) <br><br>So not only is my order missing a part of it, but i get crap service to follow it up.  But i get it.  Its Saturday night.  She probably just wanted to leave and didnt have time to do her job.

My favorite dish from the Cheesecake Factory is the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta (I added extra spicy). This dish taste better to me at the woodlands location than the galleria, the woodlands location dish seemed to have more flavor). Service is depending on your waiter. It seems that the management is not aware when some waiters need help (multitasking is not everyone&#39;s forte). Our drinks ran empty several times, the kids&#39; food order was placed incorrectly, but we didn&#39;t bother changing it (it took a long time just to get more napkins and drinks, not risking more wait time with hungry kids). The staff is nice, just need help.

Here for brunch and it&#39;s delicious. I got the bruleed French toast with bacon and the flavors are very nice. I didn&#39;t originally come for brunch so I paired it with a Mai Tai. Will probably return for brunch seeing as though they have a nice brunch menu selection.

Went in on a Saturday night to pick up some cheesecakes, and the place was extremely busy and loud, as expected. After the server took my order at the walk up register, we stood to the side watching them work and noticed that instead of packing up our cheesecakes, the server/cashier just stood around waiting for someone else to come up and order. <br><br>I get that there is an assigned person to pack up the stuff, but if you see that everyone else is busy, how about lend a hand and pack up some of your to-go orders so they don&#39;t have to wait so long. I&#39;m pretty patient, but if I see you standing around doing nothing while I&#39;m waiting for you to fulfill my order, that&#39;s going to annoy me a little. Also, I watched her as she realized we hadn&#39;t gotten our order yet, and it had been over 20 minutes. <br><br>She proceeded to fill the order herself, but as she did that, I saw that she licked her finger and used that to grab the wax/tissue paper that they use to grab the cheesecake from their trays. I&#39;m trying not to think about how there&#39;s contamination on my cheesecake since we waited so long and had to pay extra for parking just to get the stuff. So if you have an aversion to germs and other people putting their saliva on your food, maybe pay attention to your servers. Also, maybe avoid this lady in particular.

I will NEVER be back. I will make sure everyone that I know won&#39;t be back because they way were treated even after speaking to multiple managers was unacceptable. My fiancé and I have both worked in this business before and would never treat anyone the way we were treated Sunday. I was given raw food then nothing was done about it. The only thing that was done was the food was taking from my table and my check was brought. I paid for the food. But I spent 1 hour to be waiting on them moved tables for this to happen! The managers are a joke and only care about themselves!

This is the closet Cheesecake Factory to my home so I like to visit often and typically service is fine but today in particular was less then that. My friends and I went here for a nice brunch and the wait wasn&#39;t long but once we sat down Darla unfortunately dropped the ball. It took almost 10 minutes for her to speak to us, then getting something to drink and bread wasn&#39;t much better. We ordered right away and our food came out individually instead of all together. My friend waited 30 minutes for get something to get his food while the rest of us had ours. The waitress kept saying it was coming out just for the manger to come bring it finally. Everyone else&#39;s food was cold then had to be remade or taken off the bill all together. I&#39;d never expect this level of unprofessional and uncourteous service. I won&#39;t return soon.

I came yesterday afternoon with 3 girlfriends. I don&#39;t normally leave bad reviews, but the service is terrible. The food is great. Make sure you have everything you need when they drop food off, bc they won&#39;t be back for a long time (experienced this with app, entrees, and desserts). Also, we had to stack plates when finished and still the servers dropping food off did not pick them up - at edge of table. Had to wait for our server to finally come back (happened 3x) - which was not soon enough to ask for more sauce for the chicken dish bc food was eaten by the time he checked on us. Servers seem to have the &#34;not my table, not my  problem&#34; attitude. We needed water refills when entrees dropped off, but they were gone before we could ask. <br><br>We waited about 25 minutes for our entrees. They brought out the wrong entree for one of the four of us. She then had to wait another 25 minutes for her food. By the time it arrived we had all finished eating. She also requested the lunch portion, but was charged for the dinner portion. <br><br>I give our server the benefit of the doubt bc they seemed busy (keep in mind though, it was 4pm on a Sunday). Seems like a management issue since members of his (our server&#39;s) team couldn&#39;t care less about helping and making it a good experience. He seemed to be working hard and doing his best.

Who doesn&#39;t love the Cheesecake Factory<br>There menu has so much to choose from and it&#39;s absolutely delicious food. It&#39;s a great place to bring the family, coworkers even to celebrate a special event. We&#39;ve been to the Galleria Cheesecake Factory too many times to count not to mention the Cheesecake Factory in different cities. We haven&#39;t been let down yet. Sometimes the wait time is a bit extensive because everyone loves the Cheesecake Factory. From pastas to Louisiana style creole shrimp and rice flavored airing high. <br>I love the seafood as well as the red velvet cheesecake. If your ever looking for a nice sit down redo able priced restaurant for yourself family or group defiantly count this restaurant on your list. Dressed up or down you will feel comfortable. I hope this review was helpful have a nice day.

The take out service is horrible... we are staying at the hotel next door, so we ordered food, we didn&#39;t receive any plastic ware, napkins, etc.. so we called the manager he suggested we walk down and everything would be ready.. it wasn&#39;t and they gave me 2 forks instead of a full set up.. <br>come on... it&#39;s holidays, we are trying to shop and enjoy are day, not babysit

I would probably come to this location more if it wasn&#39;t so busy. It is inside the Galleria located on the third floor so it&#39;s freaking busy always when I go there. In all fairness, it&#39;s always the weekend. <br><br>Their menu:<br><br>Has anything from American to Italian or Chinese even. Their menu is full of different delicious foods from all these different and wonderful countries. You really can&#39;t go wrong in their wide selection of foods.

I wish I could give The Cheesecake factory four and a half stars.  It deserves more than a four, but not necessarily a five.  The Cheesecake Factory is an excellent restaurant chain.  There is a very nice atmosphere, created by the dim lighting, which also causes a romantic feel.  There is very good service as well.  While you are waiting for your meal, they serve you fresh, warm bread.  My favorite is probably the Rye... that&#39;s the brown one right? lol.<br><br> Just a hint: if you are going to order a main entree, plan on getting about three meals out of it.  Personally, I go for an appetizer, which is one or two meals.  My favorite is the fried macaroni and cheese.  You are served four breaded and fried balls of macaroni and cheese on a chunky marinara.  When you plunge your fork into the ball, you will find lots of white cheddar cheese and macaroni. I have tried so many things on this menu and I have NEVER been disappointed. I&#39;m usually not all that experimental but Cheesecake Factory has gotten me out of my old habits! If you&#39;re a Veggie... they make some of the best salads I have ever had.  If I want a salad for a meal (which is rare) the first place I think of is Cheesecake, hands down.  My personal favorite is the Luau Salad.  I am also rather fond of the Chicken Tostada Salad.  <br><br>This place makes some damn good cheesecake with about 20 available selections.  I guess that&#39;s what they are named for.  A fail-proof order is the fresh strawberry - it&#39;s a classic.  Dulce de Leche, though I feared might be too sweet, but divine - rich without being overpowering.  However, I almost feel that they got a little zealous with their combinations.  Some of those cheesecakes really never had to be made.  German chocolate cheesecake?  Boston cream cheesecake?  <br><br>At the end of your enjoyable meal... they bring you the bill....  Although it isn&#39;t too bad, it&#39;s still pricey.  Normally, the wait is about 45 minutes.  If you get there early or on a weekday, you may be seated immediately.  This place is a must-try.

After dance class, my boyfriend and I stopped at this location. He ordered Jamaican shrimp dish and I ordered the 160-calorie cheesecake with strawberries and whipped cream. Cheesecake was light, and satisfying with just a hint of sweetness. it was enhanced by the berries and cream, and I will order it again. Yummy.  The Jamaican dish was beautiful with shrimp, rice, black beans, a sweet relish. He was enjoying it so much, then there was chicken it (that he didn&#39;t order). He brought it to the waitress&#39;s attention and someone returned some time later with a small plate of shrimp.  I also had the skinny margarita, which was good.  The service was satisfactory and a friendly atmosphere engulfed the room. everyone enjoying a Friday night out with family and/or friends. I will return in the near future.

Went for my daughters 13th birthday and our waiter definitely put a damper on our experience. His attitude was obvious, he hates his job. ZERO enthusiasm, hardly smiled. When told it was my daughters birthday he was unemotional. When he delivered our drinks the ice cubes in the water were already melted, the iced tea was warm and the cubes were mostly liquid. I had to ask for a sugar caddy as well as bread. The food was fine with exception to my husband&#39;s shrimp dish. They overcooked the shrimp and they tasted like cardboard. The waiter offered to take it back to be redone. The manager came to the table and asked what was wrong with the dish and stated they were working on another one. We were already finished with our food by the time his second dish arrived. We thought maybe we&#39;d be offered a discount or a free slice of cheesecake for the kitchen error...nope....not even on my daughters birthday. We are always hesitant to go to this restaurant because our past visits for the most part are lackluster and it&#39;s primarily because of the staff. They&#39;re just not friendly. I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s the type of customers they have to wait on day in and out and it&#39;s tarnished the guest service shine. It just seems like everyone is going through the motions and far removed from the notorious Texas hospitality. We will avoid this restaurant from now on. We&#39;ve given it too many chances to turn around and our sever and his lack of interest or caring (even smiling much) closed the door to our patronage.

Ordered an unassuming taco from their menu and was given a huge plate of delicious food! I was in the restaurant for a &#34;light&#34; lunch and a slice of cheesecake and I almost couldn&#39;t walk from fullness. <br><br>The waiter was very nice and suggested that 1/2 of my cheesecake be placed on a takeout box. Why didn&#39;t I think of that?

Came here with a friend for his birthday. Just the 2 of us were sat immediately around 2:30 on a Friday afternoon. Service was good. We ordered fried Mac &amp; cheese (~$11-12) as an appetizer. It took a little while but we weren&#39;t complaining since we were catching up. The manager stopped by to apologize about the wait and explained they had cooked one less than what was suppose to be delivered so they&#39;ll have it out in just a moment. Very soon after, 4 perfectly fried Mac &amp; cheese balls were delivered. They were awesome!<br>For our main course, we both ordered from the lunch menu. He had grilled salmon which came with mashed potatoes and broccoli ($15.50). He said it was good. I ordered the miso salmon which comes with rice but asked to sub it out with mashed potatoes ($15.50). It was great! I really enjoyed my miso salmon because it had a sweetness to it. I highly recommend it and will order it again. I could only eat 1/3 of it because I was full after the bread and 1 fried Mac ball. Packed it up because I don&#39;t waste food.<br>I highly recommend the red velvet cheesecake but my friend wanted the Reese&#39;s cheesecake, so we ordered that to go for him because you can&#39;t go to Cheesecake Factory and not order cheesecake! Plus it was his birthday, and his first visit to CCF ever.<br>When the check came, I was surprised to see how they had comped our fried Mac &amp; cheese balls. Total was $43.<br>Hadn&#39;t been to CCF in years, and I forgot how tasty they were. Looking forward to my next visit. :)

Good food, service and environment. Came on a Saturday night, wait was 15 minutes for a party of 2. (They don&#39;t do reservations) Because the menu is HUGE, my boyfriend and I had very low expectations. We had the Crispy fried cheese (aka mozzarella sticks) for starters. Very good, and pretty light for it being fried food. We had to ask for extra marinara sauce bc it was so chunky and not really sauce-like textured. <br><br>I ordered a &#34;factory combination&#34;-Shrimp scampi &amp; Steak Diane w/ mash potatoes. The mash potatoes were FIVE STARS! The steak was flavorful, but the shrimp scampi was not in my favor. I assumed it came with Angel hair pasta just like it does alone on the menu, and every other restaurant but it was just the shrimp by it self. <br><br>My boyfriend got the Rib-eye steak w/ mash potatoes and Mac &amp; Cheese. FIVE STAR MEAL! Next time I&#39;m getting what he got! Steak was cooked to perfection. The sides had nice flavor and texture. <br><br>Overall, we will definitely be back!

Very good restaurant we ate there and omelette with potatoes it was very delicious I also drank The Oreo shake oh my God it&#39;s the best shake ever I eat here at least once a week and I never get disappointed they have a very big variety on their menu and the staff are very nice and polite.<br>The only thing they&#39;re disappointed us was when we asked to get some change of $100 bill and they gave me a $30 on singles it&#39;s a lot but other than that they deserve to get five stars as always
Been some time since I last came here. They did not disappoint me at all. Got Parmesan Crusted Chicken with garlic mashed potatoes, and green beans. All of the food was well cooked and delicious.

This was my first time visiting Cheesecake Factory in the Galleria area, it was my friends birthday so we wanted to eat somewhere trendy &amp; delicious! We were sat down quickly but us being problematic we wanted to change tables when we were already put in Myriam&#39;s Section. Although , she moved us &amp; still served us . I wanted to have them sing happy bday to my friend &amp; she got everyone to sing &amp; brought her the cheesecakes I ordered c&#39;: ! Overall she was a really great waitress &amp; would definitely ask for her again! She made both of our nights!

They really need to work on customer service here. We were brought out dirty silverware. The food was okay. Better than the place itself. We also never got bread. The also took eggplant parmigiana off the menu which was probably the best thing there.

Like a worn old shoe. This place is familiar and you learn to have your favorites. The staff is always hit or miss, I blame that on management. Tonight it was sloppy at best, just like the manager on duty.<br><br>We had the gluten free Shepard&#39;s Pie and a slice of Mango Key Lime Cheesecake. The Shepard&#39;s is always a huge portion and a blissful indulgence. This version of a key lime cheesecake is an utter sin. You need to  visit your priest for a full six months to get over it.<br><br>I love how the check has the tip ranges broken out.

Wait was rather long... but I will say the staff is friendly. Food orders were correct and very tasty. Not first tone here... but haven&#39;t been to this location since around 2012... Good experience. Great server... went above minimum to ensure his 30%tip from each of us

On a Sunday afternoon just before 1pm there was a 20 minute wait, which was acceptable with two young kids in tow.  We quickly ordered and got our food really fast which I was thankful for since we were starving.<br>The ahi tuna tataki salad and chopped chicken salad were both fair to good.  I enjoyed the brown bread they served with the meal and I am not a bread person at all, so that&#39;s saying a lot.<br><br>Our kids shared a personal pizza which the gobbled right up.<br><br>It was a great experience given it was fast and good with a starving family

Awful. Completely awful. The service was awful and the food was awful. I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory a few times and after this last visit I will not be coming back. My food was cold (which doesn&#39;t bother me much, but hey- we&#39;re pointing out what was wrong), the pasta was so thick and gummy. It felt as if I were chewing on cardboard. I told the waiter I wasn&#39;t pleased, a place that&#39;s kind of pricey you&#39;d think you&#39;d get good service.  The waiter didn&#39;t even apologize, not even a fake &#34;oh I&#39;m sorry ma&#39;am&#34;, of course we both know you&#39;re not actually sorry, it&#39;s just said out of courtesy. Didn&#39;t ask what was wrong. He just IMMEDIATELY said he was going to get the manager, who was rude as well. She said I had &#34;eaten half of it&#34;, I couldn&#39;t shove that down my throat and leave half of it if my life depended on it bc of how awful it was. The whole visit was disappointing.
Rude waitress. Typically not this bad. Waitress came and tossed stale bread and really unpresentable &#34;butter&#34; on our table. Not a great experience.
This place is a staple. Consistent as always. I love their grilled salmon always cooked properly and tastes fresh. The cheesecake is always consistent and never disappoints.

I went to the Galleria location for lunch order pick up. While waiting to pay, I accidentally mistaken it was my turn to the counter, and this tall black waiter with braids tied up behind his head, stepped in and start to commenting on me with &#34;How Rude!&#34; and &#34;She is no good!&#34; I challenged him, what are you talking about, he said, &#34;oh, I was calling my co-worker, her is is fruit!&#34; BS!! I&#39;m never going to Cheesecake factory again, their food is very unhealthy anyways! Yuk!

The food and service were amazing! The portions were huge , we could and should have shared an entree but we enjoyed it. Our server Ausha was top notch and Always had a smile on her face when she rushed to get our many requests. I will definitely be back to this location in the galleria.

I eat st this Cheesecake Factory a few times a year when I&#39;m here on travel, usually opting for take out. Typically, meals are delicious and of Cheesecake Factory standards. However, today I ordered food and an apple crisp dessert from Grub Hub and the apple crisp was completely cold...as cold as the ice cream it came with. The food was good but I&#39;m completely confused why they would serve cold desert, even on a delivery order. I&#39;m at a hotel and unable to warm my cold apple crisp, which is a total bummer for me and my sweet tooth.

This was my first time at this particular Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to a couple of other ones in the Houston/SL area and they are fine. I actually always liked Cheesecake Factory, but the experience at this Cheesecake Factory was not so great. I came on a Sunday around lunch time. The wait was not as long as I expected. We got seated almost right away. Our waitress came and greeted us and took our drink orders. She was very nice and happy. When we were ready to order, she came back to take our food order. We waited a very long time for everything. The drinks came out with the food! The waitress kept coming to our table while we were waiting to let us know that the bartender is super busy but it should be done soon. She came back a third time and she basically said that the bartender is &#34;horrible&#34; and &#34;sucks at her job.&#34; We felt really awkward and wanted to leave.. but we had already ordered so we just waited for everything to come. It was very unprofessional but mostly made us feel so uncomfortable being there! Definitely will not come back to this Cheesecake Factory. The food was okay but again, it took FOREVER to come out.

This place is disgusting.  How many times do you have to tell the manager that the bathroom is trashed before they do anything about it?  Service was horrible.  Wrong orders missing critical parts of the meal.  Very very long waits for food.  Never again.  Why do people still go to this place?

When you come to the Cheesecake Factory you expect a certain standard. Even though the wait staff was very attentive, the food was prepared improperly and by the time I got mine the second time, my buddy was almost finished with his meal. A food runner brought the food out the second time and I never talked with a manager. (Mac and Cheese burger ordered Medium. Arrived Well Done and dry.)

Minus points because the lighting is very dim, you can barely read the menu. Got their at 11:30 and it wasn&#39;t busy, however my salad took 30 minutes. The waiter asked if I wanted bread instead of just bringing it out as most locations do. I was brought a refill of iced tea with no ice? This is our second time at this location and I wasn&#39;t too impressed. My salad had chicken in it which was located on the bottom of the salad. I had 10 small pieces the size of a nickel laying underneath 3 inches of salad. I love the Cheesecake Factory just not this location

Was placed on hold for over 20 minutes then hung up and took my business to the competition where there was a hold of under 2 minutes. Get a better system of taking orders because I will no longer be eating here. It was a disappointment because I was going to place a large order! <br><br>What is the industry standard of wait time? Think about how much business they have lost simply by placing customers on hold for too long.
New Years Day; quick professional service. Food is absolutely amazing. Good quality savory ingredients burst threw each bite.

First time eating at the cheese cake factory in Galleria . We have been to different cheese cake restaurants in Different states / locations . However , this one has been the worse. <br><br>First, we were seated and our server took our order . After that , we didn&#39;t get any bread  or any appetizers so we had to ask another server to get it for us . our server disappeared for a while so he didn&#39;t care to check our table not even once . <br><br>We saw the manager walking around and we asked him to get us some bread.we told him we have been waiting for it for more than 20 minutes . He didn&#39;t apologize and disappeared as well .<br><br>Food was good but we were left alone on your table . I wonder why our server didn&#39;t even care to stop by and ask if we needed any anything . <br><br>Luckily, a nice buzzer girl was around and refilled our drinks / water . <br><br>On top of that , I didn&#39;t to use the paper tolls because he didn&#39;t care To bring a nice one . <br><br>Seriously , if you want to be treated like a worthless ,come to this restaurant . Basically , he only took our order and then bring the check. <br><br>I guess that guy ( Aka server ) needs to be learn how to deal and treat customers. <br><br>Thank you so much for the poor service !!! We loved it and had a great time there !!
horrible, bad attention, I waited for my food for more than 40 min and the restrooms were disgusting

I frequent this location because I am closer to this area than the others. My favorite dishes are the Thai lettuce wrap and the Pasta Da Vinci. The Thai lettuce wrap comes with about 6 pieces of chicken, some veggies, and 3 different sauces. I usually order the Pasta Da Vinci because I like how the flavors are not too bold and it comes with mushrooms. Service is consistent most of the time. There&#39;s usually a long wait during the weekend, which is understandable.<br><br>If you&#39;re coming from the inside of the Galleria Mall, it&#39;s much easier than coming in the main entrance. By entering the main entrance, you have to climb a set of stairs before you are able to do anything. The restroom is also located downstairs so make your pit stop before you walk back downstairs if you&#39;re coming from the front (or just go when you leave). Parking is usually a hassle because you have shoppers and customers from other restaurants parked in the same garage.

Our server was very rude and he had no problem blaming the establishment for how poor his service was. It was my daughters friends birthday, and we left highly disappointed with our experience. We work in the food industry too, I&#39;m an understanding person when it comes to customer service, but this was just terrible.

Corbin is the waiter to ask for in this restaurant. He is exceptional and superb with attention to detail for customer service. Without asking questions our drinks are always full, a take out containers were there when we were ready to go. Cheese Cake Factory is like any other franchise but I gave this place a 5 star base on the over the top service. Thanks Corbin had an awesome time.
i really enjoy coming to this place. everyone gave us good treatment and the food is delicious. it is also conviently connected to the galleria so after we ate, we could walk it off and go shopping.

This place is run by racist a-holes. Here&#39;s how a friend of mine was treated when she went there. She&#39;s a veteran, law student, and an all-around decent person.<br><br>&#39;While waiting for my order at The Cheesecake Factory, a customer demanded I wait somewhere else because he didn&#39;t want me nor my &#34;germs&#34; near him. When I refused, he stood up and told me he would move me himself. The manager approached, another customer approached, and DESPITE the other customer stating that I was not the aggressor and &#34;the gentleman at the bar was being rude.&#34; The manager told me to wait in a corner of the restaurant because the other customer felt uncomfortable. When I decided that I would not be moved, the manager called the cops and told them to come and remove me from the restaurant. I left, found a corner on the side of the road, and cried. I&#39;ve never felt so embarrassed, insignificant, and helpless.&#39;

I had to check in twice because I wanted to amend my comment about the customer service, our service was James, we had a large party of 11 people and he was amazing at keeping it all together and always had a smile. This is not my usual location as I go to Cheesecake Factory often but it was a good experience all in all.

I wish I can leave 0 stars! I&#39;m so upset I visited the location in the galleria mall in Houston Texas I ordered the fried Mac and cheese as I took a bite I saw there was a big hair in my food!!!! I am so grossed out such a unsanitary restaurant for the galleria!! oh.... but it gets better I ordered the chicken carbonara for my entree and in the dish there was a chunk of tomato and green bell pepper mixed with my food that did not belong there called the manager he didn&#39;t even care to speak or apologize really it was very fake like he was used to these problems in his restaurant cause in my case hair is a very unsanitary thing and should not be taken lightly very bad service and is not clean place to dine do not go!!!! wish I could have got something in return but nothing not even there sympathy I got DO NOT EAT HERE

Parking to come to Cheesecake factory at this location is not optimal. <br><br>The food here is consistent and the menu selection is broad. There is something for everyone. I usually get a pasta dish and sometimes try a new cheesecake which never disappoints. Cheesecake factory is almost the same everywhere with decoir and food consistency, so I can really only differentiate with service here.<br><br>Service could have improved for sure. Twice I asked for a warm batch of new bread, that took an extra 20 minutes to get to me and wasn&#39;t even warm (though he said it was &#34;fresh from the oven&#34;) :( I have waited tables in my past experiences so I don&#39;t usually harp on trivial things, but the butter wouldn&#39;t even melt on my bread LOL. We didn&#39;t get checked on or water refills -- which just confused me because it was past rush hour. Ended up staying here around 2.5 hours for dinner at 7:30 partially because it took so long to get our food.<br><br>I also wish they did something complimentary cheesecake or something for birthdays, but they only decorate the dessert for you. oh well :( You get a happy birthday song by your server and 1 other unlucky server who happened to be dragged over. Next time, I&#39;d probably opt for a different location.
They are so rude and incredible slow. I enjoy the food but the service needs to improve.  I prefer to spend my money somewhere else.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. So much variety in everything they have on the menu. I wish they were a little cheaper and had less calories. Oh And I wish i didn&#39;t have to walk 3 miles inside the Galleria mall to find the place.  But the walk back to the car did make my selection of a S&#39;mores Cheesecake more palatable. Overall Great place, I wish we had one in Little Rock.

First thing was that our bread we were given was really hard, and hard to eat. When we got to our seats the server took awhile to come to us. Once we were given our food we only saw the server like 2 times and didn&#39;t come back to check on us often for refills. I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich with buffalo sauce and it only had like 2 drops of buffalo sauce on it, I expected more. I come to this location often but after this experience I don&#39;t think I will.

I like The Cheesecake Factory.  I do question their choice of Door Dash for their deliveries.  In the dozen or so times I have ordered over the past year, I don&#39;t recall one order or delivery being correct.  Door Dash blames TCF, but they should be double checking on top of whatever checks TCF is already doing.  On my latest delivery, they missed an entire item and the soup was packed on top so when it tilted over, it drained on all the other packages.  Ugh!  And no dessert!

I went here for dinner last night while in town on business. Standard Cheesecake Factory experience. <br><br>I was quickly seated, the hostess was constantly refilling my water, and the spicy cashew chicken that I ordered was good. No issues with this venue at all.

This is my granddaughters favorite place when we are in Houston. Of course the Cheesecakes are amazing and so many choices. We ordered steaks, 1 medium well, one medium rare. They were served to us 1 medium and 1 rare. Waitress graciously took them back. They re fired our same steaks and they came back to our liking, however now they were dried out.<br>The flavor was there, so if they would have been cooked right the first time, pretty sure they would have been perfect.<br>Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta dish is delicious.

This was an average cheesecake factory.  Not worse or better than others.  That&#39;s why I&#39;m giving it a 3 out of 5 stars.  The food is so-so, there was a long wait for our food, and the prices are not great.  Overall, I always feel like there is a better choice of places to eat than cheesecake factory.

Haven&#39;t been to this place in a long time and I must say from the service to the food I was impressed. <br>I didn&#39;t order alcohol beverages because it was a very chill dinner. Jasmine was awesome had us laughing and giving her recommendations and I must say that lovely lady knows her stuff. Will definitely be back.
It&#39;s okay the food is tasty but the silverware was dirty  Other than that it&#39;s a nice place to eat

This was a first for my wife and I and we had a great time! First and foremost the service was excellent, our server was a young lady named Anngee from Venezuela and she was full of personality! The food was top notch, the restaurant was spotless, but we only gave this place 4 stars because the frozen drinks leave a lot to be desired. We would definitely recommend this place to anybody looking for a good time, good food, and a good atmosphere.

The service has been slow. Asked for a manager to speak to about the old lettuce in the salad. Slightly disappointing for a Cheesecake F. After sending three salads back for rotten lettuce, there was barely an apology from the manager and No comp anything. Horrible customer service! I would not recommend.

This is one of the worst cheesecake factories I have ever been to.  I would not ever come back here for a meal. My burger wasn&#39;t cooked properly and tasted disgusting to the point where I didn&#39;t even finish itS. The cheesecake I had was decent.

Let me start by saying Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants.  I&#39;ve eaten here soooo many times, and I&#39;ve never gotten tired of it.  The building itself is inside the mall, so you can park at any of the garages and walk to it.  It has an entrance on the 2nd floor, and another entrance on the 1st floor (which is where the bar is).  Since it IS in the galleria, good luck finding parking on the weekends.<br><br>This place gets pretty packed around lunch and dinner time so you will have to wait, especially if you have large parties.  The waiting area can get pretty crowded too, so go at off hours if you want to avoid the chaos.<br><br>If you&#39;re new to this place, you&#39;ll be surprised at the sheer number of items on the menu.  On top of that, they will give you complementary bread &amp; butter.  As far as  the appetizers here, its all pretty good.  Except for a few things, such as the &#34;vietnamese shrimp summer rolls.&#34;  That stuff&#39;s pretty cold and bland.<br><br>Don&#39;t know what to choose for lunch or dinner?  The pasta &amp; burger/sandwiches are always a good choice, not to mention the size of the portions (they are VERY big).  If you come during lunch time, you can get a &#34;lunch special&#34; of certain items, such as the pasta.  It&#39;s a smaller size portion, but to be honest it&#39;s still quite a lot of food.  Overall, most of the things on the menu here are good.  <br><br>As far as the cheesecake goes, the Cheesecake Factory has THE BEST cheesecake.  Again, you can&#39;t go wrong with any of this stuff.  It&#39;s all good.  BUT, be warned, one slice has like 750-1000 calories.<br><br>Wait, but Brandon, what do you recommend? Well check it out homie:<br><br>1. Appetizers: Crabcakes, Factory Nachos, Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip, Crispy Crab Bites<br><br>2. Salads:  I don&#39;t eat salads here<br><br>3. Real Food: Kobe Burger (personal favorite, get it with sweet potato fries and ask for chipotle mayo), Southwest Chicken Sandwich, Louisiana Chicken Pasta, Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta, Shepherd&#39;s Pie, Famous Factory Meatloaf<br><br>4. Cheesecake: Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake (a classic), White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut, Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake<br><br>Oh, and don&#39;t get the vietnamese shrimp summer rolls.  Or the fish tacos.  Just sayin

We came here for cheesecake, but decided to have a meal as well. We didn&#39;t have to wait long, which was an initial surprise. Once seated, we waited for about 10 minutes before member of the wait staff recognized that we were there. She said that she was over booked in our section about would be back by to get our drink orders. It was at that point, that I realized our service would suck... and it did. Not because of the waitress, but because the hostess sat too many tables in her section.<br><br>Food was mediocre. But let&#39;s be honest, no one comes here for their food... Its all about the cheesecake.<br><br>We went with the red velvet, to-go. It was good, but could have been better.

The menu selection is HUGE. So many options to choose from! The portions are very generous so the pricing is acceptable in my opinion. The service was a little bit slow on the Tuesday evening that we went, although the restaurant was packed for it being so early in the week. Excellent cocktail selection at decent prices, although the cocktail menu does not show the prices listed. You basically just find out how much you spent on your alcohol at the end... Overall, a great experience!

I was in Houston with my aunt, and her 8 and 11 year old grandchildren. The kids were excited to eat the cheesecake factory. We were seated in a timely manner, and a friendly waitress came soon, and took our orders.  After at least, 30 to 35 minutes waiting, we flagged our server to find out the status of our order.  A man approached our table and identified himself as a manager. He immediately went into excuses as to why our food was delayed. He said it would take an additional 18-25 minutes for a well-done burger that was for one of the kids. He tried to convince us that this was a reasonable time frame for cooking a well done burger. He offered to bring food for everyone else to start eating, while the one child waited for his burger. Or he said that we could leave. I explained that we did not want to eat and leave one child without food. That we<br> had flown in from S.F. this morning, and the kids wanted to eat. I asked if these were the only two solutions he could offer, and he said yes. <br>As the initial shock wore off, we asked for a check to pay for the soda and watered down drink, and we decided to leave. But then the real manager came over very professionally profusely apologized and told us that he would get the meal out as soon as possible and gave us a generous discount or the meal.

Ridiculously disgusting if I may. Did NOT expect this service from Cheesecake Factory. First all, had to sent back our plates which were all greasy which the server denied to be so, and then our food came for which we had to wait good 5-7 mins for our plates. By that time, our food was cold. Then our pasta arrived which was rubbery, and extremely cold which was disgusting to eat. Overall, WORST experience of the year. I am one who let&#39;s go of any bad experience but this ruined our night.

Ordered a hickory bbq burger I asked for it well done cut it open and it&#39;s just as pink as it want to be! They had to take it bk and waited for more than 15 min, my fries got cold bc she didn&#39;t take it bk with the burger. The other people at the table finished their food and still haven&#39;t received mine. Not happy at all

I have eaten here a few times, but mostly we get it to go. They give you an estimated time it will be ready, and it&#39;s always been ready when I&#39;ve arrived. The waiting area for dining can be crowded, but the to go counter never has more than one or two people in it, and mostly there&#39;s never a line. They pull everything out of the to go bags and go over your order with you to ensure you get what you wanted. They will throw in some of their fresh baked bread and butter at no charge. I recommend the wheat bread, I normally don&#39;t prefer wheat bread but theirs is a little sweet, and it&#39;s always warm. <br><br>The regular portions are huge, and the lunch portions are also huge, but smaller than the normal portion. <br><br>The Chinese chicken salad is good, as is the Santa Fe chicken salad. The Santa Fe&#39;s dressing is simply amazing, it is described as Spicy Peanut-Cilantro Vinaigrette, but it is not spicy at all. I always ask for extra dressing. They are stingy on the tortilla strips but you can ask for extras also. The chicken is thinly sliced and everything blends together nicely. <br><br>I&#39;ve also had their lunch pizza &amp; salad, the pizza has a fairly thin crust, and the cheese always tastes great. The lunch shepherd&#39;s pie is also very good, and a very nice sized portion. <br><br>My only complaint is the traffic around the galleria and the parking. I normally park on the roof deck and pay the minimum charge, even though I&#39;m in and out in less than 15 minutes (this used to be free, but of course now they make you pay!) There is a valet (I think free?), but I&#39;ve valeted before and told the guy I had to go to one store close by and would be back in less than 20 minutes, but they still went and parked my car &amp; then I had to wait for them to bring it back.

STAY AWAY!!!!<br><br>By far one of the absolute worst restaurant experiences I have EVER had.  For starters, today was my mother&#39;s birthday, so we decided to go to The Cheesecake Factory to celebrate.  That was our first mistake:<br><br>1. It took over 15 minutes for our waitress to greet us at the table.<br><br>2. My mother&#39;s food was not hot when it arrived at the table.  The salmon was dry, the mashed potatoes had been sitting out for so long that they were no longer soft, and had turned a yellow/brown color.<br><br>3. It took another 15 minutes for our waitress to return so that my mother could select a different dish.<br><br>4. We ask for a manager - it took the manager, Chris, over 10 minutes to come to our table.  I remember the time because I intentionally checked because it took so long.  When we asked our waitress why it was taking so long, she said &#34;the managers are all having a meeting with the new shift.&#34;  Umm..ok?  I have never heard of a manager at a restaurant being unavailable when a patron asks to speak with one.<br><br>5. Manager finally arrives and my mother places a new order.  We order our dessert (remember, it is her birthday and BOTH this manager, Chris AND our waitress knew).<br><br>6. Dessert arrives.  No candle.  No &#34;happy birthday&#34; on the plate.  No song.  We ask our waitress if they still sing to guests at the table, and she says, and I QUOTE &#34;Oh, we still sing, but we only do it for certain tables... sometimes we don&#39;t want to disturb other guests.. But I always do it for my guests..&#34;  ... Umm.. awkward?  So we are not your guests?  Are we not deserving?  Also, this was about 4pm, and there were maybe 3 people seated in our section.<br><br>7. We call a manager over again.  Takes Chris the same 10-15 minutes to arrive.  He proceeds to tell us what he would NOT do (i.e. comp our horrible dinner).  We end up ARGUING with the manager about our horrible experience (because there are plenty more details, such as old coffee, tea, cold food, no water refills, OVER CHARGED for things my mother sent back, poor service all around).  <br><br>I have NEVER been to a restaurant where a manager argues with a patron about the experience they had at their restaurant.  I will NEVER, EVER take ANYONE to The Cheesecake Factory again.  I will NEVER recommend going there.  Absolutely deplorable service, and an even more awful dining experience.

The worst service I have had. My friends and I are hungry.  We waited 15 minutes just to order drinks and food together. After ordering we waited another hour. Food never came. When complaining to management they seem uninterested. Management finally said sorry for the inconvenience we have taken care of the bill. <br>We just had water. I will not come to this place again and discontinue my lunch meetings here.

We have frequented this place for years. The food is good, the cheesecake amazing. We went there yesterday for my birthday. The hostess showed us to a corner table by the front door; I asked if we could be seated at a little less noisy table because my mother in law was hard of hearing. They acted like I insulted them, &#34;all the tables are noisy,&#34; and we watched table after table being seated in front of us. We left.<br><br>Thank you for your comments. This was the first time we had experienced anything like this, and will definitely give your restaurant another chance.

So my family and I decided to dine in at The Cheesecake Factory, thinking it would be good since it has a really good reputation. We arrive at our table with a waitress who did not really care about our experience their. But we just forget about that. Then we order our food not knowing we were about to get the worst experience possible. My parents both got the Steak and Salmon dinner combination. And the salmon tasted like plain salmon even though it said it had lemon butter. But it was sooo PLAIN/BLAND. And the steak was pretty good but still needed a little help on their sauce. I got the Pan Seared Branzino. And it was the most bland thing I have ever tasted. And the vegetables that came with it were just steamed with no seasoning on. I would say the  presentation on the plates looked really good. But after that first bite we took it was the exact opposite of what it looked like. My little sister got corn dogs and that was better than the Steak, Salmon, and Branzino. Anyways at the end their cheesecake was very delicious. I really recommend the tiramisu cheesecake. At the moment So overall please just get the pasta which is probably only the good menu item that they have their. Any kind is good. So just go their for their cheesecake. This is the last time my family would ever come to The Cheesecake  Factory at the Galleria.

First time dining at this location and my first thought was -- why does it feel like an Amazonian rain forest in here?  It was so humid inside that I almost didn&#39;t order anything, but after driving 3 hours and skipping lunch, we were already famished.  I complained to our server about the questionable lack of A/C and he said that it always feels hot in the restaurant.  Meh.<br><br>With that aside, our server was wonderful.  He was very attentive, but never intrusive.  I ordered a grilled salmon which was very good.  He didn&#39;t charge me for my extra side of asparagus -- which winded up being a good thing because they were semi-overdone anyway.  After about 15 minutes of dining, there was a server change of shift and I was afraid that the continuity of service would be lacking, but our next server was just as great.<br><br>Our booth was located next to where all the other servers congregate and they were very unprofessional speaking loudly and cursing -- typical teenage behavior.  I was already feeling miserable sweating to death, so being forced to listen to them was just icing on the cake.<br><br>Would I come back?  Yes, just because I love the food.  Maybe my next experience would be better.  There is a veranda adjacent to the restaurant so I&#39;ll just sit outside when it&#39;s hot next time.  <br><br>- Disgusting, smelly women&#39;s bathroom.  My  particular stall had scattered toilet paper and small spots of blood on the floor... yuck.  My bf said it wasn&#39;t much better on the men&#39;s side either.

When an African-American friend was harassed and physically threatened by another patron, who demanded that she not stand near him because he didn&#39;t want her or her &#34;germs&#34; near him, the management told her to wait in a corner because she was making the man who had threatened her &#34;uncomfortable&#34;.  When she refused to be pushed into a corner, the restaurant called the cops on her.  <br><br>Apparently, this restaurant&#39;s a good place to patronize if you&#39;re a racist jerk.  Otherwise, steer clear.

Got my order to go, because it was near closing on a Saturday night. Saw something white in my pasta that I had never seen before in the pasta. Picked it up, and turns out it was someone&#39;s gum. Took the whole dish back to them the next morning and was given an attitude by the manager and told they can&#39;t do refunds or gift cards today, call back Monday. So not only did I not get dinner because there was gum in it, but I also have to wait who knows how long for them to refund on Monday and it to be processed by my card company.

How to have a customer sit down and stay? Ask them what they want to eat. Literally no one even would greet us? <br><br>I come to eat here whenever I am shopping at the Galleria. They have a &#34;Skinny Menu&#34; that makes it easy to keep my meal at a certain calorie count which is really one of the only reasons I come here. <br><br>At the moment, I&#39;ve been sitting at our table for over 15 minutes and haven&#39;t seen a waiter/waitress. There are also 5 empty tables around me and it is noon, so it&#39;s not because it&#39;s &#34;busy&#34;. This is pretty standard service for this location over the years. We actually ended up not even eating here today because no one ever came to our table to take our order. <br><br>Food is typically good it just takes a long time to get and service is spotty. If you are at the Galleria I would suggest the Bistro on top of Nordstroms, food is delicious and service has always been wonderful!

Terrible experience at brunch today.  Chinese chicken salad came out much later than other orders at the table.  A few bites in, I realized that there was no chicken in it all.  Waited for chicken to arrive--after the rest of the table had finished their food.  No change in the bill.  Mentioned to the waiter at that time that it was not his fault, but a poor reflection of the restaurant to not offer some type of adjustment due to their errors.  He asked the manager and was told that there was nothing that could be done.

the brown bread (and no I don&#39;t know what it&#39;s called) in the complimentary bread basket is the #2 reason I love this place. I can&#39;t think of any place where I like the bread more, nah not even the cheddar bay biscuits for the seafood lover in you place, that I jokingly refer to as Red Dumpster, since the food either looks like it belongs in the trash or just came out of it, in comparison to the pictures on the menu. <br><br>Moving right along, TCF&#39;s menu is too damn big, no way in hell you can&#39;t find anything appealing. My personal fav is the lemon herb roasted chicken. Juicy with a hint of tart from the lemon, it&#39;s divine and comes with carrots and mashed potatoes. Try the corn fritters for an app, delicious. Cobb salad, worth the price tag. NOT a fan of the cajun jambalaya pasta AT ALL, pass it up, save your cheddar, TRUST ME! I have friends in high places and know these things...believe me when I&#39;m trying to hip you to the game! <br><br>Hold up partner, don&#39;t eat all that food they give you, one must save room for dessert when you come here. Strawberry cheesecake, yum...loves it...BUT my #1, I can&#39;t stay away, I dream about this cheesecake y&#39;all, kahlua cocoa coffee. I&#39;d like to imagine God himself created this cheesecake and broke off a slice from heaven just to share with his #1 angel (that would be me FYI)...it&#39;s so decadent and rich, made with layers of brownie, kahlua cheesecake, chocolate mousse, and chocolate ganache. Look me in the eyeballs and tell me that ish doesn&#39;t sound good! Yeah you can&#39;t do it, can ya...don&#39;t bother, just run and try it for yourself. The carrot cake is pretty decent, but that ain&#39;t my speed. It&#39;s big as hell but I don&#39;t come to TCF for that kinda cake!!! Waste of stomach room...

Always a good dependable place to eat. The food is not superb but good and solid. Now the CHEESECAKE is SUPERB! I try a new flavor often - my faves are Lemon Meringue, Key Lime, The Original, and Salted Caramel....also get a great cappuccino with it! Those are so delicious, too!

This place is always our &#34;go to&#34; when we aren&#39;t sure what we are in the mood for. You can literally get almost every type of cuisine at one restaurant. <br><br>I&#39;ve tried several items off the menu, but some of my favorites include the fried calamari, buffalo blasts and cheesecakes! I am seriously addicted to their Oreo cheesecake. Quite frankly, it might be my most eaten dessert of all time (sshhhhhh )<br><br>The pizzas are a hit or miss... Sometimes they are on point and sometimes you are left with a soggy, sodium filled glob of dough.<br><br>The salads are always a good choice as well.

Fancy and good ambience restaurant within the galleria mall. Food is good, the quantity really fills you up so taking an appetizer isn&#39;t worth it unless you are ready to take a to go box back home. Food is good, but most of the main courses are floating in oil, but trying their cheese cakes are a must!

Love the experience every time! Ambiance is nice with a variety of diff rooms to sit in. Menu is extraordinarily extensive. I like how it has the calories listed, and I usually like to go healthy with the low cal salad and then splurge with a high cal slice of cheesecake. Would recommend the asian chicken salad or chopped salad. My bf loves the burgers here - bacon bacon is his fave. We liked the oreo cheesecake a ton as well! Service is on point: the asian salad smelled strongly of peanuts (which I am allergic to), so the server PROMPTLY asked the kitchen and confirmed it was merely the sesame.

This place is amazing! Located inside the galleria, you feel like you are far away from the city. Very intimate and warm! Our waitress was very friendly, and she didn&#39;t question when I asked for a bowl of sliced lemons. She just kept them coming! We just had cheesecake, but that didn&#39;t slow down the service. We had them fast, and of course they were delicious. Perfect little stop while shopping!

Just had the herb salmon customized. I took off the mashed potatoes and asparagus. I added green beans and broccoli. It was sooooo good.  Everyone I had dinner with had amazing entrees as well. I capped off my meal with a strawberry lemonade. I had so much food I have leftovers for lunch and possibly dinner.<br><br>Our servers were so attentive, which was good for a big group.
Worst place to eat , by the time they bring the food out it&#39;s already cold and has no type of flavor. This place does not live up to what everyone says , it is disgusting.

Where to start????? I was SHOCKED with their service today. My fiancé decided to meet and have lunch at this place since he s been there few times and enjoyed their food. Service was ok, lousy but nothing new, considering other reviews. He ordered so called &#34;famous meet loaf&#34; that he usually liked before, but it tasted so bad that he couldn&#39;t chew a single bite. I dared to try, and something was seriously wrong with the taste. So, normally, I wanted him to return a plate and talk to manager, but he refused to make a scene. He decided to tell waitress about it, but she couldn&#39;t care less. He had to repeat twice that something is wrong with the meat, and her only reply was&#34; So....You don&#39;t want this for to go&#34;???<br>WOW !!!!!! <br>Obviously, he got upset, paid our check, and we left. <br>I can&#39;t believe how ignorant and low class this place is or become. Not even single &#34;thank you&#34; on our way out!!<br><br>We both work in high end stores in same mall as this restaurant, and by God, we will never recommend this place to anybody.<br>This Galleria Mall location is disaster!!!!
This restaurant was amazing and the food was off of the charts and the staff was kind and courteous and fast to seat us, food is priced just right.... Will have to go back ASAP

It starts with the waiting process, they give you a buzzer and when that goes off, you wait with 20-30 other people for them to call your name again. Why not just get the table when the buzzer goes off?<br><br>This place is overcrowded and the two person seats are all right next to each other. It&#39;s impossible not to hear your neighbors&#39; conversations, which also means no privacy for yourself. <br><br>I ordered a drink and it was completely wrong, for $11 I would expect a little better. Took about 10 minutes from when we sat down to get the waiter and another 10 minutes to get water. Bread came around 15 minutes after that.

Bartender Anna and manager Red made my experience amazing! Had the skinnylicious salmon rolls and Tuscan chicken but the highlight was definitely the pineapple cucumber Mojito Anna created for me!!! I&#39;ll definitely be back!
Food was good .. Then went to the restroom and was very filthy. Like what the heck?! Any public restaurant should make number priority is the restrooms.

I came in on a Saturday night. I was seated quickly. I waited about 15 minutes before my waitress came over to the table. Waiter seemed very distracted. I ordered the blood orange martini, which was really good. About 10 minutes later I ordered my food. I didn&#39;t receive any bread and the waitress seemed like she was ready to leave. I had my food for about 7 minutes and she brought my check. I ended up ordering a new drink and she brought a new check. I&#39;ve been to a few cheesecake factory locations and this was by far my least favorite.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, but I did not enjoy my experience at this location yesterday. My food was great; however, the service was not. One lady I came with asked for potato skins and they informed her they ran out and when she asked if she could replace the potatoes with French fries for loaded French fries the waiter stated that is not possible. I didn&#39;t realize it was difficult to put cheese and bacon on fries. I will continue to go to Cheesecake Factory because I love the chicken costaletta, I just won&#39;t go back to this particular location.

Did not want to come here but BF had a gift card. (sigh) Closest location was the Galleria so after plumbing the depths of the parking garage and navigating the non-functional mall escalators we made our way to the restaurant.<br><br>We came here specifically for burgers cause it was Monday and I wanted to go to Pub Fountains for the three-dollar burger special but funny how things work out. So our waiter shows up for a few seconds, leaves. Shows up, leaves. Shows up, leaves. Keeps doing this, he&#39;s running off to wait on the 2 tables next to us. Finally comes to take our order, we start ordering just as the runners bring the food to the table next to us. We&#39;re mid sentence he&#39;s like &#34;just a second&#34; and leaves us for the other table. By this time we&#39;re like WTF?<br><br>So finally he comes back says &#34;Do you want to order?&#34; I&#39;m like (facepalm) Now I cannot eat rare hamburger because when I was growing up my mother nibbled at the raw hamburger while cooking and as a result, got a tapeworm which completely turned me off raw hamburger for the rest of my life. And something I&#39;ve struggled with for decades is places that try to cook hamburgers like steak - they always always always fail to get the desired result because hamburger Is Not Steak. (unless it&#39;s a high-end restaurant and their hamburgers are inch-and-a-half thick ground sirloin). (and is anyone as old as me and remembers when Chili&#39;s only served hamburgers and would **only** cook them medium-rare?)<br><br>So I say I want it cooked until no longer pink but... and he cuts me off and goes &#34;well done&#34;. And I go (facepalm). We go round and round with me trying to cancel the burger 4 or 5 times and him ignoring my requests and finally going off to find the cook for me to talk to.<br><br>It&#39;s not the cook that shows up but a manager who asked what the problem was. I tell her I want the burger cooked until no longer pink but still juicy and she goes &#34;well done&#34; and I go (facepalm). I ask her to cancel the hamburger which she actually does.<br><br>BF&#39;s burger comes, he ordered it medium-rare, no bun, it comes medium with a bun, no condiments. I testily snap &#34;Do Not Send It Back.&#34; He cuts it in half, shares it with me.<br><br>Waiter shows back up, puts the check on our table we&#39;re like WTF? Picks the check up after BF snarls at him. I had gotten no sleep the night before so I was extremely fragile and snarky as well. Exceedingly snarky. Waiter comes back, clears the table. I would have gone (facepalm) but I had part of a hamburger in my hand and no dishes on the table. We speculate  the reason he&#39;s showing up more often at our table is probably cause the other 2 tables have left.<br><br>The only good thing about this is we didn&#39;t pay for anything because of the gift card. Next time I&#39;ll tell BF &#34;fuck the gift card and take me to Pub Fountains&#34;.<br><br>Afterthought edit: They handled the stupid hamburger issue all wrong. Instead of arguing with me over it, the waiter should have just cancelled it first time I asked, brought me the menu and offered the suggestion &#34;see if there&#39;s anything else here you&#39;d rather have.&#34;  And I probably would have. Geez.

The quality and the size of the Cheesecakes have gone downhill, dramatically. There is a thin layer of cheesecake in almost every flavor and it is masked by cake and other cheap layers. The size of the slices have been cut in half. This place is a rip off. The Pappas Brothers chain (e.g. Pappadeaux, Pappas BBQ, Pappasitos, etc) has way better cheesecake. Larger slices and reasonably priced and did I mention that it is actually Cheesecake! Unlike Cheesecake Factory which has flour cake, cream, layers of this, mousse and/or that, everything but Cheesecake. Do better Cheesecake Factory.

This place has the worst servers in town.  At least at the time we walked in. The host walked us around the  whole freakin floor and 5 different servers male and females told the host to sit us somewhere else. They don&#39;t want us. In front of us and everyone else sitting. I thought they were playing a prank. Worst lunch experience I&#39;ve had in years. Told the manager,  she didn&#39;t care. Probably used to it. Whataburger has better service.
I couldn&#39;t understand why anyone wouldn&#39;t put 5 stars. I can never say no to Cheesecake Factory. Best food and desserts. Great management and service.
The food was good but the service could be better. I love the different varieties of cheesecakes of course!

Ugh. What can I say...this place is an overpriced Chili&#39;s at best. The food is very inconsistent and tastes like frozen food they microwave. The galleria area is filled with great restaurants and would not recommend Cheesecake Factory if you&#39;re in the area.

It&#39;s a three star because it&#39;s a hit or miss when you come here. The last time it was a Saturday and I understand that it&#39;s busy ,since I also work in the food industry, but my food had to have been sitting under the heat lamp for more than 15 minutes because my prosciutto to be as dry as leather, the arugula have been wilted, the sauce had crusted into the noodles and the dish.

I travel a lot for business &amp; I&#39;ve visited Cheesecake Factory in multiple cities, but unfortunately this location had the worse service I&#39;ve experienced so far. When I arrived I was seated immediately. Unfortunately I waited almost 15 mins before I was approached for anything. Once I was, I asked if they had JD Honey &amp; was told she wasn&#39;t sure, but didn&#39;t believe so. Instead of telling me she would check with a bartender or offer an alternative she just waited for me to order a drink which I got frustrated &amp; just ordered a water with lemon as well as my dinner. This drink order would seem pretty simple right? Wrong, I got my water 5 mins later w/o lemons. It took asking 2 more times for me to get the lemon I asked for 10 mins earlier. I became irritated &amp; just wanted to get my dinner &amp; leave, but while I was eating my dinner 2 other men were seated across from me. To my disbelief, they had the same server, but got helped almost immediately. In my head I thought...WTH!! I visit Houston multiple times a year, but will not revisit this location. Total service disappointment Cheesecake Factory Galleria!

This place has really gone downhill. I guess it&#39;s the lack of competition for &#34;fine dining&#34; inside the Galleria that has allowed the quality to slip as much as it has.<br><br>We were seated promptly, and our waitress could not have been nicer, but that it about the end of the positives.<br><br>Our tamale corn cakes were burnt, our rice was almost completely raw, our fish tacos were lacking sauce and shredded cabbage, and the black beans tasted overly sweet.<br><br>Won&#39;t be going back for a while.

Reverse Racism<br>I toyed with not writing this review but decided to do so...it needs to be posted.<br>We were staying at The Westin in The Galleria. and wanted a nice dinner. Decided to go down to The Cheesecake Factory. We are an adult white couple, (its ashamed that in 2017 people EVEN need to add their race to a review but its an intricate part)<br>The hostess was African American and as we stood at the hostess stand and she finally finished her conversation about her weekend she acknowledged us. No nice greeting no &#34;How are you&#34;? Just &#34;How many..?&#34; We said two and she grabs menus and begins to walk away...we assume we need to follow her and we do. She sets the menus down on the table and walks away, LOL Whatever.<br>As we sat there we noticed two other African American couples and one family get seated by us. We have still not even been greeted by a waiter. I see an AA young man (waiter) go to both the other AA tables and with some very nice banter he took their drink orders. Not ours...we sat and sat and he returned with there drinks and then took both there food orders! As he walked by I asked him if he could please get our waiter, he said &#34;Ill be right with you.&#34;  After 7 more minutes he walks up to us and no smile, no nice greeting like the other received just say...&#34;want can I get you&#34;.<br>\I asked him are you our waiter or just taking the table because the correct waiter disappeared?? He said I am...LOL<br>We said we haven&#39;t decided on food...he walked off and we left and will NEVER return. <br>Yeah...racism works both ways people!!

Two of our dishes came out later than everyone else&#39;s. My orange chicken was so dry I had to ask for more sauce on the side and my food was cold by the time that came out. I had to remind the server twice about my whiskey sour. She needed another reminder to refill my water (she remembered everyone else&#39;s though -- bringing my water refills to a grand total of 1) and then forgot ice. Our appetizers were forgotten or never put in to the kitchen and finally arrived over halfway through the meal. Confusion when splitting up the checks, with the entire process taking a good 20 minutes.<br><br>Easily my worst dining experience, though everyone else&#39;s food was tasty.

The food here is decent. The prices are ok. It seems like it&#39;s going for an upscale feel but for some reason missed the mark idk. It&#39;s a lot to choose from so that&#39;s a pro and a con in itself.. the cheesecake to be honest is not what I expected. For a place that specializes in cheesecake you would think that they&#39;d have some of the best you&#39;ve ever had but it tastes like cheesecake you can get from any old restaurant. They have a variety of cheesecakes also so again a pro and a con. Honestly if someone wanted good cheesecake I&#39;d be on the edge to recommend this place. Would I come back? A BIG maybe.

This place is always good. Had chicken littles. The chicken was very juicy and crispy. The sauces were very good. Service was superb. Can&#39;t remember ever having a bad experience here. Everything i have tried is good.

First, this place looks nice. Upscale decor.<br>Second, great service. Looks like their waiters here are well trained. They smile, greet customers, polite, and knows the food they are serving.<br>Third, the food are delicious and ample serving size.<br>The downsize, expect to pay $15-$20 per person.

You walk and it&#39;s busy, but what&#39;s new? After getting the table and ordering our appetizer, 20 minutes later the server comes back to tell us the item is out of stock. I understand it&#39;s busy, but 20 minutes after we had told you the order is a bit ridiculous. Then, we ordered our food and after five minutes he returns to tell us the marinara sauce is out too and so I ordered and different pasta dish. The other dish I ordered was the chicken Alfredo and the sauce was watered down to where it tasted like thick cheesy water. After receiving my food, I looked to the table next to us to see them being served spaghetti and meatballs.<br><br>Also, I ordered a small salad before my meal and it had no dressing on it. My friend ordered a salad as a meal, no croutons. After asking twice, our server brought it out. She also ordered a small side of French fries and after asking three times to the server and food deliverer we had to cancel the order because they did not bring it out. I can understand with it being busy, but this service is uncalled for and unprofessional. Very disappointed in the service and the food. Saddening.

Spouse and I had some errands to run at the Galleria, so we decided to grab dinner at The Cheesecake Factory. We have only been here together once since chain restaurants are not our jam. However, it was a pleasant dinner. Ambience-the lighting is low and warm. We were seated on a booth with other tables adjoining, but there are solo booths available. Bread is complimentary, and the brown bread is a winnerThe menu is giant. Massive. Enormous. We opted to split some small plates, which was PLENTY for two grown adults. The chicken samosas arrived first. They were flavorful and crisp. The accompanying sauce was tasty as well. Cuban egg rolls came next-they were not my fave. The mustard sauce was thin and the egg roll itself was not cohesive. But it was fine. Nashville nuggets were another small plate we sampled. They are not anything brand new-just chicken nuggets with hot sauce or Buffalo sauce. But they were tasty. The dish in last place was the truffle cheese sticks (bacon truffle cheese sticks? Something like that). Avoid. It was just grease. Flavorless grease. &#34;Flavorless Grease&#34; is a great name for a band. Terrible when it describes your food. So overall, our small plates were fine. What brings this review up to 3 stars were the speedy and attentive service as well as the cheesecake. Red Velvet cheesecake. So light, so delicious. Absolutely worth it. Overall, a fine dinner at Cheesecake Factory. The cost was great, the quality was fine, and the cheesecake was delish
This restaurant is too cold which spoils the experience... Otherwise everything is typical cheesecake factory.

This is the Cheesecake Factory connected to the Galleria Mall so it&#39;s super busy.  It is a 2-story restaurant so when we entered into the restaurant from the first floor with a stroller, we had to find the elevator.  They do have an elevator in the restaurant but it&#39;s so tiny.  We were lucky enough to get a booth seat away from the hustle and bustle so we were able to park the stroller at the end of our table.  They have an area at the hostess where all the mothers parked their strollers LOL<br><br>The cheesecake is wonderful. So so so many to choose from.  It&#39;s always hard.....I always go for Tiramisu cheesecake and the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake....they are both to die for.  This time though we decided to try the lemon raspberry one.  It was also very good.  <br><br>Their portions are huge so sharing a portion is always a good idea.

Please take the Cuban crispy rolls off the menu, they were lousy (greasy and tasteless). Otherwise, food was ok, service was very good and cheesecake was delicious. Good location will bring us back again.

Ok food. AWFUL service. Waited forever for drink order. Finally had to call another server over to place our order. They could not find our waitress. Service was very very slow.
