I understand they are busy. I ordered the beef burger with grilled onions.  The berger was good but the onion was 1 very thickly cut onion. The tomato was also very thick. Burger was do thick I could not fit it into my mouth. It was just too much<br> Very awkward to eat in front of guests unless you have a very large mouth.

I don&#39;t always go to chain restaurants, but when I do, it&#39;s often at the request of an out-of-towner friend. So, let&#39;s do this: lemme get excited about The Cheesecake Factory. First, I do love going to The Galleria for anything. So, next time, I won&#39;t be so cheap and deny myself valet service. I decided to park underground and hoof it up a flight of stairs, then another inside the mall ( yup, the escalators were out of service. of course the day I wear high heels. all in the name of sexy heels). Ok, so here&#39;s the skinny on the fat-laden Cheesecake factory:<br><br>Pros:<br>1. In the mood for something off the menu? Don&#39;t hesitate to ask. My BFF was dying for some particular &#34;brunch-only&#34; grilled skirt steak and our server pulled some strings to get her exactly what she wanted despite us not being there during brunch. So thank you cool server for hooking us up!<br>2. The white and dark brown oat bread is warm and delicious with butter. OMG what I won&#39;t do for a warm bread basket. <br>3. Ask for a mango juice spritzer: half of their mango juice with seltzer. You&#39;ll thank me later, in case you end up diving in for a bite or three of cheesecake.<br>4. If you go during lunch, order from their lunch menu. Smaller portions with 2 sides and a smaller price ($11.99). I got the meatloaf with broccoli and sweet potato fries. 2 slices of tasty loaf, with  a little on the mushy side broccoli and perfectly salty sweet SP fries.  <br><br>Cons:<br>1. If you sit on the patio upstairs, be sure to bring your sunglasses. You swear you were on the Love Boat &#39;s Lido Desk. It gets super bright. Note: Vampires, sit inside. <br>2. Bathroom is downstairs only. Ladies, if wearing  heels, be prepared to take the elevator or walk down 1 flight of stairs. <br>3. Nothing truly exceptional here. The service is hit or miss: you won&#39;t get extremely friendly service or any special recommendations. <br>4. In my opinion, the cheesecakes here look impressive, but I&#39;m more of a fan of smaller portions and lighter tasting cheesecakes. So for that reason, I can only warrant 3 stars. <br><br>All in all, if you&#39;re dining with someone who loves The Cheesecake Factory or a group with diverse tastes, their menu is perfect. And if you decide to go face first into dessert, you can always walk it off in the mall, but ladies, be sure to bring your walking shoes ;)

So we decided to go here on a THURSDAY NIGHT and these jerks decided they would be &#34;closed for a conference event&#34; today.<br><br>Well, GOOD RIDDANCE.  You don&#39;t want our money, we will GLADLY GO ELSEWHERE.  I am done with your crap...you do NOT treat your custom like that.  If you love being closed for f***ing &#34;conference events&#34; so much, why don&#39;t you try STAYING THAT WAY AND TRY MAKING YOUR LIVIBG OFF OF THAT CRAP.

I wish I had photos!  I absolutely love this place!  Great food and service every time.  Yeah sometimes it takes awhile to get seated but it&#39;s worth the wait.  They have options for healthy eating and gluten free options!  Tamale cakes are a must have!  We go here every time we are in the area.

So... me personally I dont care for cheesecake factory, but my gf insisted we go so I figured I&#39;d give it another try and -_- let me just say it&#39;s a good thing it&#39;s called the cheesecake factory because that was the only thing the was worth consuming.<br>First of all the service was slow and not only slow but borderline garbage.<br>The waitress was new (bless her heart) but hopefully within time her people skills grow.<br>I ordered a mojito and it tasted more like a mint and lime water, absolutely unacceptable. Should&#39;ve just drank tap water <br>Just a heads up if you order the jamaican black pepper shrimp, make sure there aren&#39;t any empty dog food cans in the garbage be cause that&#39;s exactly what it tasted like( with a hint of rice) the chicken and shrimp were both exiled to hell before they were served with a bed of white rice some teriyaki sauce that was obviously mistaken by the chef as jerk sauce, and a fruit salad of mango whatever the fuck that was.<br>I would be a little more light on the insults to this restaurant only of they hadn&#39;t insulted my tastebuds and wallet first. But the cheesecake was decent so.. whatever I guess. Let&#39;s just say $120 later all my thoughts of how garbage this place is was confirmed. And after that experience even my gf that LOVES the cheesecake factory said she wont be returning.
Awesome fun and friendly staff. The food was good as well. It was a party of 5 so we got to try each others food. The waitress was amazingly awesome. The cheesecakes were to die for.

So gross- why do people come here?<br>I literally just got the regular old fashioned burger-  medium well.<br>I swear this was the the most burnt burger I&#39;ve ever had in my life. I would have sent it back but it was to-go and I was to tired to walk over.<br>How do you burn meat? I don&#39;t get it.

Flatware/silverware at table were completely not cleaned upon arrival. Not just small sticky food that didn&#39;t come off in the washer, but chunks of food that looks like they scooped up some time of crusty pie. See pictures I&#39;m placing on this review.  Also service was extremely slow and disorganized. Just to get the check at the end of the dinner took about 25 mins

Cheesecake factory at Northstar mall San Antonio. Not worth the money for the food. I ordered the angel hair pasta with grilled shrimp. I was expecting a decent amount of shrimp for the $19.95 dish. I got five medium size shrimp with the hand full of angel hair. The service was so so. We got our main course and the appetizer dishes were still left on the table till about halfway through our meal.

Today i was there with my friends for valantins day .food was delicious, lemonade was pretty good. <br>The service was horrible, starting seating ,to  having my cheesecake to go ..I got it up side down ..and sqweezed in a  broken box..I can tell the girll who prepared it to go was angry because the waiter khorkhe  he didn&#39;t tell her earlier yo make it to go..so she released her anger in my cake<br>We asked the waiter jorje to get us more bread ..But he never came back with some ... .so sad to waste valantins time  with such a bad service

Im not understanding the hype about this place. Yes the atmosphere is great and the staff i have NO complaints about but i have tried this place more than once and the food it so BLAND! Im convinced they use Ms. Dash seasoning because i taste not one lick of salt! However it is the Cheesecake Factory so they do have AMAZING CHEESECAKE! That is what keeps me a customer! Oh and i make sure i do not miss National Cheesecake Day :)

I went last night for my boyfriend&#39;s birthday. I askex for a booth so a gentleman adked me to wait 5 mins so that one could be cleaned. We get to the booth and I had to use the Cloth napkin that they wrap the silverware with to clean the seats. The floor under the booth was very dirty as well. I hesitated to put my feet on the floor. The restaurant tends to be a bit on the pricey side for certain items.The restaurant doesn&#39;t live up to its hype. The Galleria location always disappoints me. I love getting Strawberry Martinis but theirs is very weak (It barely has alcohol in it) at that location and costs $11.25. Our waitress Mackenzie was very helpful but she&#39;s not the bartender. I sent my Martini back because it was weak and she brought another one but it was no better. I kept it to keep confusion down. My boyfriend ordered 2 as well thinking that the next one would be better thsn the first, but was also a fail. I paid $33.75 for 3 of those. The food was good this time. I had no issues. The bathroom was so disgusting. I could not believe my eyes. All of the stalls were disgusting as well. I will post pics. I hope that they can clean up their acts up there. I&#39;m not interested in coming back to this location. I will stick to the Sugarland location where it is much cleaner and the drinks are worth my money.
They have excellent cheesecake.  Their recent change to their factory burger has been a let down.

I&#39;m finding that in Texas everything has some type of pepper / spicy flavor when I don&#39;t expect it.  I ordered two eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast around noon on a Saturday.  I expected the potatoes to be flavored, but my normal, plain scrambled eggs (not an omelet) had small chunks of green peppers? It was like whatever omelet or fried item was prepared on the griddle before my food wasn&#39;t properly cleaned off or was stirred into the eggs? Other than that most of the food tastes like any other Cheesecake Factory. Our tables were close together, I feel like I was on a date with the couple next to me and then a family sat down I could&#39;ve watched their kids, lol.  Service was excellent  so that was a plus.

All the workers were doing a fantastic job. My salmon and steak were over cooked so they threw them out but made another one asap which was good. Mothers steak was way overcooked and the managers offered to pay for her meal and was very professional and calm about it. Would totally recommend this place for dinner!

Man, I hate to write this review. I normally like Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to the one in Downtown Seattle dozens of times and had almost all good things to say but not here. Not Houston. I arrived around 9pm on a slow weekday and there was no one working the desk. I stood there for 5 minutes and not one employee came to seat me. Finally tired of waiting, I sat at the bar. The bartender deserves a 3 star on her own, and she did just enough to get what I needed but didn&#39;t or maybe couldn&#39;t do anything more. The food is where the worst disappointment was which is sad because if the food had been good, I still would have given a 4 star. Chicken and Biscuits. The biscuits were harder than Thor&#39;s hammer, and just as tasty while the chicken was bland (at least it was juicy and hot). The gravy was the worst though, it had the texture of oatmeal that had been overcooked and sitting under a heat lamp all day and had almost no flavor whatsoever. <br><br>I may have to look elsewhere on my travels when eating out. Sad times.

First they brought us the wrong order, then I waited almost an hour for my food to come. Other people in my party had already finished their food and I was still waiting. Does it take that long to make a turkey burger?  Obviously there&#39;s a management problem. I will not dine here again.

Horrible service!!!!!! <br>Food is good but service is just horrible! They take forever to bring out the food and apparently the bread is always in the oven. The lady at the dessert center is rude as hell. Don&#39;t come to this location!!!<br>Management is also terrible and don&#39;t know how to apologize. No customer service skills or manners at all.

Service, atmosphere and the food have gone down the hill in the Galleria Cheesecake Factory. I  Ordered Steak Diane it was not prepared like recipe at all. The whole place looks like it needs to be cleaned an a handyman needs to spend some time in there the staff leaves a lot to be desired too. Yuk will not return.

This is standard American food. Huge portions, pretty delicious cheesecake. So why 2 stars? Because I got some cheesecake to go, and I as the person behind the counter was putting my food in a bag, he decided that he was going to drop it. Yes, that&#39;s right. Drop it. And then he looked at me, obviously thought that I didn&#39;t see even though I was watching him, and put it back in the bag. Half of the topping of my original cheesecake was on the top. So half of my cheesecake was just boring cheesecake, and the rest was super delicious. <br><br>Looking back, I should have said something. &#34;HEY. I watched you drop my cheesecake. Replace it.&#34; But I didn&#39;t, and my annoyance has now transferred to my Yelp review.

I was on hold for 2 hours just trying to call and see if I left something there and then they hung up on me. Before when I was eating there the food was cold and the waiter made us water 40 minutes to get a single slice of cheesecake and made us water 40 minutes just to get served for drinks. When we made a complaint everyone just looked at us like we were stupid and laughed. Every time I&#39;ve gone here the service was horrible the only thing the waiters do right is bring me food and sometimes I doubt that they do that for some people. My friends had to wait 30 minutes longer than the rest of us to get his meal because they screwed up on 3 times and it took two different managers to come and take his order when all he did was ask for no sauce on his spaghetti and they couldn&#39;t even do that.

Just ordered cheese cake factory on uber eats. Over priced and terrible quality are understatement. My gf paid 16 dollars for a lean cuisine quality meal. I paid 20 for something even worse. The mashed potatoes state like they are powdered. Will never eat at cheese cake factory again.
Took over 35min to complete a Togo order of salad and some veggie sides? Really? This is just horrid

This is usually a great spot for a birthday celebration but not the last time I went. My group (fairly large, consisting of two families) arrived at the restaurant and were seated at around 7:10 PM. It took a good half hour to get our drink orders, by which point we were already ready to order food but our waiter immediately left after taking the drink orders. Cue more waiting. Appetizers and food arrived both at once at around 8:15. The drinks weren&#39;t as good as usual but the food was for the most part, pretty good with a few exceptions. The pasta was super salty and the hamburger buns were soggy but once again, the waiter was nowhere to be found until close to the end of the meal when he asked if everything was ok. The members of our party who had ordered the disappointing food items let him know of the issues but declined to have their meals remade since everyone else was finishing up their food. Cheesecake orders were taken relatively quickly (which we only ordered because our families had come together for a birthday celebration) and the meal finally ended after a long wait for the check at around 9:30. This was very disappointing not only because the wait times made the party pretty boring but also because some members of the party were looking forward to browsing the mall after dinner and could not due to spending so long at the restaurant.

Our servers QUINCY C failed to get us plates or silverware. And after we asked for them he got us plates only and we had to fitch our silverware from the table next to us. Plus He passed our table at least 3 time without refilling my drink which I had to ask for...and when I told him that it was hands down the worst service I&#39;ve had in my life, he was like &#34;oh that&#39;s too bad&#34; carelessly. I&#39;m never going back to that place even though I loved their cheesecakes

We came for dessert.  Our waiter spilled a water to start the evening and it took three trips to get it dried up.  There store was busy but the overall service was middling.  The cheesecake was far from the best we have had and prices a bit higher than some other places but not too bad.  They have a huge variety which was nice.  As I said it was busy.  Our table was being bussed while we were winding down which is disconcerting.  The check came with several to suggestions. The smallest starting at 22%. I&#39;m not excited about this place at all.

The worst customer service I&#39;ve ever had. The manager was so disrespectful, and then was told that this is exactly what my nachos are supposed to look like yet online it says that it comes with multiple sides?? Do your freaking job.

The food was good and the waitress was really sweet but it took us a long time to get our order. By the time she got our order we had lost our appetites and had to take most of it to-go!<br>Amazing red velvet cheesecake though!

Having been to other Cheesecake Factory locations, Las Vegas and San Antonio, I must say I was disappointed in this one. It was very busy for a Monday night but our stated 30 minute wait was actually only 20. Taking into account that the place was busy our wait time for drinks and food was long. Our waitress got the orders right but it took 15 minutes for drinks and 30 for our foo; we ordered tea and water and salads and a rare burger. My Cesaer salad was OK but the chicken had no season or taste really and I&#39;m the least pickest eater I know.<br><br>The are so many options in the area, I&#39;d suggest looking else, especially if in a hurry.

Our waiter was phenomenal but when asked to move to a different table the hostess came to up to us and in a very demeaning manor told us that next time this we&#39;re to happen we would have to get up and wait in line like everyone else waiting for a table and that it wasn&#39;t okay for us to just want to move that we should&#39;ve notified her when we arrived.

The cheesecake is the only reason I come here because the food is really just over priced frozen dinners and the drinks are over priced sugar-waters. I usually just order to-go (since I&#39;m only here for the cheesecakes) but what I really hate is that when i called ahead for to go pick up orders, I still have to stand in line behind 12 people that are indecisive AF and then when i get to the register to pick up my order, it&#39;s not even prepared and ready to go. (This just happened so my review went from 3 stars to 2). Management could really &#34;lean&#34; the process so they wouldn&#39;t get such crappy yelp reviews all the time due to their outstanding customer service (that&#39;s right, I see your 3 stars).

WOW what an awful experience. First off, dirty table should&#39;ve alerted us that this was going to be a bad experience. The servers were rude and neglected us, they lied that they had no bread when we watched them bring it to another table, it took twenty minutes to get a drink refill (and they weren&#39;t even busy, it was 6:00 on a Sunday when the mall was empty), our server straight up disappeared and when we asked another server for help he also never returned. The waitress threw our receipt books on the table without a word and we were afraid to take our leftovers because after the rude way we were treated, who knows if they did something to the food. I work in the mall but it&#39;s not like I get some sort of discount and if I&#39;m using my hard earned money to pay for a meal after work, I expect the same level of service I give guests in my store. Absolutely will NOT be back and will take my business to the Shake Shack downstairs where they&#39;re always nice and service is great!

Yikes. Get a reservation. We arrived around 1 on a Saturday. We needed a table for 5. It was so crowded there was no where for us to stand. We moved to the bar area and in doing so we didn&#39;t hear them call our name. They no longer have buzzers so listen carefully. We weren&#39;t seated until 2:10. <br><br>Menu is wonderful. They have anything you could want. And a nice skinny menu. Food portions are huge. You get complimentary bread and butter which was nice. <br><br>Had it not been so crowded we would have had a better experience.

I met a friend here for lunch on Good Friday and it was not too crowded.  We were seated upstairs and our server was nice and efficient.  I ordered a tomato basil flatbread pizza and crab balls and my food was quite delicious.  My friend ordered a salad that was no longer on the menu, but the staff went out of their way to make it for her which was really nice.  Parking was difficult as it is the Galleria, but I will return if someone else drives as the parking is too much for me to handle.

Horrible experience! I came to eat here yesterday and had a waitress named Rebecca. As soon as our waitress came out with the drinks and while passing out drinks to my table she spilled my tea on my head!!! My entire head and shirt were soaking wet and I had to cancel my plans for after dinner because my hairdo and outfit (brand new shirt!!) were completely ruined. I figured after this situation they would at least give me some sort of discount or offer a free appetizer or drink! But no! They made me absolutely no offer to compensate for the accident so I decided to speak  to the manager who gave me a mere $6 off!! What a joke! This place obviously does not care about customer service at all and we will never be returning to this location.

A bit crowded for a Thursday night so I can&#39;t image the crowd on the weekend. With that said management needs to work on waiting area which is extremely limited and unorganized. My children hate being in crowds and that&#39;s exactly where we ended up. Not cool, literally!! The view and the cheesecake were on point hence the 2 stars.

I guess things work differently in Houston. Same menu as Dallas. Here are the short list of issues. I ordered the Filet for my son, he likes it Med. I got Rare. We also had to ask for a knife twice for the steak.  I ordered a espresso with the drinks order to be brought out right away. It arrived with the check.<br><br>So bad service and food!! Not a good combination.

Terrible is the least I can say. <br>My husband went to get a to go order.  It took them an hour to give him cold fettuccine Alfredo and small baked potato soup.  When he got home they have forgotten to put in the bag the cheesecake he ordered and paid. I called to talk to them about their omission and they put me on hold for 15 minutes.

My boyfriend and I are in town for Free Press Summerfest, working. We&#39;re staying at the Westin Galleria and around 10pm we really wanted something sweet to eat. The hotels room service is not good choices with even worse prices. The mall closes at 9 so we&#39;re excited that there was a Cheesecake Factory still open!<br><br>My point is not to talk about quality. We&#39;re going there for cheesecake, obviously the quality is amazing! But the lady who worked the &#34;to go&#34; section was so nice. I wish we had gotten her name. We were chit chatting and it came up that it was my birthday tomorrow so when she gave me my order she told me there was a surprise inside that I wouldn&#39;t see until I got home. I got back to my hotel and saw their dollop of whipped cream included confetti and a candle. <br><br>I was touched. Thank you, and if you read this review I&#39;m so sad I didn&#39;t get your name but you&#39;re awesome!
Rene special is the best!! Good portion plate. Salad, sandwich and clam chowder soup. Great customer service!!!! I love this place.

We went up using the stairs. There was no one there to greet us. We had to wander around and figure out how to be seated. We were finally greeted and seated. The booth seats were covered in bread crumbs. I hate how they leave the silverware siting on the table. At least keep it wrapped in a napkin. The silverware always looks dirty. They gave us cold bread. The food was good; cleanliness and service not so much.

Love coming here due to its nice ambiance and varied menu. I was recently displeased with one of its staff that displayed such horrible customer service. I was completely in shock that they would allow it. This male (black) rarely checked on us, never refilled our drinks, and I even saw him &#34;peep&#34; on us from a distance. It was horrible and I frequent this place a lot and I&#39;ve never experienced that. I notified the manager and also contacted the company via email. There&#39;s something about customer service that I cannot ignore, the good and the bad.
Food is good but the waiting time is usually 30-45 mins, especially during weekends. <br><br>Traffic is always bad in the galleria area so avoid weekends.
Quick and friendly service. The waitstaff is excellent. I often come during my lunch break and they make sure to get me in and out on time. The portions are huge and the desserts are my favorite.
Great service, they are all very nice but what makes this place even better is chef Chuy!!! The best combination between kind people and exquisite meals in a family friendly environment.
Meal was great! Service was good.. Didn&#39;t even have room for dessert.. But the price of desert doesn&#39;t make me want to take it home either

Pretty good food. Wonderful staff usually just a little overcrowded normally.<br><br>One thing I love is they have great drink diversity. So it&#39;s always a good place to have small bites or a huge meal. Make sure to ask about seasonings on the pasta, they can be a little heavy on the seasoning.

The food here is pretty good. I have been here more than 3 times, none had disappointed me. I highly recommend the ahi tuna tartar, very delicious and refreshing. For dessert, kahlua cheesecake is the beasttt. <br><br>Everything is good, except for the service, the servers were attentive.
Food is so amazing here, went for Valentine&#39;s Day. Tons of food choices, amazing service from server and hostess. Great experience.
Horrible service and the food at this location seems to be sub par. The Cheesecakes however are still amazing so my recommendation just come to this location for dessert.

I&#39;ve recently become hooked to this place again. I definitely prefer this location over the Memorial City Mall location too. On my most recent visit, I did take out, and the girl who took the order was super, super nice, despite the place being incredibly busy as usual. Although I have had a few different things from this place, lately I&#39;ve been addicted to their spicy chipotle chicken pasta (at least I think that&#39;s what it&#39;s called) . It&#39;s SO GOOD!!!! I had to get cheesecake after having a staring contest with the display cases of cheesecakes, and got my usual Adams Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake. I love Reeses&#39; peanut butter cups, peanut butter, and Butterfingers, and this cheesecake has them all. I&#39;ve had plenty of other cheesecakes from here as well, but this one is my favorite yet. Both the food and cheesecake was super tasty as usual for me. The downsides would be how this place is always packed, but what can you expect when it&#39;s attached to the Galleria? Also, I was specifically asked if I wanted bread and butter to go, I said yes, but didn&#39;t get any. Still, I&#39;ll definitely be back.

Salmon over cooked. Service was good. <br>The most horrifying thing was opening a menu a seeing an advertisement for Dr. Guy Lewis!!! He&#39;s been sued and fined by the Texas medical board for substandard care MULTIPLE Times!!!!We were horrified to see that Cheesecake Factory would put its patrons in harms way. By running his ads in there menu.
Got the spicy chicken chipotle pasta.  Service was excellent. Never ran dry with my tea.   Then to top it off had the lemon meringue cheesecake pie slice.  OMG !!!!!!!!!! Sooooooooo good.

Great food, great service, I really enjoyed the lunch with friends and family. The Pecan cheesecake is my favorite cheesecake. <br>I always come back to this place, it is one of my favorite restaurants. I am very disappointed that the quality of the one in Sugar Land is so different.

We came here to celebrate one of our work colleagues birthday. We made a reservation for 10 people at 7pm, we showed up on time and still had to wait 20 min to be seated. <br>After we were seated we received very good service from our server and we were all happy with our food choices. Was a little dissapointed we had to waste almost 25 min.

Received a gift card for Christmas.So we decided to finally dine -in on a Wednesday night.<br>This was my first time here.The service was very poor.I ordered a Margarita, it was very watery.The food took forever!!! The service was poor and they didn&#39;t apologize.<br>Food was not tasty. I will not be returning.

I love this restaurant. Been to this location several times and have always been welcomed with great service. <br><br>The food is delicious and consistent, especially the dessert. One time I ordered a medium well steak and it came a bit over cooker. The waitress happily took it and apologized. The manager passed by and apologized as well and offered me a soup on the house while I waited as well as dessert afterwards. Amazing customer service especially when I didn&#39;t really complain. <br><br>I dropped a star for one reason, this location gets quiet busy given that its connected to a shopping mall. Waiting time could go up to an hour even for a party of 2. That&#39;s not why I dropped a star though. They have a whole ground floor which I have never seen them use no matter how busy it got (at least never when I was there).

I hadn&#39;t been to this location in a LONG time.  I&#39;m not particularly a fan of the ambiance b/c it feels a little too touristy for my tastes.  I went here last FRI for a 20 person birthday celebration.  I was pleasantly surprised that there were no major kerfuffles but, you know there&#39;s always ONE person in the group that puts up a stink. (she&#39;s THAT person, so you can disregard). <br><br>Also, I am always amazed at how large their menu is and how they are able to prep everything so quickly.  My partner had the stuffed chicken tortilla (which was basically an enchilada) which was very good considering he ordered it from &#39;Cheesecake&#39; and I had the shrimp club sandwich which should have more shrimp but that&#39;s just my own personal preference.<br><br>The servers were very proficient and made our experience really enjoyable.  Needless to say, the birthday boy was very happy and no one had to pay anyone else&#39;s bill.
Table for 12 please. ( Sunday 4:30 PM Jan 3rd.) <br><br>Manager : wait is 3 Hours. <br><br>Really? Seriously? Really? Is this a joke? <br><br>BTW, downstairs area was closed.

I ordered three diff pieces of cheesecakes. Red velvet, tiramisu, and white chocolate raspberry truffle. All good, but a little too sweet for my plain tongue. The size is very big, I can feed myself with one velvet cake

Unfortunately I can&#39;t give a 1/2 a star so now there&#39;s 1. Worst service ever you would think something in the gallery a would offer a lot better and when I received on my niece&#39;s birthday. Stay away go to a different restaurant

Sometimes the Cheesecake Factory is just the spot. Ordered the kids lunch upfront - delicious bow tie pasta with butter and parmesan. I stole (more than a) few bites, it was simple, yet really good. My chicken tacos were good, can&#39;t speak of the side of black beans because my 1 year old ate them all. Service was slow and the upstairs/downstairs set up was confusing (and led to a parade of hungry guests by our table).

Tough to skip...<br>Well cheesecake is one reason to not hate being at the mall.<br>It&#39;s hard to go by without a taste.<br>Really, really, really, slow service. Otherwise 4 stars. Did I mention that the service was slow? And not for lack of employees. There had to be at least 4 girls behind the cheesecake counter. Just none of them seemed to care about actually getting the job done. It took over 20 minutes for us to get three pieces of cheesecake to go!!!
This place is the right place if you are looking for GREAT food and a atmosphere of family! And the cheesecake is worth the price! I really LOVE this place!
I had the BBQ chicken salad delivered to me via dinedash and my food was awesome as usual.  I am always very happy with what ever I receive from them and this was no exception.

I revisited this location on 4/13/17 and....THEY GOT IT RIGHT!   It was a Thursday night and a bit crowded but my son and I were seated promptly in Rebecca M.&#39;s section.  She immediately came to take our drink order.  When she came back we asked her about any new menu items to help is order.  She answered all of our questions, she was really on her A game.  Our appetizer and entrees came out at the appropriate times and she checked on us our entire time there and refilled our drinks WITHOUT us having to ask!  I rarely get the same server at CF but I will request her when we go back.  I pulled the manager to the side on our way to let him know how well we were treated and he said he said that he was pleased to hear that Rebecca did a great job.  Oh yea, and the food was good too, although I don&#39;t even feel like I have to mention that because the food is ALWAYS good.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! And this one is my favorite location. <br><br>Growing up, this was the only Cheesecake Factory in Houston (at least that I was aware of) and going here was a big deal. First of all, it&#39;s in the Galleria and that&#39;s exciting. But then it&#39;s kind of fancy and it has SO MANY kinds of Cheesecake! We went for birthdays and special occasions and it used to make me so excited. It still kind of does. <br><br>My most recent trip to The Cheesecake Factory was on a date (a third date) and that definitely affected my experience. So, keep that in mind if you keep reading. <br><br>It was MAGICAL!<br><br>Just kidding, but I legitimately do like Cheesecake Factory. The food is good, definitely not healthy, and comes in gargantuan proportions. Think like 3 meals per dish. My date and I both ordered pasta dishes and when they brought them to our table they looked more like serving bowls for an entire table. Sheesh. But I suppose that makes it more worth the money. I ate pasta for lunch for the next 2 days. <br><br>Then we shared 2 pieces of cheesecake - a peanut butter chocolate variety and a mango key lime. Both were amazingly delicious. And we had leftovers of that too!<br><br>I really like the brown bread they serve as well. Slightly sweet and so yummy. <br><br>The service is always great at The Cheesecake Factory. And the ambiance is fast-paced in an exciting way. It&#39;s probably all in my head, but I just feel like I&#39;m doing something special when I eat at this Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>So, yeah, it&#39;s unhealthy, it&#39;s a chain, it&#39;s not local or organic or trendy, and it can now be found in abundance in the suburbs. BUT CHEESECAKE!

From my understanding Cheesecake Factory is suppose to be a nice, tasteful, great service restaurant. However, one at the Galleria is the opposite. Service sucks, food comes burnt and sad enough people feel it&#39;s ok to serve burnt food which turns into an inconvenience. Definitely advise that management look into this because this is my 3rd visit here in hopes of improvement, unfortunately the quality of this restaurant is slowly going down.
The recipe for the fried Mac and cheese either changed or they&#39;re not up to par either way it tasted burnt, my bread attracted gnats to it and the spoon at my table was dirty.
Stopped by for a late dinner, everything was going good until my son pointed at the floor and there was a cockroach under the empty table next to us. We quickly asked for the check and left.

Great ambience. I&#39;ve tried several entree&#39;s from pastas to sandwiches. All were great. The desserts are worth every penny. Ambiance is nice and the location is conveniently situated inside the Galleria Mall.

We went for date night and had an excellent time.  The service was good and we enjoyed the food. Several items had changed on the menu since the last time we visited the restaurant. However our waiter was extremely helpful in helping us find items that were similar to our previous favorites.

Absolutely disgusting!  The table was filthy. When I asked the hostess if someone could clean the table she sighed, rolled her eyes, and said &#34;in a minute&#34;. She clearly was not interested in helping us so we left.

With a poorly composed novel of a menu, prices too high for an average weekday dinner, service too slow and young to compensate for the cost and a location smack-dab in the worst area in Houston for traffic and parking, you&#39;re gonna really have to do something to get me in the door. <br><br>That something comes once a year in the form of half price cheesecake. They&#39;ve always let me order 2 slices at half price. And for the amount of money spent on dinner and the time spent waiting, I damn well should get 2 half price slices.<br><br>But bring your hillbilly friends and family from out of town to this &#34;fancy&#34; two story restaurant located in a &#34;glamorous&#34; mall and they&#39;ll be convinced they&#39;ve died and gone to heaven and that you are the classiest person to walk the earth.

We usually go to Grand Lux but we wanted to switch things up. Never again!! Both our orders were wrong and our fries were cold. When my friend got her burger back the bacon on it was stone cold. Not a pleasant experience at all. The server let the manager know we were unhappy and the manager offered us free cake to go which is the only reason I&#39;m giving them 2 stars instead of one. Even though they didn&#39;t have the cake we wanted. Just walk across the street and go to Grand Lux.
The experience i had here was phenomenal. Our waiter was out of this world! <br><br>The lunch portions are huge FYI!

I have never been to Cheesecake Factory so I decided to try it out in the Galleria today. I waited with my family at the bar until our table was ready. Bar service I will say, was excellent. <br>Once we got seated it took almost 30 min just to get bread. And once we ordered food, that took awhile. I understand serving gets hectic and server sections get busy but I saw my server a total of twice. I ordered a drink that never came until I was near leaving. I had to ask where the server was multiple times. <br>Food was fantastic but service on the other hand, was not. Very unhappy with service and I myself am a server.

Biggest train wreck experience. Went here on a date and we ordered simple- a burger and a chicken sandwich w/ fries. When we initially sat down the place was packed. 30 minutes passed and we still had not gotten our order. We put in a complaint and 30-40 minutes later the food comes out when I notice my burger is well done instead of medium well so I have to return it. At this point everyone who sat after us were already gone. Waited another 25 minutes and the burger finally came out but at this point I did not want it anymore so I returned it. When a waitress brought the check she had not even voided the burger.  Thanks cheesecake factory.

Our waiter was good but other servers were very unprofessional holding mutiple things in their hands without trays. I ordered eggplant parm and it was cold and barely cooked. Manager came to send it back. When it came out again, it was still just as bad. This is the worst Cheesecake location I&#39;ve ever been to.

Our Waitress name is Kristin She was super sweet very attentive our food was brought fast and hot I had two drinks both delicious I will for sure come back to try the cheesecake but this time around I was full with what I ordered. Over all a great experience

Horrible staff.  Very sloppy, unorganized, unprofessional, rude.  We went somewhere else that treats guests with respect, and warm welcoming.  <br>Extremely disappointed, and will never return, even if they pay me.

Ok.. I don&#39;t write reviews and I like going to The Cheesecake Factory but this one... oh my lord. My fiance and I came in and got seated right away, our waitress greeted us and took down our drink orders and went on her way. Sitting next to us were 2 women who seemed to be having a problem with what they had ordered and I&#39;m guessing the manager or whatever was helping them out (the same lady who brought us to our seats, so maybe she was the host?) We got our drinks and my fiance had finished his and was given a refill by our waitress who just kind of plopped it on the table and left. 10 minutes go by and I&#39;m sitting there hungry waiting for that magical complimentary bread and butter to show up and it doesn&#39;t, another 10 minutes go by and our waitress walks by us and doesn&#39;t even stop to let us know if our food is almost ready yet or not. So by this time the 2 ladies who were next to us had already left and a new group of people came in. (one of them didn&#39;t even finish their food because something was wrong so she ordered a dessert to go, it came on a plate and she had to tell them she was getting it to go... manager/host did a goof job there. *sarcastic* and yes I was eavesdropping cause there was no bread and butter to catch my attention) my fiance sees the lady who was dealing with the 2 ladies before and asks if we can get some bread and she says yes she&#39;ll get some. We see her walk to the place where they&#39;re cooking, thinking she or someone would bring us some but nope. So 20 minutes have gone by and no bread, another 5 minutes have gone by and we see the lady walking around and still no bread or news about our food. And my patience just drops waaaayy down and I see a guy at the desk area and I tell him that we&#39;ve been sitting for over 20 minutes with no bread and we have no idea when our food will be out or where our waitress is and he says he&#39;ll get her right away. So I sit down, she&#39;s taking drink orders from the new group of people next to us and comes over and says &#34;what did you want?&#34; And i said &#34;oh, i just wanted some bread&#34; and she says she&#39;ll go get some. Like wtf....what about my food. So bread comes and a few minutes the food comes out too. I got the shrimp scampi and steak diane combo thingy and it comes with mash potatoes and it&#39;s $21.95 or something. PEOPLE IT IS NOT WORTH IT! i got 3 little pieces of meat mixed with shiitake mushrooms and onion, 3 shrimps (shouldn&#39;t the shrimp scampi have some sort of pasta at the very least?) And i got a whole not fully cooked potato in my mashed potatoes, my fork barely cut through. My food was cold but after all that waiting I was just happy there was some sort of food in front of me. I did ask our waitress to get me another side of mashed potatoes and I was like... if she charges me for this I will explode. But at least the burger my fiance got was good. I ordered a slice of chocolate cake to go cause i didn&#39;t want to be there any longer, and when i opened to eat it in the car it was this thin slice. In conclusion I&#39;m never going here again. No wonder there was no line here, should&#39;ve waited for Shake Shack.
I will never go back. The busser threw the crumbs from off the table and seats into the floor. Absolutely horrible!

I wanted to place an order to go and when I got to the cashier counter. Some employees were having a conversation about a fake $50 bill and I heard everything because I stood there without been notice for a while. It took time for the girl to ask me what I wanted. I gave her a $100 bill and she gave me a $50 bill which I knew it was the fake one they were talking about. Very disappointed about this experience, they sure need to improve in customer service period.

The first time I was here wait was a bit long but I brushed it off. The second and probably last time I was there was for my birthday dinner wait to get our order taken after we were seated was about 30 minutes and we had to keep asking our waiter for everything which was frustrating. After we placed our order it took another 30 minutes then the food was brought to us except mine I was told it was accidentally given to the wrong person. So I had to wait another 20 minutes for my food by the time it came out I wasn&#39;t hungry anymore since I had picked at my friends food. I got it boxed to go. The manager did stop by to apologize and gave me free dessert but I just feel that it all starts with the waiter if he would of been on top of his orders we could have avoided these problems. Live the location hate the wait.

This review is not about the food or drinks!  I have always loved The Cheesecake Factory, but today the service was below par for what I am used to receiving here so SERVICE is what my review is about.  <br><br>I decided to eat here today for Sunday brunch and invited my best friend and her husband who are from Orlando.  I know there are plenty of Cheesecake Factory restaurants, but my best friend and I love The Cheesecake Factory and the Galleria area, so why not bring him here so they can eat delicious food while enjoy the view of Uptown Galleria area?  Well, we were seated by the hostess in a booth by the stairs on the second floor across from the elevator.  I asked if we could move closer to the window, but the hostess said they were reserved, but I thought that was odd because The Cheesecake Factory normally does not take reservations, unless I have been lied to every year when I plan to have my birthday dinners there and we all had to get there super early to get a table because I was told they do not take reservations.  <br><br>There were small parties and some booths that were occupied near the windows, so we did not understand why they told us those tables were reserved.  We asked another hostess again just in case maybe the other hostess did not understand us the first time.  This time we were told that since it was still early (11AM on Sunday and they open at 10AM) they were understaffed so they couldn&#39;t seat us at those tables.  It was still puzzling, but we didn&#39;t want to make a scene about it.  It was disappointing to eat at a beautiful restaurant and not get to enjoy the views.  We came early with intentions that we could get a good table with a nice view and beat the rush, but instead we were not rewarded.  A few minutes into our meal, the tables by the windows were occupied.  <br><br>I really don&#39;t understand what the issue was as to why we could not have been seated near a window, but I hope that in the future, the staff could be more understanding and give a better explanation for why guests cannot be seated where they request to be seated.
This place is extremely  busy but i love the varietg of options  to eat here... their bread basket and dessert *cheesecakes* are my favorites

Waited 10 minutes to be seated as servers passed us by. After being seated we waited another 15 minutes to be greeted while three tables that were sat after us were greeted and orders were placed. We decided to leave after an addition 10 minutes went by. Not a good experience.

Worst place ever! <br><br>Horrible seating unless you like being crammed up against the wall with fruit flies circling around you and your food.<br><br>Wait staff neglected to bring sauce upon request, they said yes and never came back.<br><br>And to top it off I ordered a burger on a wheat BUN and they brought out a burger patty on TOAST?! <br>Worst. Never going back. <br><br>It&#39;s as if they expect tourist all the time at this location so they neglect their regulars.

Waited for over 45 minutes for kids pasta with butter and it was cold, dry, and sent it back. It took another 20 minutes to get a new order.  Just crappy service and highly overrated. All of the entrees were subpar for the cost of this place.

The staff is very nice. I ALWAYS get the Miso Salmon and tonight I was very displeased. The first time they brought it out the rice was very hard and dry. After they fixed that, there was another problem with my meal. The was still skin on the bottom of my salmon which made the rice, sauce, and fish taste horrible. It left a bad aftertaste in my mouth and ruined my appetite. I settled with the Lousiana chicken pasta to go but I was so upset because I was looking forward to that dish. My boyfriend refused to eat in front me so his food ended getting cold. Overall we had an unsatisfactory experience at the Galleria location. <br>We usually go to the Memorial location and everything is usually perfect so you can imagine how upset I was during this  visit. Our server was sweet as pie and the manager did take the time to give her apologies for the food. Though it will be a while until I come back to this location.

Went to this location today, and while the food was good our table was dirty when we sat down.  It was not busy, and there were greasy marks, and many &#34;sticky&#34; spots on the table and our bread plates.  I put my arms on the table and part of my skin stuck to the table when I picked it up.  I also noticed what looked like finger marks and butter smudges on my bread plate.<br><br>Can&#39;t complain about the food, especially the cheesecake.  And the variety is really hard to beat.  The Godiva chocolate cheesecake is just awesome.  Would have been so much of a better experience without the dirty table.  I didn&#39;t ask to be moved because that&#39;s such an annoyance for everyone once we&#39;ve already been seated with silverware, drinks, bread, etc.

Ugh I want to like Cheesecake Factory but the service.  Yesterday I visited the one in the Galleria.  Once we got there we entered from the lower level and there was  sign asking for you to walk upstairs so we walked upstairs and had to wait 20 min to be seated.  When we finally got seated took 15 min for someone to come by and ask for our drink order.  She was a sweet girl but she was either overwhelmed or just slow.  Our drinks took another 10 min to get to the table.  I was there with a friend and three children so you know how annoying it is to be hungry And have hungry children with you asking you when the food is coming.  When she brought the drinks we ordered our appetizers and the kids drinks.  Their meals came out one at a Time And all the meals were served by different bussers every time so there was not lack of help but there was a 5-10 min gap between each dish.  Finally my food came but not my friends food.  I placed a to go order at that time.  Everyone was half way done and she still hadn&#39;t received her food.  Our waitress finally showed up.  We asked about the food and she said &#34;let me check the window &#34;.  We finished our food And she still hadn&#39;t returned.  When we finally saw her return my friend told her please just cancel the order everyone is done eating.  She came back 5 min later with my to go order and my friends food and said &#34;the kitchen is backed up&#34;.  Sad. She said her manager told her to &#34;still bring the plate of the food and see if it can entice her to take it home&#34; really?.  I would reserve going to Cheesecake Factory on pay week by myself and only order appetizers.  It&#39;s expensive and I hate spending hard earned money somewhere that the service just isn&#39;t up to par.  I enjoyed my meal but did not enjoy the interactions in between or the wait.

Basically a Chili&#39;s with a 100% markup. Their bread is better than most food on the menu. The menu suffers from too-much-itis or a hodgepodge of food that would probably give the world&#39;s best chefs a headache. <br><br>People come here for any random event so be sure to reserve a table around Valentines Day, Mothers Day, etc.<br><br>The waiters are great and attentive.<br><br>You&#39;re basically paying for the fancy interior.

My friends and I waited 2 hours to be seated, which is understandable for a group of 14 people. HOWEVER, they split us up into two tables that were across the room from each other! Awesome Christmas dinner with the friends cheesecake... NOT!
Always like to go here. Staff is nice. I know they are busy so i will wait. Chessecakes in general are just great. Nothing to different here,

We loved the restaurant until 7/3/18 my sons burger came out undercooked after I specifically asked them to make it well done. It was also the second instance this occurred. The chicken Marsala tasted like it was on the menu at the hospital. The restrooms were beyond horrible. Someone barfed in the first stall and the second stall some one pooped everywhere.

I really wish I can give this place 0 stars. I have been going to Cheesecake Factory for many years and always loved my visit. The last few times I visited this location, this is NOT the case. My best friend and I decided to go grab a late dinner, around 9 ish. We arrived no later than 9:15 and were seated upon arrival, I had a feeling it was going to go south once the host walked us all the way to the back, where no one was seated. Got to the table and we&#39;re waiting for our drink orders to be taken, no one seen until 9:40. Order our drinks and no one for another 20 minutes, no bread or anything. Finally order around 10:15, food arrived at 10:55. We had 3 different people &#34;serve&#34; us each time with a TERRIBLE attitude. Ordered desert, got it at 11:15, cheesecake WARM AND MELTED. Waited to pay for another 20 minutes and finally left at 12:10. Terrible service, I shouldn&#39;t have to spend 3 hour to get a &#34;quick&#34; meal. Steer far from this terrible place!

This is a really clean and friendly location. The food was wonderful and our waiter was accommodating and attentive. I will definitely come here again. And obviously if you like cheesecake you need to come here.

We had heard that the Cheesecake Factory was a great restaurant. It was pretty bad. My daughter ordered the shrimp with angel hair pasta. There was so much tomato on it you couldn&#39;t find the pasta. The shrimp served with it was lukewarm and way over cooked. It was rubbery and had not been shelled nor deveined correctly. I had the Avacado egg rolls and they were also served at room temperature. Everything needed salt and lacked flavor. My daughter ordered a Carmel macchiato and even that was served just warm. The macchiato and the bread placed on the table were the best part of the entire meal. What a disappointment.

Ordered the chicken chili to go. The rice was mixed in with the chili so of course my rice arrived soggy. I have never had rice mixed in with sauce in a to go order.  I also did not received my complimentary bread as requested.
Fantastic Louisiana chicken pasta! Not on our menu in CA, but a must try if you are in TX. <br><br>Typical Cheesecake Factory setting

I couldn&#39;t in all honesty give it 4 stars today thanks to my inattentive server. I ordered iced tea and never received sweeteners until after my food arrived. I was never offered the complimentary bread which is a highlight of coming here. I didn&#39;t get offered a refill on my tea until after I finished my meal! I&#39;m sorely disappointed in what&#39;s been a favorite of mine since it opened.

A good friend of mine who is a chef just dropped some knowledge on me. I always enjoys cheesecake factory but didn&#39;t realize that everything is pretty much made in house. That&#39;s impressive considering the menu is 200 pages long. Great experience as always

Hostess usually have a bad attitude, the food comes out fast sometimes, but sometimes you wait for 30-40 mins.  They don&#39;t put much meat in there dishes.  Only thing good about this place is the desserts.  Everything else just sucks.  I&#39;ve given up eating finally.  I&#39;m done.  I DO NOT recommend this place to my family and friends.

I love this Cheesecake Factory! My husband and I both order off the skinny menu. We both started with the beet and goat cheese arugula salad that was perfectly dressed. Sometimes salads can be drenched in dressing, but this was not the case. I had the Asian chicken lettuce wraps. They were messy to eat due to the nature of a lettuce wrap, but the flavors were a great combo of sweet and salty. My children. Had spaghetti and meatballs and it was very savory, unlike most kids meals. For the finale, the tuxedo layered cake/cheesecake was worth that pound I gained eating it! It was sweet and rich and wonderful.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.<br>Food is, as the French say, &#34;merde.&#34; The chicken on the chicken bellagio tasted like rubber. I wouldn&#39;t be surprised if they heated it in the microwave and threw it on a plate. The pasta in the Pasta da Vinci was so dry. And the fact that the service was terrible and the waiter only brought water every 20 minutes didn&#39;t exactly help wet the palate. For the price, this may be one of the worst places I&#39;ve ever been. Given the amount of good, local restaurants in Houston, I&#39;m embarrassed that I ate here.
Excellent service and very friendly. If you come here ask for Anjienette. She will treat very well!!

I don&#39;t think a review is necessary.  This is a staple chain.  It&#39;s pretty reliable.  For those you who have not been or consider this a date spot, you should go.  It&#39;s a fairly large menu and nothing on the menu will taste bad.  You&#39;ll enjoy the atmosphere and gain weight from the cheesecake.  <br><br>Pro tip: be careful walking around.  The floor seems to be slick sometimes, or at least that&#39;s been my experience.

Was there last night, the attendant did not write the oreder and thats why he forgot some :) <br>I did say nothing and when I was done I reminded him then he said I did it intentionally coze u ordered a lot of food!!<br>What a liar <br>Desserts were fantastic unlike the main dishes

Came in on a busy night last night w my 3month old daughter and pregnant best friend. Upon entering by the cheesecake displays she slipped (NOT fell.. She just slid a bit and caught her herself) she got pretty upset, so I told one of the employees there&#39;s a slippery spot and she said &#34;ok&#34; and kept walking. We waited about 10-12min before being seated. I ordered the pasta with meat sauce and got the stomach virus from it. &amp; my 3month old daughter got sick with congestion and cough. Never again! Did I mention that when going to the bathroom my friend slid AGAIN!?<br><br>Called to let them know about my experience and she conveniently couldn&#39;t find my receipt in the system and asked for my address to &#34;get something sent out to you in the next couple of days&#34;.. How about paying my co-pay for the hospital visits, or helping me take care of a sweet 3month old baby girl. <br><br>Ugh!! Only thing good about last night was our darling waitress, Jeanette. (Think that&#39;s how it&#39;s spelled)<br>She was the ONE STAR of the night.

First time at the Cheesecake Factory and I was very impressed.  People there have a true service attitude and the meal was delish.  I had the miso salmon at the recommendation of our awesome waitress Heidi.   And my coworker had the herb crusted fish.  Both were amazing and don&#39;t forget the bread hot fresh and soft as well as the avocado rolls.....YUM YALL.  Thank you Frontier for paying for my company meal because it WAS NOT WASTED.  Oh, and a shout out to Justin..... (told ya I would mention you!)  He was delightful as well.

Shame. I love the Cheesecake Factory but this experience deserves 1 Star. Came here with my uncle and we waited at the host stand for awhile till someone greeted us. When we were sat we waited some more until our server came over to get out drink order. I have no idea what his name is but he was pretty lifeless and just does not look like he enjoys his job at all. We ordered our meal. I got the southwest chicken sandwich with a salad and my uncle got the stuffed cheddar burger. Took forever to get out meal. A table that was sat after us and ordered way after us got their meal before we did. Anyways, my uncles burger wasn&#39;t even stuffed and my sandwich was uneven in portioning. Half of my sandwich had avocado and the other half didn&#39;t. My salad I spit out cause it wasn&#39;t even clean it tasted like dirt. So gross. When I complained to the server he about the burger he just was like &#34;it&#39;s not my fault the kitchen doesn&#39;t pay attention&#34;. I was like what! He didn&#39;t even send over a manager to apologize let alone apologize himself. Such a disappointing experience here today!

For this to be a nice restaurant they certainly didn&#39;t not think about people who make orders to go. They want us to park in the garage downstairs which I find ridiculous when I can park nearby the door just to pick up my order or maybe have someone bring it down for those that order to go. My husband loves this place but it was stupid packed and I couldn&#39;t find any parking and valet wouldn&#39;t let me park just to grab my food that only would&#39;ve taken 2min.  I circled around more than 15min and I couldn&#39;t continue because then my food would get trashed then I&#39;ll have to wait an additional 45min. Make a lane for to go or hire a to go server!

Good:<br>The food was DELICIOUS!! Everything came warm and tasted really good. <br>Bad:<br>The service starting from the rude and hungover looking hostess to the waitstaff was TERRIBLE!! The friendliest of all were the bust boys cleaning up around us. Our waitress was very apologetic the whole time we were there, but come on...if you are having to apologize every time you come to the table...something is WRONG! Our appetizer arrived like 2 minutes before our food...and even thought it was really good (the salmon firesticks) we kinda had to eat it quick to try and clear plates on the table and make room for our entrees.....Oh but you know what DID come right on time with no wait or stalling??....the to-go boxes and check. Felt like they were trying to kick us out and on to the next! This is my third time there and the service has been bad every single time!

Yesterday we wend to have a dinner. Because we were in a rush we ordered our cheesecake to-go. Our waitress brought it on the plate. We nicely pointed out that we was going to take it to-go.<br>We live 1 min away and after open box at home we found out she put cheesecake with strawberries and cream on the bottom so looked terrible. <br>Very poor service considering tips we left for her.<br>I would recommend go to one in memorial- pretty nice service all the time.

I just don&#39;t get what Houstonians see in this place - except for maybe dessert.  <br><br>The majority of their food is okay, but that&#39;s about it.  I&#39;ve ordered pasta dishes and found a few different types of pasta floating in with my entree - this doesn&#39;t really inspire me with confidence where their food quality is concerned.  It really makes me think that it is just like McDonalds, but you sit down to eat and the food is on a plate.  The menu never actually changes either - just the names of the items (our waitress told us this) or the pretty pictures of desserts scattered inside and out.<br><br>The portions are huge.  If you have anything else to do while you are at the Galleria and know you won&#39;t be bringing any leftovers home, then most of the pasta, salad, and dinner entrees will be a waste of money for you.  If you want to leave the table without feeling bloated, then try a sandwich or burger with a small side-salad instead of the fries.  I did this for the first time on this visit and it is the first time I&#39;ve left the restaurant and felt like I could continue to walk around comfortably.  <br><br>The best thing about the Cheesecake Factory is that if I want a slice of cheesecake I can walk in, get my slice of cake to-go, and then walk out.  That&#39;s about it.  Otherwise, it&#39;s just a typical mediocre chain.

Good:<br>The food in general is consistent across all Cheesecake Factory restaurants, that is not necessarily what i am reviewing.  <br>Clean tables, clean restrooms<br>Always love the Santa Fe Salad<br><br>Bad:<br>The service.  The hostess on Sunday morning (Jan 19, 2014) were very rude.  The fact that I had a stroller (in a mall, mind you) was inconveniencing them greatly.  They were rude to me and I will never dine there with my family again because of that.

Turrible... Absolutely turrible. We were seated literally so close to another group that we could were commenting on their conversation.<br><br>Then we asked to move to a booth and the booth was dirty, along with the silverware. <br>The waiter kept forgetting things like water and bread. He was too close to my face when taking my order and his breath made me lose my appetite. There was also a lot of fruit flies in the restaurant.<br><br>The silverware was dirty and the bottom of the plates of our appetizer had food debris stuck on it. To make matters worse, the food wasn&#39;t good. The only saving grace was the cheesecake, which I think they now sell at SAMs club so I won&#39;t be back. <br><br>Disappointing because I used to like this place. I&#39;ll be a Grand Luxe.<br><br>PS the bathroom was so dirty it was like an outhouse. Do better Cheesecake, do better!!

Don&#39;t be fooled by The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s grand appearance.<br><br>I have received poor service here several times so I will usually not come here at my own will. It&#39;s open late, and the location is convenient, those must surely be the only reasons why it&#39;s so packed. The dishes here are mediocre calorie bombs. The cheesecake is good, but I&#39;ve had better. <br><br>Service was particularly terrible on our most recent visit. My burger was cold, my friend&#39;s chicken was lukewarm, and my husband&#39;s appetizer was so hot, I almost burned my fingers when I reached for a portion of it. My friend asked for lemon for her water and more bread, and we received neither. My fries weren&#39;t delivered until much later, and the server dashed off so fast, I couldn&#39;t even ask for ketchup. Seriously, who eats fries without condiments? Drinks were never refilled, I ended up giving my friend half of my glass of water. At the end of our meal, we asked for our checks, and the server just tossed them on the table. Not even a &#34;thank you for dining with us&#34;, or &#34;have a good night&#34;. Mind you, it was NOT a busy night, and it&#39;s not like we were here during the dinner rush.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is the most overrated restaurant in Houston, and this is the worst $30 I&#39;ve spent in a long time.

I gave them two stars because of their delicious cheesecakes and fried macaroni balls. Regardless of the small  pros, being jammed in their long banquet style benches where the table that you sit on is going to to be a rough foot diameter of personal space. I apologize but that just makes awkward staring contest with people next to you. Well maybe they have their own technique and the goal is for guests to communicate with one another..<br><br>It&#39;s not workinh

I come here every so often-service is typically fast and on point. However, today&#39;s meal was a little off. I ordered the veggie melt , which claimed to come with artichoke, kale, tomato, roasted red pepper and herbed goat cheese. I received a provolone, mushroom, and zucchini sandwhich. I was confused and disgusted to say the least... our waiter quickly fixed it for us without charge though which I greatly appreciated. Next time you order this, make sure they include all the listed ingredients. I have seen other reviews complaining about the same exact problem regarding this dish, so eat at your own risk.
Didnt like the seating, too many people bunched together no privacy. The food was really good, really recommend it.

Terrible communication.  It&#39;s busy on a Saturday night, I understand. But, to be told a 20-30 minute wait to wait longer then be moved by the stairs to wait 5 more then to be handed a ticket and sent downstairs only to have someone sitting at the table you were supposed to be seated at. Then to wait longer. The downstairs manager was trying hard but after finally being seated we had no server for an additional 5 minutes. We left. It&#39;s not worth $20 for a plate of pasta of the service has that many bad omens for the night. 2 stars because it&#39;s been better before - but not this time.

The food is usually good and at a fair price but calling to place a order is ridiculous. I had to call 3 times and was left on hold for over 15 minutes and by that point I decided to place a order for my lunch else where. You would think they would make it an easy process like every other restaurant in this mall and allow for orders online.

Grandiose (adjective): characterized by affectation of grandeur or splendor or by absurd exaggeration.<br><br>That would be a good starting description for The Cheesecake Factory. This particular location is large, two floors, and always crowded. The inside architecture/design reminds me of the ridiculous dining rooms on Carnival Cruise ships. All around over the top. To go along with the over the top interior design, the menus are filled with a crazy variety of foods. <br><br>The Food:<br>First, there is a lot of variety (from pizza, to tacos, to steaks, to pastas, to everything else). Second, the food is probably more costly than it should be. Paying almost 20 dollars for chicken/cheese pasta is a little on the expensive side. The price may be proportional to the portion size, which is very large. I think it would be better if they made the portion smaller, and lowered the price to match the size. Beyond the pasta, I&#39;ve had their pizza, burgers, steaks, pork chops, and chicken. Whoa, I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory too many times. The food has not been terrible, it just has not been memorable.<br><br>And the Cheesecake:<br>The Cheesecake Factory wins the prize for having the worst tasting cheesecake flavor/combination I&#39;ve ever had.... Key Lime Pie Cheesecake. It was bad, but maybe it was my fault for ordering something like Key Lime Pie Cheesecake. Go ahead, say &#34;Key Lime Pie Cheesecake&#34; out loud. Sounds terrible doesn&#39;t it? Ignoring the above, the other cheesecakes I&#39;ve tried were not bad. Strawberry, Oreo, Snickers, Raspberry, Cherry, etc. They are 7-8 dollars, large, and easily shareable between two people.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory must be doing something right though. They are always packed. I can&#39;t say that I&#39;ve ever had bad service. Sometimes slow service, but I can see why given the volume of people in the restaurant(s) when I&#39;ve been there. I&#39;ve been many times, though I must say that it&#39;s never been my idea to go!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory tries to do too much and fails at having anything memorable. It is definitely average... but average should not cost this much. Somewhere between 2-3 stars.

Service was pretty average, nothing out of the ordinary except for the fact that we asked for a booth and was seated and a half booth half table and we asked to move as the waitress gave us a dirty look. Silverware was dirty and we had to ask for replacement silverware other wise the food tasted good but I wouldn&#39;t come back to this cheese cake ever it was one of my worst Cheesecake Factory experiences I&#39;ve ever had...

I have been to this location 3 times in the past 6 months. Every time I have received bad service. I&#39;m not sure if the service is due to bad mgt or the wait staff. I understand this is a tourist location but come on. <br><br>1st bad experience host told us 15 min. That ended up to 1hr and half. Then the waiter forgot my sisters food<br><br>2nd bad experience there was no wait but might as well been. Took us about the same to get our food. <br><br>3rd bad exp. utensils were dirty(2 sets). They where out of cokes. Rude wait staff. I could go on but my food finally got here.  <br><br>I do not know why I keep coming back here maybe because I get gift cards from family.

Despite a bad experience years ago and an unanswered letter to head office, I went to CF with a friend for lunch yesterday. I should have trusted my instincts. It was absolutely one of the worst food experiences again.<br><br>I ordered a skinny vegetable salad with chicken. My friend ordered a Tuna Tatiki appetizer.<br><br>Both look tired and of extremely poor quality. My salad was not per the menu. No roasted beet, but added celery and corn. The lettuce was dark and brown, the apple chunks were brown also. I asked the over-worked waiter and he told me on 3 occasions that the manager would be over. After 15 minutes had passed, I stood up to find the manager at the host table assigning tables. Is that his job? I tried to attract his attention, but after 5 minutes back in my seat, no sign of the manager. The waiter offered us to cover my meal and a free cheesecake slice (which I didn&#39;t want as I had just ordered a salad). We finally got up and left without paying.<br>It turns out the Cheesecake Factory hasn&#39;t got much better in 5 years and I wont ever be going back.

I ordered Evelyn&#39;s pasta with no mushrooms, o to be served mushrooms as well as mom cooked pasta. Sent it back with the waiter &amp; I swear they gave me back the same food but just took out the mushrooms. The pasta was still hard &amp; half of the broccoli was burnt. I like the grand lux way better

Celebrating a birthday went totally wrong. Started out seating a table of 14 - 3 children and 11 adults. Our server was nice but I believe a bit overwhelmed, as he had 3 -4 tables with large seating.  Never the less, he was really trying. What was sincerely an accident, he spilled 2 Patron Margaritas on 2 of my guest and inside the purse of one, vintage Louis Vuitton purse with wallet and 3 phones. Management came over, but very nonchalantly handed them a incident form and a gift card. It got worse as we begin to order food and drinks which were delayed if not forgotten all together, some got theirs ... some didn&#39;t. We asked for bread and waited patiently, only to find that the table that came in after us received 2 trays fully stacked, while we were still waiting.  It was a night to remember, to say the least. Our server committed an accident however, I don&#39;t feel he received the assistance he needed to make this event better.  AND....even after the bill came, we had to remove some items that were credited to the offended parties as directed by the manager. The birthday dinner was markedly marred by these incidents. I hope there will be some  sensitivity training given and received.
Perfect service for me and my wife. It was the best Valentine&#39;s Day ever. Thank you CCF.

I really wanted to hate this place ( tired of hearing, oh you gotta try it). <br>Holy shite, I freakin luv it!<br>Their spin on The Steak Diane is fabulous! Pasta dishes are kick azz!<br>Not sure which cheese cake is my favorite ( still experimenting with that).<br>The Galleria location is my favorite at the moment, but I will try The Clear Lake/ BayBrook Mall location on my next visit.
Seated in less than 5 minutes at a crowded mall on New Years Day! Fast, hot food and great service!

It was our first time trying something other than the original cheesecake and I am in LOVE with this place again! That&#39;s right you can never go wrong at The Cheesecake Factory! If you&#39;re a chocoholic like me you can try the Oreo dream extreme or the Hershey&#39;s cheesecake - I don&#39;t know what heavenly ingredient they add to their cakes that makes it out-of-this-world yum! Keep it between your tongue an palate for a few seconds and it literally melts - cheesygasms I tell u haha! The place is super overcrowded but lovely ambience! <br><br>P.S somebody who was once cheesecake-allergic.<br>Ty Cheesecake Factory!

Probably my last time coming here. I was here on a Saturday night and we were sitting on the balcony. We had a pretty good view of the stairs. As we were having our dinner, I saw a server walking down the stairs with a cup of French fries in her hand. Suddenly, I saw her take a French Fry! I don&#39;t know if she was taking the fries to the break room(?) or if she ordered the fries herself(?). Nevertheless, I was shocked that she would be doing something like that in the middle of the restaurant where everyone could see her. I also never get the best service which is understandable considering how busy this place gets but my goodness. It was just horrible last night. Waitress did not pay us any attention. It took a long time for her to come and take our orders. When our food finally arrived, I wanted tabasco bc I pretty much cannot live without it but our waitress pretty much disappeared on us. By the time she finally came back with tabasco, my food was getting cold. The friend I was dining with did not get a refill on his water. It came to the point where he was so thirsty, I just let him have some of my drink.
Forgot my leftovers in the restaurant - hurried back to get them and they ended up in the trash...the manager was so sweet to remake a portion of what I had with no charge. Love it!

The cheesecake factory is a strong chain of restaurants and I was pleased to see they still have costumer service as a priority. I ordered a Caesar salad and wild mushroom soup that I was pleased with, and my friend got the fried shrimp platter and a spinach artichoke dip. All the dishes were good, but I must say the Caesar salad was the best. Our server was kind and helpful. The only reason I took one star off was because the hosts did not acknowledge us upon our arrival and continued their own conversation for a short amount of time.

This was probably the best meal of my life. We ordered a mix of seafood pasta, with shrimp, calamari and a perfect cooked white fish. Needless to say, their cheesecake is the best of all times. New York style we went, just the plain simple and original cheesecake. Make sure to arrive early so you don&#39;t have to wait long for a table.

I&#39;ve been to one other Cheesecake Factory location in another city, but this one is definitely more upscale. First off, it&#39;s located in the Galleria shopping center. And it&#39;s 2 stories! But it&#39;s location means this restaurant gets pretty crowded in the evenings. When I went, we had to wait for about 15 minutes and there wasn&#39;t a good waiting area. It sure was fancy inside though!<br><br>As for the meal itself... I always eat too much of the yummy wheat bread appetizer and I think we asked for about 2 or 3 refills (the waitress might have been annoyed). My friend ordered some kind of Mexican salad with chicken and cheese and peanut dressing which was huge; she said it was really good and didn&#39;t even finish the entire portion. I ordered a salad with salmon which was pretty average. The salmon was slightly dry. Definitely not worth the $15 I paid. We didn&#39;t end up getting cheesecake but I&#39;ve had it before and it&#39;s really good - super rich and creamy! One slice is wayyyyy more than enough for one person. I&#39;d say 2-3 people can share so at $7 a slice, it&#39;s a good deal! All the flavors I&#39;ve tried I&#39;ve liked but my favorite flavor is the red velvet. <br><br>In my opinion, Cheesecake Factory is pricy for what the food is but the cheesecake is worth coming for with a friend!

A standard restaurant as everybody know. There is not bad but not good enough for 4 stars. The service is slow today and have to ask for bread. My Ahi tatar is pretty sour today. Overall, i give 3 stars.

i usually go to Cheesecake Factory, for their great Cheesecakes, parking kinda tight you need to pay for Valet or park in the galleria, but keep in mind galleria closes an hour before Cheesecake Factory. service always great, great manager as well he had change my order because it had different taste from last time I had it.

Have been to the Cheesecake Factory in the DFW area several times, and have always enjoyed it.  Saw this one in Houston, and after a day of having mediocre food, we thought we&#39;d eat here because they are consistently good.  Both my dinner and my husband&#39;s dinner were delicious.
