Set down and the silverware had food caked on it.  The plates had food caked on it as well. Disgusting.

This is the worst experience I&#39;ve had in a long time. We ordered wings just as a small meal after shopping, and our waiter came back with the wrong order after we had already waited for 45 minutes! We decided to leave instead of placing another order and waited a good 15 minutes just to get the check for our drinks. Don&#39;t come here.

Had a $8 BBQ hamburger that was just okay. I had Five Guys earlier and they tasted much better for $2 less.  Of course I had to try out one of their cheesecakes, since that was my whole reason for trying them out, Vanilla Bean Cheesecake, very tasty, $7 piece tasty? Perhaps. <br><br>Go for their cheesecake not the other food is what I&#39;ll go by.

This location is seriously over crowded. Food is mediocre at best. Also, the  mixed drinks are 10 dollars a piece, and they are extremely watered down! However, the cheesecake.... Oh, the cheesecake! The red velvet cheesecake is stupendous! My advice? If you&#39;re looking for a fantastic dessert, go to CCF. If you&#39;re looking for great food, go elsewhere.

Horrible service - waited an hour for meal, when the meal arrived it was burnt. Manager came over and he said, &#34;you aren&#39;t happy&#34; then said I&#39;ll let you eat and come back.  Didn&#39;t see him again. Don&#39;t waste your money!

Used to love Cheesecake Factory. My wife and I had the Grilled Shrimp &amp; Bacon Club - the bread was butter soaked and the sandwich was soggy and greasy. Our waitress was obnoxious and greeted us by asking, &#34;you all ordered anything already?&#34;... how could we, we had just arrived and been seated. She gave us all of 30 seconds to review the menu and kept insisting we order AND we had to beg her to refill sodas. The last straw came when we ordered a slice of Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake to go and to our horror discovered when getting home that it was  half a slice.... we were not happy. For $8 a slice, come on people. <br>We won&#39;t be going back there anytime soon again.

We received attentive service. Food was typical of other cheesecake factory locations and tasted great. Overall good choice if going with a lot of people and everyone has different food preferences -- since there is always something for everyone on their menu.

The restaurant was packed as always, but were seated very promptly. Did not need to look at the menu, since I always get the same thing---Chicken Costolleta. It&#39;s 3 huge thin pieces of chicken Milanese with a lemon butter sauce, some grated lemon peel, garlic mashed potatoes, and about 6 pieces of asparagus. I always take about half of it home because it&#39;s definitely a huge portion. <br><br>I drank apple cider, love it! It&#39;s definitely cider and not just apple juice. Service was pretty good, you&#39;d expect ordinary service at chain restaurants that are packed, but our server was very attentive. <br><br>The place tends to be a little loud, since tables are practically crammed together unless you are seating at a booth. I found the music to be unnecessary. <br><br>I would really have to say that is one of my favorite restaurants. The menu is HUGE. Their smoothies are delicious, the bread they bring to you before your food is to die for, along with the butter. <br><br>Will definitely keep returning. I like this location much better than the one in the Woodlands area.

Here&#39;s the deal: I go to school far from home and I&#39;m here for spring break. Not to mention my sister, her boyfriend, and my mom all decided on CCF so we can talk and have a nice meal. We didn&#39;t mind that the service wasn&#39;t AWESOME because we had our alone time (which I know seems quite backward). <br><br>1. My mom LOVES and ordered the Da Vinci. The pasta came out HARD/crunchy and tasted BURNT. so the waiter took it back and came out soft but still burnt taste. the manager offered to pay for her dessert (kinda weird he didn&#39;t offer to pay for her pasta). <br><br>2. Even though the waiter wasn&#39;t giving us the time of day, our food &amp; drinks were pretty much given in a timely and appealing manner. Our glasses kept being filled and when we needed something, we got it. Not the BEST service. <br><br>3. for 4 people: 4 waters, 2 alcoholic drinks, 4 meals, 4 cheesecakes = $114. THIS IS AN AWESOME PRICE!!!! not only did we take ALL 4 meals home, we took home the cheesecake. so we had lunch &amp; dinner paid for. <br><br>Decent experience. We all LOVED our food. This is definitely not the place to go if you want to get pampered by a waiter though. I enjoy coming with friends/dates/family when we don&#39;t really want to be bothered with service.

Customer service was exceptional and very attentive. Pizza and fried macaroni is a must if you want something vegeterian. Obvs the cheesecake is tasty however I was really disappointed by the veggie burger as it was really bland

I&#39;m kind of shocked by all the 1 and 2-star reviews. Steve and I had an absolutely perfect meal and experience, dining here for lunch. We started off getting the Asian Lettuce Wraps. We both thought they were the best lettuce wraps we&#39;ve ever eaten. Delicious grilled chicken, thin cold noodles with black sesame seeds, shredded carrots, thinly sliced cucumbers, bean sprouts and three kinds of sauces. They were unbelievably delicious... and oh-so sticky. So I asked our server if they had wet-naps for our hands. She came back in a few minutes with a plate that was holding steaming hot fabric napkins with lemon slices. We were both very impressed. The appetizer and service were both 5-stars.<br><br>Steve&#39;s entree was Louisiana Chicken and Pasta. Which consisted of bow-tie pasta, assorted peppers, mushrooms, parmesan-encrusted chicken in a creamy pepper sauce. Steve gave his pasta dish 4 out of 5-stars. My entree was a Spicy Crispy Chicken Sandwich (lettuce, tomato, chipotle mayo, homemade bun) served with sweet potato fries. Perfect sandwich. Perfect fries. Perfect 5-star rating.<br><br>It&#39;s been a long time since we&#39;ve both been so impressed with the service and food at a restaurant -- regardless of the fact that Cheesecake Factory is a chain. It really was one the best meals we&#39;ve had in eons*<br><br>*eons = one or two months at most ;-)

Service is not as good as food and price. I&#39;ve been there a few times and it is always busy. I have waited 20 min for a table. Sometimes waitress are too busy that they forget the order or the order is not right.
Always a staple if/when on the road. I usually go to a local spot, but I am not going to lie, I wanted a slice of CHEESECAKE!

Cribbing some of David N&#39;s review, this place seemed to be a suitable choice for our annual company holiday lunch for 40 persons on a Friday.    We arrived at the opening time of 11 AM and things started out with us scattered throughout the first floor dining room - hardly conducive to the presentation part of the program.  This flaw was more pronounced as other lunchtime gangs arrived and added to the din of the kitchen, plate clearing, and general circus-like activity.  Needless to say, the range of those who actually heard the speeches was limited to the front 3 tables.  On second thought, perhaps those farther out would consider this &#34;cone of silence&#34; a good thing.  We&#39;ll call it a wash.*<br><br>The meal itself was comprised of a carte d&#39;hotel of an appetizer and entree, all presented on the most classic of classy presentations:  the fuzzy black-and-white bad copier sheet.  Dessert was off of the regular menu of about 3,000 iterations of cheesecake.  To her credit, our server (playing zone defense) was earning her pay by whipping out plates of calamari, onion rings, and spinach-and-artichoke dip between rounds of refills for the drinks.  I watched as her colleagues were a little more unenthusiastic about the pace.<br><br>For my entree, I opted for the Navajo Chicken sandwich:  a fried bread stuffed with chicken breast, lettuce, tomato, celery, and some mayo derivative, which made the whole thing a colossal mess to eat.  I couldn&#39;t figure out where the &#34;Navajo&#34; part came into play - did they fry their bread?  Is mayo an indigenous food item for these noble folk?<br><br>I had to unload some of the tomatoes and lettuce to expunge some of the offending mayo melange so I could eat some of this native goodness.  To sum, it was &#34;all right&#34;.<br><br>Splitting a dessert selection with my neighbor, we chose the banana cheesecake with fresh banana slices and whipped cream.  The cheesecake was forgettable and generically flavored - the fresh bananas were the most exciting part and ended up being fought over by me and my co-worker.  Make of that what you will.<br><br>I can only surmise that convenience brings the masses here since the food is middling and the prices a bit steep for the value.  For the most part, the servers must have been court-ordered to repay society by working here since they seem devoid of cheer.  If you can do it, save your cash and sanity by going off of the &#34;reservation&#34; and eat elsewhere.<br><br>* We can all be thankful that no rat fell from the ceiling during our visit like it did during Ako&#39;s trip here.  See her review for details.  I just wish we had read it before booking our trip here.  2.5 stars.

I give this place 3 stars because of it&#39;s location. I prefer the Redondo Beach, Ca location much better. Oh well, on any given night expect to wait a while to be seated. Considering how loud this place is you may want to dust off the &#39;ole megaphone and  bring it along with you. (Don&#39;t worry no one will even notice ...I guess if you can read lips your good too!)<br><br>Okay moving on, the portions are what I like to call &#34;Texas&#34; style which means....huge! So be sure to come hungry!  There&#39;s something for everyone on the menu....it&#39;s literally the size of a spiral notebook with several pages. <br><br>Don&#39;t for get to save some room for dessert...I prefer the Godiva chocolate cheesecake.  It&#39;s awesome!

Get your tickets to the show!<br><br>This once popular and respected restaurant  disappointingly operates like a circus where the animals run this show.  The wait staff/ servers reprise the roles of disheveled clowns clumsily juggling to balance their orders. <br><br>The unruly and dated animal house themed factory&#39;s service is coarse. These sloppy dressed performing jesters are either overworked, or they lack the enthusiasm to profit from providing a valuable service.<br><br>The food my wife and I ordered was the straw that broke the elephant&#39;s back.  <br><br>Our appetizer was an order of the Crispy Crab Wontons that was visually pleasant to describe the least and a distasteful wreck of over fried wonton noodles filled with mush at best.<br><br>Our main course was the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp.  This order I thought would have redeemed its failed appetizer.  Surprised, our main meal was another poor choice to order. <br><br>Turn that frown upside down, right?  <br><br>Wrong!  Why so serious?<br><br>Painfully, our dessert (strawberry cheesecake) tasted as though thawed for the 15 minutes we waited for its arrival.  Upon its entrance, this audience had mentally left this joke of a biz to run its circus act as my wife and I visually took in this Ringling Brothers atmosphere.<br><br>-Esteban

When I think of Cheesecake factory I think an overpriced over rated Chili&#39;s.  It has a wide variety of food that&#39;s alright so a big group of people who don&#39;t have their mind set on anything can find something on the menu.<br><br>So why does it deserve 4 stars?<br><br>The CHEESECAKE of course!<br><br>Don&#39;t bother getting the food here because everything is mediocre.  However, the cheesecakes are to DIE FOR!!!<br><br>My favorite is the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle.  White Chocolate is already my favorite.  So you already won me over but add the rest and it&#39;s the best thing ever!  <br><br>I&#39;m not a fan of chocolate (yes I know I&#39;m odd) but I actually enjoyed the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake too.<br><br>The wait here can be terrible so I usually just put my name on the list and window shop at the near by stores.

Inspired by Edgar V.&#39;s review, I figure I&#39;d get around to posting my review of The Cheesecake Factory. Here it is:<br><br>&#34;Gigantor Menu. Delicious Cheesecake.&#34;<br><br>Then, despired (making up words, natch) by this recent thread talk (<a href="http://www.yelp.com/topic/houston-how-artistic-can-a-review-be">yelp.com/topic/houston-h…</a>), I now need to add something more substantial. Here it is:<br><br>Gigantor Menu.<br><br>Seriously, anything you can think of. Way too much, in fact. They do pretty much everything decently but nothing spectacularly. Kind of like Brendan Fraser, the Philadelphia Eagles, or BIC pens. Problem is, everything is way too overpriced. But you knew this already, because everyone knows what goes down at the Cheesecake Factory. My personal go-to is the chicken marsala, which costs something like eleventy dollars (note: eleventy is not a real number but is in fact a placeholder for an actual overpriced value).<br><br>Delicious Cheesecake.<br><br>But you knew this already, because the place is called freakin&#39; &#34;The. Cheesecake. Factory.&#34; They&#39;ve got pretty much any type of cheesecake combination you can dream of: something sweet + cream cheese filling + crust = yum. So if you can&#39;t find anything you like, or don&#39;t like cheesecake, well, that&#39;s just un-American. Wait, that may be apple pie. Forgive the mistake. Problem is, the slices are way too overpriced (are you sensing a trend here)? My personal go-to is the Vanilla Bean. Simple yet magically delicious. This also costs eleventy dollars (I think it&#39;s actually like $6.50. Still ridiculous.).<br><br>You&#39;ll definitely end up going at some point in your life. Don&#39;t look at the prices. Just enjoy.

I usually love The Cheesecake Factory. This was the worst experience I&#39;ve had at any of their locations. <br><br>Problem 1 - The hostess (young, attractive, long dark hair, slim) was RUDE. She walked up behind us and was extremely annoyed that we weren&#39;t moving quickly enough to get out of her way. I know they were busy, but a polite &#34;excuse me&#34; with a smile would have accomplished her goal. The slight shove paired with an irritated expression wasn&#39;t necessary. I watched her as she stormed through the restaurant upstairs and downstairs. <br><br>Problem 2 - Filthy bathroom.  When I say &#34;filthy,&#34; I mean unusable - like a porta-potty, an outhouse, or a redneck gas station. Two of the bathroom stalls were covered with diarrhea, and one toilet was in a state of overflow. No stall had any usable toilet paper, but the floors were covered with used toilet paper. There was no soap or paper towels. Obviously the customers behaved badly for the restrooms to reach that point, but it is the staff&#39;s responsibility to keep it from reaching this point. <br><br>Problem 3 - The macaroni and cheese that we ordered for the kids was undercooked to the point of being crunchy. Not al dente, CRUNCHY. Our French fries were terrible; they were cold and tasted old. <br><br>The Pros - The service was good. We liked the brown bread and the iced tea. The children&#39;s pizza was pretty good, and they liked it. Our mushroom sandwiches were good enough to order again. I enjoyed the Oreo cheesecake. <br><br>In summary, I&#39;m not interested in going back to this location. We waited 45 minutes for a nasty hostess, a disgusting bathroom, and mediocre food. The one in Sugarland does a much better job, and I have high hopes for th new location at Memorial.

If you don&#39;t mind fighting the Galleria traffic and don&#39;t mind eating with Galleria people then this is a great place to eat.  The menu is huge.  A great variety of food to choose from.  I can&#39;t speak for any of it except the Bang Bang Thai Chicken and Shrimp - which is incredible and what I order every time.  The portions are substantial.  I&#39;m not a light eater but I take home a full meal in leftovers each time<br><br>There are approximately 7,000 different desserts to choose from, of which 95% are cheesecake.  I highly recommend that Dark Chocolate Raspberry, as the ganache is excellent.  Our service has been great here as well. <br><br>Overall, it&#39;s a little more expensive than some places, but given the quality and quantity of the food it is so worth it.

I have NEVER eaten a meal at Cheesecake Factory. I have only gotten their cheesecakes and cakes. I personally think their regular food menu is really overpriced and the portions are way too big. I don&#39;t like boxing up leftovers and reheating them later on. But as for the desserts, oh my goodness, I have never been disappointed. <br><br>Flavors I&#39;ve tried: <br>-oreo (childhood love) - it&#39;s like a cookies and cream flavored cheesecake<br>-chocolate mousse (very very good for you chocoholics) <br>-reese&#39;s - big portion and super sweet! have a glass of water/milk ready, and be ready to share...but definitely not something you can have JUST one bite of. It&#39;s really rich in flavor (and probably sugar)<br>-hershey&#39;s - celebrated its big debut last month. It&#39;s like the reese&#39;s if you like that one<br>-kahlua coffee - slightly lighter hint of chocolate if you&#39;re a coffee/milk chocolate kind of person. less sweet than hershey&#39;s and lighter texture as well, kind of like a fluffy mousse<br>-black out - I think this is the richest, darkest chocolate cake/dessert offered at the place. it sits on top of the rest of the cheesecakes and it TOWERS over your head! Very very big portion. I shared it with my boyfriend and we STILL wanted more after we killed it. Definitely my favorite

Food WAS great! Awesome Cheesecake.  It was a Dinner for 4... OverAll We had a Good Time. It Was Up Until The End, that left everybody in a bad mood. Our Waitress was named ARTISHA B. She was nice in the beginning, but toward the end our dinner, Missy had the audacity to TRY &amp; make me pay her a bigger tip. Now I understand most waiters make their money off their tips, but to TRY to make the customer pay you an even bigger tip is ridiculous. Her whole ATTITUDE &amp; demeanor changed....Shaking her head...&amp; snatching the tip off the tip off the table in front of us.. Everyone looked around looking like REALLY.  The tip was more than $10 which we didn&#39;t EVEN have give..Tipping is OPTIONAL... I know it sounds petty BUT that was unacceptable behavior. I know so many people that don&#39;t even tip, but I do whether it&#39;s $5 or $15... I just feel as a customer that spent nearly $170+ altogether  on ONE meal at the Cheesecake Factory. That service of a waiter is absolutely HORRIBLE. Then she suggested she could break one of My $100 bills I had for her tip... After that I told my group it was time for us to go! Later on I called the Cheesecake Factory &amp; made a complaint. I hope they took care of it, because to be honest that type of service is UNACCEPTABLE.

Food is what you would expect... Decent and maybe slightly over priced.  The waiter was very good and attentive.  I&#39;ve been Herr before and have come back.  Unfortunately upon this visit we noticed several insects throughout the establishment.  First was the fruit flies.   Annoying? Yes.   Understandable to some degree?  Yes.  Houston area is notorious for fruit flies.  Though the other insects we noticed were of the cockroach variety.  It&#39;s hard to &#39;stomach&#39; eating somewhere that you can see several cockroaches crawling around the booths and walls.  GROSS!  time to get some pest control guys!!!

Overcrowded, Overwhelmed and Overrated.<br><br>Altogether, on a Saturday night, it took my party four hours to get food and leave, between the long wait for a table and slow service. The staff is clearly overwhelmed and the floors were slippery. My poor friend was seated next to the waiters&#39; station where all the silverware was being shuffled...so on top of the loud ambient level of noise he had to deal with clanging metal for three hours.<br><br>The food is fine but I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll go again.

The meal was fine.  Service was actually excellent.  Unfortunately, we were joined at the end of the meal by a visitor of the brown, hard-shelled, six-legged variety.  <br><br>We departed.  Quickly.<br><br>(If you still want to eat here, I recommend the Georgia Peach Martini.)

Let me start off by saying that today was supposed to be a pleasant girls day out at The Cheesecake Factory. However, that all changed when we received &#34;service&#34; from a guy named CECIL. When we were first seated, the server bought out our drinks and some butter. He stated that the bread would be out shortly. Well &#34;shortly&#34; turned into 30 minutes! When we asked him about it, he stated that all the servers were in line to get bread and he wasn&#39;t able to get any. WTF! I found that hard to believe bc all of the servers around our table brought bread to their customers! So we didn&#39;t get any until we received our entrees. Next, I ordered a cheeseburger with onion rings and a peach Bellini. I guess ordering that was to much to ask bc I NEVER received my Bellini and when my food came out, it didn&#39;t include the onion rings. And to top it off, the burger came on a sourdough roll instead of a bun! The top of the bun was so crispy and burnt, there was no way I could eat it. I asked for a manager, however I did not want anything else from this establishment. I told them to take it all away. Come to find out, the server never put my drink order in AND never mentioned the onion rings. So if you ever receive service from this waiter....RUN!

I had been wanting to eat here for a long time. Somehow--I could never make it to Cheescake Factory. Perhaps my disdain for malls had something to do with it?<br><br>Anyway, I finally made it here with my sister one afternoon. I don&#39;t recall disliking the food, but I do think it was very forgettable. My reason for going to the Cheescake Factory, however, was not the main menu but the cheescake. Their menu offers twenty billion varieties. We went with some Peanut Butter type variety. Delicious!<br><br>I think I might come back here--but skip the main menu and head right for the Cheescake.

Godiva Chocolate Brownie - I crave thee.<br><br>Alas, I cannot have you.  But I can have the 6 Carb Original Cheesecake - perfectly creamy with a walnut and graham crust.  <br><br>It&#39;s no Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake but it sure is good.<br><br>And I know this may seem a tad pathetic with all of the good food they have to offer but I LOVE the Classic Burger at The Cheesecake Factory.  I know I could dive into Goulash or Chicken and Biscuits but there is something about having a perfectly prepared burger while on break from marching all over the Galleria.  <br><br>I am always a little annoyed that they don&#39;t have a kid&#39;s menu because the adult portions are way too large for anyone under 12 - but usually an appetizer will cover it.  <br><br>Anyway, who&#39;s there for the food?  Any kid dining there is just waiting to get into their favorite dessert and that&#39;s how it should be.

I need to write more reviews.. so why not start it off with a bad one to get the juices flowing?<br><br>Worst. Dining. Experience. Ever. <br><br>Main points before I rant?<br>Good: There is food here. it comes out hot and their cheesecake is awesome.<br>Bad: the cheesecake is the only thing you should come here for. Service sucks. OVERPRICED.<br><br>I have been to 3 Cheesecake Factories: Sugar Land years ago when it opened (was okay), The Woodlands ( a couple years ago. did well for seating/serving our large party, but we had to sit outside in the cold with only some heaters working) aaaand this one.<br><br>We put our name down at about 3:30, and finally sat down at 4. Never have I been to a restaurant so full during the slowest hours of the restaurant day.<br><br>First off, it&#39;s pretty small as these places go. There&#39;s two stories and they way the seating is, it&#39;s not a favorable floor plan if the stairs are right in the middle. looks cool, but takes up a lot of space. The downstairs/main/valet entrance has no space for how many people have to wait. I guess you could stand around on the sidewalk if you had to. We always had to shift around when someone was passing by. The upstairs/mall entrance is a bit better, and there are more benches just outside to sit on, or you could line the long hallway.<br><br>Our buzzer goes off, and the upstairs hostess informs us that we need to go the DOWNSTAIRS host stand to be seated. we do so. host informs us that table is being cleaned still...<br><br>10 minutes later and the table is JUST getting cleared off. Host sets places and we sit. Menu is huge - there is a huge poster outside the mall entrance of everything they serve. Quite daunting if you were as hungry as we were. Weird thing is, there were apparently 2 menus with no obvious labels of their differences until you saw one had more options (I think one was lunch and the other dinner) and one is full (every other page) of advertisements.<br><br>10 MORE minutes later and we finally get a waiter to take our drink &amp; appetizer order and to request some bread.<br><br>probably another 10 minutes until our drinks come, though he&#39;s standing around talking to one table while holding our and our neighboring table&#39;s drinks for a few minutes. Aren&#39;t you supposed to drop off all the drinks, and if one table is ready to order, say &#39;let me drop these off&#39; and I&#39;ll come back? He was taking so long I was contemplating just getting up and taking our drinks off his tray since he was standing 5 feet away.<br><br>So recap if you&#39;re still with me: we have been waiting about an hour for any food or drink.. still no bread and that&#39;s supposed to come with your drinks, or shortly thereafter.<br><br>Our appetizer finally comes. spinach artichoke dip with little bowls of pico and sour cream. decent, nothing special or horrible. Still no bread, though he brings the couple beside us their bread. They were seated after us.<br><br>Food comes - WITH the bread! We had specifically asked for it first because we were really hungry. okay, whatever, our food is here. One friend asks for ketchup. Waits well over 5 minutes for it, and our drinks have not been refilled this whole time. They&#39;re all half ice, and with the appetizer we&#39;ve sucked them down already. Friend calls over manager to complain. We feel kinda bad but... this is really slow. Ridiculously so.<br><br>Other friend seems to be enjoying her greek salad and avocado eggrolls. My chicken carbonara was underseasoned, and I had to pay an extra $2.50 for a measly chicken breast. The pasta was okay, but maybe I&#39;m just getting too critical. In my opinion, DEFINITELY NOT worth what I paid, which was over $15. The dish shouldn&#39;t have cost more than maybe 12 total.<br><br>So now the manager and the waiter have combined their efforts and it probably equaled to about 1 lackluster server.<br><br>We finish and we had explained at the beginning of the meal that we wanted to split the dip 3 ways, and then the rest of the ticket billed to each person, respectively. He had to ask again. Took over 10 minutes to split it. We get the books back and he hadn&#39;t even run already peeved friend&#39;s card, and put the other friend&#39;s ticket with his card. Then we had to wait for him to do that... it&#39;s 5PM at this point. took this long without wine/dessert?!<br><br>FINALLY we left. I vow to never return here for a meal. Maybe only if they ever get that Toblerone cheesecake again.. and I&#39;ll eat it at the bar to take it to go.<br><br>Horrible - and not even on a busy night! And this was not an isolated incident.. the other 2 tables beside us had the same time-laden service as well. The first couple wanted to get dessert, but the waiter was taking so long they couldn&#39;t wait any longer and asked for their bill after they only had an appetizer. The other table was agreeing with us. And we wished the new couple who sat down before we left luck with a more expedited service. They were already growing restless and they didn&#39;t even have food yet.<br><br>For a high dollar clientele between lunch and dinner service... this was simply AWFUL.

Went here this past Saturday night for dessert, following a not so 5-star meal at Pico&#39;s Mex Mex.  <br><br>First things first, we obviously wanted dessert, because when we arrived shortly after 9 p.m., there was a 30 minute wait.  We all know that a 30 minute wait for The Cheesecake Factory is fairly decent.  The upside is, if the wait is too too bad, you can always go shopping in the high end stores, encased inside The famous Galleria Mall, where this restaurant is located.  <br><br>We were seated, and our waiter came right over.  I have nothing negative to say about him other than the fact that he told us  redundantly three times that he&#39;d only worked there a year.  Guess people at the table, including myself uttered things that seemed different on the menu, to which he followed up with his, &#34;It&#39;s been the same since i&#39;ve been here and i&#39;ve been here for a year&#34; speech.  Giggles.<br><br>Anyway, we all pretty much ordered cheesecakes.  I of course only order the Godiva Chocolate cheesecake.  I must say this is by far the best dessert/cheesecake on their menu.  It will cost you about $7.50, to which i thought it was closer to $10, and when i asked the waiter was he sure, he replied, &#34;for the year i&#39;ve been working here it has always been this price&#34;.  LOL.  Needless to say that aside from that, he was very attentive, polite, knowledgeable, and friendly to all 6 of us.  I ended up ordering my dessert to go, and didn&#39;t indulge until yesterday.  I can say that if you do not want an entire slice, you may be better off not ordering this here.  Barnes &amp; Noble has the same slice, just a smaller version, and if you have a discount card, you can get it for less than $5.  Food for thought.  However, if you do want the size the &#39;Factory offers, then it&#39;s well worth every penny.  <br><br>I also ordered the strawberry lemonade.  I have to say that they have the best lemonade i&#39;ve ever had...hands down.  I do not agree with the whooping $4.50 price tag, it can easily go for $2.50, and you guys (managers if you&#39;re reading) will make just as much profit, if not more on it.  What the beep, i ordered it anyway.  <br><br>All in all, you get what you pay for and this place is well worth it.  Indeed, The Cheesecake Factory will always be one of my top five places to dine.

I love how there is an upstairs to this location! The place is nicely laid out. I tried the chocolate cake at this spot. The waitress was very nice. I asked if she could warm the cake, because I like my chocolate cakes slightly warm. Mm, mm good! She was pleased to do so. These cute French guys were sitting at the tables across us.This location has an international group of people dining in. Many of the shoppers from the Galleria situate themselves comfortably here. Check it out, I`m sure you will love the environment, as well was the food.

Good Cheesecake.  It&#39;s overpriced, but it tastes good!  Thats the same summary for the food in general.  Since it&#39;s near the gallery, it&#39;s a good place to stop in for when you are in the area.  You get a lot of food so don&#39;t worry about that.  I&#39;m never hungry for the desert, but I eat it anyways!  I like the double cheeseburger thing... but I&#39;m always over stuffed!

Damn, this place is big for its britches!<br><br>This location has some very undesirable seating options, such as right behind the hostess stand, where names of parties are hollered out as their tables become ready. But there are also a few fabulous ones, such as a window booth that overlooks Westheimer. Cross your fingers for a decent table, because otherwise, your experience will be screwed.<br><br>I hate that they have the gall to advertise within their menus. I don&#39;t care if you&#39;re located inside a mall or not. I will say that there are some very reasonably-priced wines by the glass, and I appreciate the smaller lunch portions being available on weekends.<br><br>Only stop in here to eat if it&#39;s your last resort, don&#39;t plan around a meal here. There are better dining options with fewer screaming tots within the Galleria like the Daily Grill.

I&#39;ve never been too impressed with the Cheesecake factory.  There is nothing there that you cant find (better of) somewhere else. I am referring to Service, Ambience and the Food.<br>The things I do like about this restaurant : <br>The location, as it is less than a mile away from my aparment. Also, the restaurant is very well decorated and looks nice. The view from some booths is great, you get to see the nice lights across the street during Christmas time (other seating options really suck). Other than that, the food is not bad, and it is better than many places I&#39;ve visited in houston... but still it lacks something. I say go try it, and see for yourself, but dont expect  too much in the service department.

I start with the Ahi Carpaccio: very thin sliced ahi tuna with pickled cucumber, and teriyaki.  Delicious!   Main dish is Chicken Teriyaki, brocoli, char-grilled plantain and pineapple.  The chicken has the bones removed and is a little dry, but the veggies and fruits were a great addition.  My guest had the Asian Salad that looked like a small mountain.    The carrot cake is about the size of my torso, so it was A-OK, too!!<br><br>The service was good, but the noise was too much.  Shouting at lunch is no fun!  Sit next to your guest so you can talk and make snarky comments on the people passing by...

Happened to stop by on national cheesecake day. Who knew? We wanted to sit at a low table in the bar, but were allowed to. Seriously, let us sit where we want. We were famished from shopping, and this place was convenient. No happy hour? Annoying. The food portions were massive and it was delicious. It would have been a 5 star if they had happy hour &amp; let us sit where we wanted.

Downgraded from 3/5 to 2/5, portions of food were served cold, and had clearly been waiting to be served to us for some time. I know it&#39;s busy and you can only do the best you can, but certain minimums should still be upheld. On a positive note, the app was amazing. We will probably be coming back, for convenience and location if nothing else.

Yes I know its a chain but certain items on the menu are good here.. I actually order the same four things everytime I come here - <br>1. Fried Calamari<br>2. Thai Lettuce Wraps<br>3. Chicken Picatta<br><br>After my second stomach opens I order the 4) Banana Cream Cheesecake.<br><br>Food : 8/10<br>Service : 7/10<br>Ambience : 7/10
Good good and great service. Love the Chicken piccata. I have never had a bad meal at a CCF and this place continues the run. I would eat here again.

Who moans about eleventy dollars when they go out to eat?  Do you realize what you&#39;re paying for? Of course it&#39;s not going to be the same price as a local place, they don&#39;t have to cover the cost of huge real estate in the middle of one of the freaking highest cost areas of Houston.  If this is expensive, is Olive Garden expensive as well? The prices are not that far off.  When is yelp going to implement a  &#34;useless&#34; button?<br><br>I took away one star for the service here. There is one waiter here who always looks like he&#39;s ready to kill  anyone who gets in his way (you know who you are, the dude who looks like if he smiles his face would crack). Most of the time though, service is slow simply because they are always so busy.  Other than that, the food here is pretty consistent, their pasta dishes always satisfy me.<br><br>If you&#39;re going to complain about price, consider what about this place screams &#34;cheap and affordable&#34; to you?  <br><br>People who complain about cost when the freaking prices are posted outside in a giant billboard of a menu = make up your own conclusion.  Fact is, you have a right to what you think is &#34;reasonable&#34;, but if you feel it&#39;s overpriced and STILL go in, why complain?

This place is definitely hit or miss. For the most part, I&#39;d say miss.<br><br>I fell in love with the fish tacos there. I must say that the first time I tried them, I thought they were amazing! Buuuuut... the second time I order them, it looked like the entree was cooked about 30 minutes ahead of time and then left under heat lamps. My beans were a dried and caked up lump and that was my big hint. <br><br>I am the type to let that kind of stuff go, however, because having cooked for large quanitities of people, I understand the stress of the kitchen. The food was still okay.<br><br>The orange chicken on the other hand... My gums were tender at the time and that chicken was fried hard. Eating it hurt. It also looked like they drizzled sauce on as an after thought.<br><br>Still, I give this place 4 stars because the cheesecake is always spot on and amazing. I like to go with a girlfriend and split an entree and dessert. That way, the both of us don&#39;t have to feel guilty about indulging... and hey! They give you huge portions you can&#39;t finish on your own anyway!!

This place is something to get excited about . . . <br><br>Since its inside of the Galleria mall, it&#39;s a convenient idea to stop here to eat after an evening of shopping.  But after I tried their tiramisu I actually started ignoring the mall part just so I could go straight here and eat. Go figure!<br><br>Since the Galleria is an integral location for people around the world to get their shop on, if you&#39;re a people watcher like me you will like this place.  The environment is relaxed and it&#39;s an excellent place to take friends.  Also for the price the great service is a plus as well.  <br><br>You&#39;ll have to excuse me I&#39;d like to go on with my review but . . . TIRAMISUUUUU!!!!!<br><br>Bottom line:  I&#39;m sorry Jason has left the building to go get some tiramisu from the Cheesecake Factory . . . he will be back after his nap.

Went in on a Sunday.  I tried this place again and wasn&#39;t impressed the first time and wasn&#39;t impressed this time.  I had the Louisiana Pasta and it was ok, borderline bland.  They give you a lot of food, but you pay for every bit of it.  I ordered the carrot cake, but shouldn&#39;t have.  I thought that they would have good carrot cake but I was definitely wrong.  My server was also horrible.  I asked him about a few items on the menu and he couldn&#39;t explain three of them.  He simply read off the menu after I had to tell him what page to reference!  Wow, it was my second time and probably my last time!

We have heard lots of good thiings about this place, but this was our first, &amp; certainly our last visit. In a group of 8 &amp; NOTHING impressed, but several disappointments. Great looking place &amp; we had good wait service, but the food was just so very average that we won&#39;t return.  Kitchen service was definitely OFF. 3 orders of fish &amp; chips were served without the cole slaw, which was brought as the table was being cleared. 2 orders of soup arrived along with the cole slaw, after everyone else was finished. Must have been out of both, &amp; the kitchen had to make more? Fried shrimp &amp; fish both looked like they came right out of a freezer box.

The portions are large and your bill will reflect this.  I remember taking my mom here and the first thing she said when she saw the portions was, &#34;No wonder Houston is considered one of the most obese cities in the US.&#34;<br><br>Ouch.<br><br>And as much as I hate to admit it, my mother can sometimes be right.  The portions here are over the top.  Now, don&#39;t get me wrong, I always finish my meal (I tend to stick with the burger and fries), but there&#39;s nothing phenomenal about it.  Hell, I could get the same quality/quantity at Bennigans for half the price.  <br><br>I suppose the cheesecake is worth checking out. . .hence the name.  But.  I&#39;m just not sure I can justify spending $6-10 for a small slice of cheesecake.  Seriously.  I mean, sure, it&#39;s good, but you can buy a whole cheesecake for that much money!!<br><br>The good thing about this place is that since it has the generic American menu, you can take people here and they&#39;re sure to find something they want.  If you&#39;re looking for generic, this is the place to go, but why live in a city with so many options and not take advantage?!

With soo many options, this place has the best cheesecake ever... You are sure to find one that you live... From a food perspective - if you want good comfort (fattening) food this is the spot... Healthy food options are super limited here...

This place has almost everything from Fish and Chips to Spicy Chicken Samosas. It&#39;s a great spot to take a big diverse group of people. Although it takes 30 minutes and a few Cliff notes to finish reading their large menu, they have a good selection to please those picky eaters. <br><br>A big group of us ladies decided to convene here for a pre-Free Hugs brunch. Getting a large table is quite a wait but the place was bustling with Miss Teen Americas, chic international socialites and last minute Christmas shoppers. I think we waited about 45 minutes. It was worth the wait because our server was very attentive and made no hassle about doing split checks for us. We had a nice little table on the side of the stairs so despite the hustle and bustle surrounding us, we were quite relaxed. <br><br>Everyone seemed pleased with their food. I had the sweet corn fritters and the avocado egg rolls. The corn fritters were sweet and fluffy. They tasted like something you&#39;d get at a carnival and I love carnival food :) The avocado egg rolls were spicy and PACKED with avocado, onions, peppers and spices. I tasted a bit of my friend&#39;s Chipotle Pasta and it was delicious! Smoky, spicy goodness. They have generous portions here so if you&#39;re not starving I&#39;d order an appetizer, snack or lunch portion. The regular portions are enough to gorge yourself and still have some to take for lunch the next day. <br><br>I always love the grandiose, over the top décor of the Cheesecake Factory. This place isn&#39;t unique or quaint but it&#39;s great for a big mix of people to take a break from shopping while at the Galleria.

I had always liked cheesecake factory so much that I decided to have my friends and families there on my wedding day. However they DON&#39;T take reservations on weekends, even though we told the manager that we were getting married on that day and wanted to celebrate afterwards, they WON&#39;T make an exception. Think about what can you lose for taking reservation? Just get the tables booked and you can always cancel it if people don&#39;t get there on time. I think the cheesecake factory just is too popular so they don&#39;t care about a $1000 and 18% tips. And this made me really disappointed that I couldn&#39;t celebrate for my wedding in my once favorite restaurant!

Fairly standard Cheesecake Factory, not as fancy decor as some of the others I have been in (such as Chicago).  It&#39;s attached to the Galleria so a good lunch spot on a busy shopping day.  My favorite thing to do is stop in for dessert with my girlfriends.  Terrible for your body, but good for the soul.  <br><br>Plan to wait to be seated if you&#39;re here on the weekend.  Even outside holiday shopping it&#39;s busy.  Parking at the Galleria can be a pain so come prepared to hunt for a spot.
The service was very terrible, because they mess up our orders numerous time. And the southwest sandwich I order was not no way near being southwest, it was definitely a south-mess.
While we enjoy the food, the main reason we return is for Corbin.  He is an awesome waiter that always pays attention to detail.
i ordered the quattro formaggio pasta &amp; fried avocado as an appetizer, reached my expectation.

Had their chicken Madeira today and it was fantastic. The Madeira sauce and the mashed potatoes are a great combination. Also the breads they serve before the main course (they&#39;re on the house), especially the multigrained one are delicious.

When we were younger, we used to frequent The Cheesecake Factory a lot for formal events and such. So after a hectic day of post-Christmas shopping, my fiance and I decided to stop by and have dinner there... I wish we hadn&#39;t.<br><br>First, we waited to be acknowledged by the seating person. I don&#39;t appreciate being ignored. He did seat us immediately though but it was on a tiny table by the bar and kitchen without asking us our preference. <br><br>Second, we had a nice young girl as our waitress and there were no problems with the service except she forgot to bring us bread to munch on while we waited for our drinks / appetizers. My margarita was ok but she really liked the flavored mojito. The crab appetizer was good but small in portion and unfortunately, my entree was not good at all. I ordered the pasta carbonera and it was overcooked and over salted. <br><br>Towards the end of the evening we felt a little rushed to leave as the waitress kept walking by and looking at the check we hadn&#39;t taken care of yet but overall it was an alright evening.<br><br>I would recommend that people sit upstairs though.

Came on Sunday early evening around 545pm for dinner. A quick 5-minute wait for seating. 4 adults and 3 children mean 7-top. Not 6! Fortunately our kids are 5 and 7 so we can hang in a 6-top table. I had to ask 3 wait staff for additional napkin and silverware as well as bread. I had the chicken and steak combo for 19.95. The portion is smaller compare to other dishes. Steak is tender and juicy. Chicken is flavorful because of the cheese topping. Kid&#39;s meals are big for our 5 year olds. Pumpkin and pecan cheese cake is very delicious. <br>It is somewhat overrated at this place because all the tourists and out of towners.

Service- HORRIBLE. our waitress didnt seem like she wanted to be there or to serve us. she brought out one basket of bread for a table of 6, and then took away everything. Slow on re-fills, and never came around to check on what we needed. <br><br>Food- The food was average. Not bad, but nothing great that would make us want to come back. We were all hungry after waiting 20 mins just for a table and then another 20 mins for food. Probably not coming back any time soon.

Crappy service turned into fantastic service. 10 minutes elapsed without any server introducing themselves so I mentioned that to the hostess. 3 minutes later, 3 different people started to serve us, which made me felt bad. Anyhow, food was great and service was great. Still a fan.
i don&#39;t think you can really go wrong @ the cheesecake factory!! food...great service...friends!! oh yea &amp; we saw kirko bangz...not bad!!

cheesecake factory is good.<br><br>the white bread makes me smile (when it&#39;s warm).<br><br>the corn tamale cakes are TO DIE FOR.  they are simply divine.  NEVER look up their nutritional info.<br><br>the service here was lovely.  i ate here twice over a 4 day period while in houston for a conference recently and both times my coworker and i were seated immediately and ironically at the same booth.<br><br>the service was lovely - especially the second time (thanks, Marisa).   the drink refills were a plenty and the food was splendid.<br><br>the following is not a compaint against this location, but rather corporate as a whole:<br><br>(rolling up sleeves for rant):  you have a skinnilicious menu claiming lower cal options.  i am on ww.  i am thrilled with this option.  i find a mexican salad that sounds splendid and filling and eat 1/2 of it and think i can find the nutritional info online, but alas, it is not to be found...ANYWHERE.  CF - release the nutritional info of your freaking skinnilicious stuff.  c&#39;mon - don&#39;t claim something is a better option for those of us who are counting watching every morsel that goes past our lips only to find out that we can&#39;t quanify it aftewards.  it&#39;s a dick move and one i&#39;m tired of.  i boycotted corner bakery for years after they refused to publish their info and only went back when it was fully released.  i eat at cheesecake &amp; grand luxe FREQUENTLY (twice a month) and am willing to go through with this threat if you don&#39;t change your evil ways and fess up.<br><br>i am done.<br><br>ps - love your cheesecake (when i&#39;m not cranky and on weight watchers).  xoxo

Came here for sunday brunch with this nerd i know. I have to say i was lovin&#39; it :) I got some hot tea which was excellent. I ordered lemon ricotta pancakes. They were like wtf good! I really liked them. The service was great, my only complaint was that the bathrooms were downstairs, and i was upstairs, and i am lazy so going downstairs to pee pee is no bueno :(

They are consistent in the food but today I had the worst dinning experience in my life. To start I got there at 6,30 and I needed a table for 16. I understand that it is difficult to get but I was told that the wait time was 45 min. After 2 hours we had to split tables and they ended giving us 2 tables. We sit down and after ordering they brought 3 of the 4 plates. The last plate arrived 15 min later. Needles to say that the rest of the food was cold by then. I&#39;ve been reading a lot of reviews about slow service and I will hope that by now they would be doing some changes. Again, I am extremely mad with what happened today.

I went there with a friend on a Sunday to try their breakfast/brunch. The wait for a table was just a few minutes even though they were pretty busy. I had their coffee which was very good I am a fan of a strong cup of coffee and they did not disappoint. I order pancakes eggs and bacon while my friend tried their steak &amp; eggs. Both were delicious I don&#39;t what kind of syrup they have but it was one of the best. The pancakes were fluffy thick but not doughy like what you get at IHOP or Denny&#39;s.The steak was tender juicy and very well seasoned. Their portions are huge too much food for one person for sure. I had to take my left over pancakes &amp; eggs home. I will be coming back soon.
Not the nicest waiter, their food has more calories than should be legal to note!  It&#39;s just a big commercial eatery with massive portions that are hit and miss

Worst experience ever.  We took our young son here for a birthday family dinner.  Due to a very loud, rude Canadian in the booth behind us talking so loud we could not hear ourselves only about his whole life story.  That&#39;s how I know what nationality he was.  We requested the manager move us.  The manager got angry at me for being upset.  No consideration was given by the staff that it was out child&#39;s birthday.  BTW is was a Tuesday night, not a Saturday.  Will never go back here again.

Well, I went there 2 times ..... and this might be only for this place specifically ... in both times .. we asked for appetizer, Main course and  the desert would be the cheese cake ..in both times .. the food was litrely HORRIBLE .. u can call it a CRIME, we thought that might he for a first time ... but for 2 times .. same HORRIBLE taste .. !!!! that is just a big shame for the name of this place ... the only awesome thing was the cake only AND ONLY .... I lived in more than 9 different counties overseas including Europe, Africa, and Asia .. so when I criticize a restaurant .. I know what I&#39;m talking about ... the appetizer was SUPER grease ... the main course simply tasted like somebody was already ate it before us .... honest comment ... service was cool though ... but for food ... it was simply a nightmare ...I will try to go to a diff branch and hopefully tk see a better chef there ... I don&#39;t know if a those big places would read my view but hopefully they will ..

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience here. Everything, from the pizza to sandwiches to burgers to pasta, is amazing. The service is top-notch. I have a hard time saving room for cheesecake, but that&#39;s where to-go boxes come in handy! They also have great specialty drinks. They do not take reservations, but they are still great for special occasions. I had a lunch here with family after my college graduation, and we were able to get a table together without any problems. <br><br>The Verdict: Great food, drinks, and cheesecake. Something for everyone.

Great time as always with good friend and food.  I have to remember not fill up on the bread.  Since I didn&#39;t finish my meal, but I did finish my drink which I had the pomegranate mojito, and dessert yummy apple strudel cheesecake.  My dinner wasn&#39;t bad to which i had s shepherd pie.  Delish, my friend had the miso salmon the first time and she was really surprised how good it was.    Next time not to fill up on the bread, but  its so good.

Actually one of the better ones.  It&#39;s two stories and that is a unique feature.  It&#39;s also large and suprisingly less gaudy than many others.  As always you know what you&#39;re getting; large portions, a giant menu and dessert.

consistently good food.<br><br>had the louisiana chicken pasta, again! always delish.<br><br>tried the jambalaya and cajun chicken. very yummy! it was a louisiana kinda day.<br><br>ordered the 10-inch white chocolate macadamia nut and dulce de leche cheesecakes split half way for $50. really expensive to the wallet and to the waistline. i cannot eat like this ever again.

Good place to celebrate birthdays, however their &#39;birthday sundae&#39; is possibly the most disappointing birthday perk I have seen in my entire life.<br><br>Get the Hibachi Steak Medium Rare, by far the best thing on the menu for meat lovers. Includes a side of wasabi mashed potatoes!

If you want to ruin your celebration this is the place to be. they kept us waiting for more than an hour. Once we were seated no server greeted or attended us for 30 mins. when we asked for water to a server he was making faces. we walked out in utter dissapointment. Manager was least interested in our complaints.

Normally I can find something good at a Cheesecake Factory... and normally it&#39;s more than 1 thing. <br><br>The BBQ pizza was Funky... the tomato/ basil pizza was tasteless, and our pasta was COMPLETELY devoid of flavor. <br><br>However, the dark bread was very good. I ate that as my meal in the end.

Cheesecake Factory is always DELICIOUS. I just wanted to complimrnt thid.location on the fact they they DO NOT skimp on the alcohol lol I went to the Memorial location and I literally thought I was drinking mint lemonade.

I enjoy going to The Cheesecake Factory. Each time I go, the service is good and the food is satisfying. The menu is quite extensive, you just need to find a dish that you like. For me, it&#39;s the white chicken chili. I guess I&#39;m drawn to it because it reminds me of the chili and rice I used to get in Cali, the only difference is TCF serves it with white chicken chili rather than regular chili. The complimentary bread is surprisingly good. It comes out warm and soft. And, who can forget the Cheesecake. I guess if you&#39;re called The Cheesecake Factory, you have to be known for it. I&#39;m a old school guy, so I usually order the old fashion cheesecake with strawberries,never been too big on the other fancy types of cheesecake.

First time at this location, and most likely the last. Came on a weekday; it wasn&#39;t as packed as we seats upon arrival, yet the service the waiter performed made it seem like it was busy when it really wasn&#39;t. The waiter seemed uninterested and unenthusiastic about not only serving us, but just being at his job in general. He didn&#39;t offer to get us water or the complementary breads until we asked for them and showed up to our table to only take our orders and to give us the bill. I also found it rude when he showed us where the &#34;recommended tip&#34; on the bill was as if he was expecting us to tip the recommended amount for his poor service.

With the long wait for a table and the crowd of people, you&#39;d swear this place had the best food in town. First off, this place is highly over-rated. While the ambiance is okay, the food is mediocre at best.  I&#39;ve been several times over the years and haven&#39;t been impressed much with this chain. <br><br>Their menu is expansive, but at the same time, I think it can be overwhelming for many because there&#39;s so many choices to choose from. Though the entree portions served are plentiful, I think overall the food is overpriced for the quality of food that&#39;s placed before you.  Of the times I&#39;ve been there, I&#39;ve had the chicken marsala (it&#39;s okay), a Thai chicken dish with coconut curry, rice, and peanuts (not very flavorful), pasta carabonara (too oily and lacking of flavor), garlic noodles (very bland), and creamy chicken soup (actually really good). For the place to be called Cheesecake Factory, you would think the portion of cheesecake offered would be huge like Junior&#39;s on the east coast, but it&#39;s not. Don&#39;t get me wrong, their cheesecakes are good IMO (love their tiramisu cheesecake  the most), but the price is too much for it to be a chain restaurant and for the amount you&#39;re given.<br><br>The best thing to me about Cheesecake Factory though are their drinks (the reason why this review doesn&#39;t have one star). Matter of fact, some of my girlfriends and I  just make a night of coming here and ordering their drinks while we catch-up with one another.  My favorite drinks of theirs are the Georgia Peach, Peach Bellini, Typhoon Punch (beware... it&#39;s served it a big glass, but towards the end of the drink, you&#39;ll begin to feel the punch lol), and the Strawberry Creamsicle (which is a grown up milkshake spiked with vodka). <br><br>Most recently, Cheesecake Factory has started offering a small plate and snacks menu. I must say this is very welcoming because it&#39;s not only easy on the pockets, but when I do come here for just for the drinks, I do want something to snack on besides the bread, but even the appetizers were too large. From their small plate and snacks menu, I usually get their stuffed mushrooms (which are very good), sausage and ricotta pizza,  and beets with goat cheese salad. You could really just make a small meal from the items that they have on that menu and be able to splurge on more drinks and dessert.<br><br>Is Cheesecake Factory worth coming to, I guess it all depends, but personally I&#39;ll stick with coming here for late night outings with my girls for drinks and a snack from their small plate menu.

So, I went here for my birthday, because I figured it was a good place to splurge on  cheesecake, guilt free. <br>The portions are huge, the service was fair and the taste of the food was also very good. <br>It was pretty crowded and there was a 20 min wait. <br>This restaurant is pretty loud, but I was fortunate enough to have been seated in the quiet area (the atrium) <br>For five people, dinner came out to 120 dls, thats including appetizers and desserts. And leftovers! <br>This is a nice casual and affordable place, if you are conscious about your waistline, this place is probably not for you.

I think I&#39;d have to say that the Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant.  I love the bread they start you off with, and pretty much everything on their menu is wonderful!  I love their salads.  Last time I was there I had &#34;Sheila&#39;s Cashew Chicken Salad&#34; and the dressing was sweet and satisfying... and the memphis burger is SOOO good, if you&#39;re in the mood for something heavier.  And then there&#39;s the cheesecake....don&#39;t think I even need to go into details of how awesome the variety is that they offer.  Wonderful Menu! Love Love Love this place!

The food at either location (Galleria or Memorial City Mall)  is run-of-the-mill.  I&#39;d compare it to what you would get at Chilli&#39;s, Apple Bees except pricier.  Although they do try to change the menu as often to give variety.  I like the skinny menu they have which seems to have some tasty dishes at reduced calories.  However, I&#39;ve never had good luck with the TCF, it seems every time I go to either of the locations, I experience a mishap.  i.e. delayed seating, wrong dish, dirty plates, unfriendly service....    One more thing which is an irritation is Happy Hour pricing is only at the Bar.  You pay full price for the same drinks during happy hour if you&#39;re seated at a table.  Who knows... maybe next time I have better luck....

Took someone visiting the US here for the first time while we were at the Galleria.  Menus were sticky.  Had to ask for water twice.  Bread was delivered mid meal after i had to flag down a mgr to get the dressing for my salad.  i didnt make a big deal about it in front of my guest but i was kind of embarassed.  Food was good.  Service was friendly but pretty mediocre at 3 in the afternoon.
i love this place and all the food i have tried from here were delicious, i love all the cheesecakes as well so give this place a try. a bit expensive but hey its that good
The worst customer service the lady on the front counter is very rude and she treat people like slave she is so racist. This was my last time here highly not recommended

I&#39;ve always felt like cattle when grazing, here.  There&#39;s usually a wait (?!?) for a table and then a wait for the farmer (aka, &#34;server&#34;) to fill the feed trough with glorified fast food.  I cannot understand how/why people like this place.  This is boring, pre-fab food delivered to you by the same pre-fab staff you&#39;ll find at Chilis/etc.  It happens to cost a little bit more than the other McRestaurants... somewhat inexplicably.

It was my friends idea to go to this location, I wanted to go to memorial location-better service. She was beyond excited to go being that we don&#39;t go that often. We walked in and there wasn&#39;t anyone at the host stand to greet us when we arrived. To the left there were about 5 girls standing at the cheesecake counter where you can purchase a cheesecake. Not ONE of those girls even greeted us. So I proceed to start looking at all the cheesecakes thinking that someone was going to ask me if maybe I had any questions, maybe needed assistance with a cheesecake purchase-NOTHING! I actually wanted to buy a whole cheesecake but since no one helped me-FORGET IT! My friend and I headed for the bar. There was no one there but the bartender named Joanne C. She didn&#39;t say hello she just looked at us as we sat down. Never asked us if we wanted something to drink we grabbed our own menus. I was presented with a dirty white linen for a placement and no silverware for us, I didn&#39;t say anything. We quickly ordered an appetizer- the corn tamale cakes which were so good, even though my friend and I watched our appetizer sit ready in the window for 10 mins. (maybe your bartender should have a food runner?) We had to ask for bread (big deal, not really) but the fact that its normally brought to the table...Still no drinks this far into the meal so we asked for waters (which I had to ask for a refill, my friends sat empty the rest of the meal) Our food-two salads, a lunch caesar with chicken and BBQ ranch chicken salad finally came 20 mins later. She actually asked us if our food was good. It was good but by then I was beyond pissed with the service we were getting. I mean if we came to have a dining experience you&#39;d think any restaurant in the galleria would have it together. I have no idea what the bartender was going through that day but we wanted service and that she could not provide for us that evening. I recommend anyone go to the location in memorial city. Far better service. I don&#39;t think i&#39;ll be returning again to the galleria location.

The Cheesecake Factory is the type of marquee restaurant that I typically don&#39;t care much for.  You know, the one&#39;s with more style than substance, the must-visits for people visiting from out of town and who don&#39;t know better.  That&#39;s how I feel about the Cheesecake Factory when I go for breakfast or lunch.  Most of their omelets are bland and completely tasteless.  And even though their salads and sandwiches are top-notch, I&#39;m not a big fan of either salads or sandwiches when I&#39;m eating out.<br><br>However, their dinners fare much better.  I&#39;m a big fan of their pizzas, and I&#39;m usually not crazy about pizza in general.  I particularly enjoy their mushroom and chicken and goat cheese and vegetables pizzas.  Of course, there&#39;s really only one reason to go here, and that&#39;s the cheesecake.  There&#39;s a large variety of flavors, but my favorites are the chocolate- and fruit-based mixtures.  The drawback is that sometimes it doesn&#39;t taste like you&#39;re eating cheesecake in its pure form, which is a drawback for me because I like the specific flavor of cheesecake.  So I usually choose the mild flavors that don&#39;t interfere too much with cheesecake taste.  And if you don&#39;t like cheesecake, then choose another dessert.  When it comes to something sweet, you can&#39;t lose.

Pretty consistent with other locations across the US, which I guess is a good thing because you always know what to expect. That being said though, the restaurant as a whole - including the menu, food, decor, etc - is slightly underwhelming. Neither good, bad, expensive, or cheap, the cheesecake factory falls somewhere in the middle of the fairway. It&#39;s one of those places that I&#39;ll never remember when I&#39;m thinking of where to eat, but if someone suggests it, I&#39;ll probably be open to it.

Typical cheesecake factory. Good local beers on draft and bottle. Separate bar downstairs. Busy. Nice staff. I love cheesecake factory food despight them being a chain. This is nothing special. Eat local if you can
Yum...Etc etc etc...Delish....etc etc etc....just go! ?..etc etc etc...eat, drink, and be merry!
I love the food and my favorite cheesecake pumpkin..... Mmmmmm... Nice romantic restaurant

The food is always good, and the servings are so big that I don&#39;t mind paying the higher price.  We always take home leftovers.<br><br>Service was excellent when I dined there last week on a weeknight around 6:30 for a party of seven.
Great Decor, Good Service, good food<br>however place is crowded and very busy..<br>expect a wait..

I went here for a get together today and had a wonderful time. We had a thirty minute wait for a party if eight, but really enjoyed the atmosphere and service. It&#39;s a little pricey but if you split dishes you should be fine, because the plates are huge.
Great service, Great Staff, Great Food.....and the Cheesecake...OMG! the BEST!

We were given a paiger and advised we could walk around the Galleria Mall a bit because there was about a 30 min wait.  About an hour and a half later the pager went off.  I thought WOW, this place must be great with a line that long.  However, I was disappointed when I saw the menu. I wound up ordering some sort of chicken pasta and a mojito.  My meal was ok but my majito was probably the best I have ever had. So good, I had to order another, but it was probably the worst. Chef Ramsey would have been smacking some mint across a bartenders face talking about how a good restaurant is all about consistency. I just regret not trying the cheesecake.  Maybe that&#39;s what all the hype is about...you think?

I recently moved to Houston with my man and this being his home town he was eager to show me around town. And of course it wouldn&#39;t be complete without a visit to the galleria. After wandering around the mall we had worked up an appetite and were eager to try the Cheesecake factory since neither of us had been. Our waiter was beyond superb. I had trouble deciding from the HUGE menu so i kept asking him for suggestions, much to his and my boyfriend amusement. I eventually decided on the burrito which was massive ( it lasted me for a whole nother meal after wards.) My boyfriend ordered the shrimp gumbo which was also Delicious. We both ate half of our big entrees then went on to desert. I eventually decided on the red velvet cheesecake which was amazing although a little too sweet. My man got the snickers cheesecake and liked it as well. Will definitely be back again in the future

If you like Mexican food do NOT and I repeat do NOT order anything Mexican off the Cheesecake factory menu. The tortillas they use are the ABSOLUTE WORST GENERIC brand tortillas ever made. Ive bought tortillas in a bag from HEB that are better tasting. I&#39;ve had other food here that was pretty decent but this was the first time I&#39;ve had Mexican food from Cheesecake Factory. I ordered the quesadillas to start and couldn&#39;t even believe the way they looked. You can go to 100 different small taquerias in the Houston area and get a much better quality quesadilla for a third of the price. The texture was like cardboard. I immediately sent it back. I ordered the Factory Burrito and took one bite and realized they used the exact same bottom of the barrel , 1 year old stale type tortilla! I again immediately sent it back again. The manager and waiter were nice enough to ask if I&#39;d like anything else, but the 45 minute wait and  disgusting looking and tasting Mexican fare destroyed my appetite. I can not believe a place that charges such high prices for food with SIMPLE ingredients would use suck LOW QUALITY ingredients and smile when they serve you, to pay for it. Absolutely will never even walk into Cheese Cake factory again after such a HORRIBLE experience with the food. I will stick to local taquerias with BETTER TASTING, BETTER QUALITY, BETTER PRESENTED food than to pay triple the price for what essentiall amounted to BLAND , Poor quality tasting and looking  food. DONT ORDER MEXICAN FOOD FROM THE CHEESCAKE FACTORY!!

This place is constantly packed but for good reasons! The cheesecakes are to die for... thank goodness for ordering them to go! There is a huge menu of just cheesecakes and you can order them by the slice or take the whole cake - awesome!

The only time I could get in, it was worth it. The Godiva chocolate cheesecake is to die for and very decadent.<br><br>However, the majority of the time you would need to wait for on average an hour and half to two hours and by that time, if you are smart, found another equally good restaurant in the Galleria area. The wait is simply not worth it and I suggest reserving in advance.

My fiancee and I went for my first time there...and we had to wait for about 15 minutes to get in.  Very crowded, but I guess that&#39;s a testament to their popularity.<br>We got there, and we ordered the tamale cakes as an appetizer...it was very tasty and almost creamy, as if the ingredients were put through a blender...there were avocados, sweet corn inside...and plenty of other ingredients to make this a good dish...<br>Then our entrees came, and she had the soup and sandwich dish...clam chowder with a chicken salad sandwich...she enjoyed it very much...there were spinach leaves on her plate as if it was an added salad.<br>My meal was just a regular ham and cheese omelette...with double ham and double cheese...I&#39;d just like to say that I&#39;ve never seen an omelette made that thickly...it must have had 4-5 eggs because it was abundant with eggs.  The toast and the potatoes that came with the dish were good as well...<br>Neither of us finished our dish because of the amount of the food that was served.<br>I guess the only thing that I didn&#39;t like was that it was too noisy.  Granted we were in a mall, but at one time, I heard a blender, the crowd noise and music playing, and couldn&#39;t hear my fiancee talking in a normal tone.<br>I&#39;m sure we&#39;ll be back at some point for the value of the food.

I went last night with my two daughters and husband..our first time as a family and my third in my life...but never in Houston.<br>Let me say that the service was impeccable. My husband was commenting already 5 minutes in about how great the service was already. The place was very clean and loved the ambiance of it.<br>My daughters behaved very well and thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and fries; while my oldest got a hamburger. I ordered the shrimp scampi..(can I say wow??? totally worth the $19.99)..the shrimp were HUGE and very flavorful!! Portions were huge and I only finished a third of my plate. My husband got the steak (I don&#39;t remember the name and he couldn&#39;t pronounce it so he just pointed it out on the menu..lol)..he says it&#39;s the best steak he has ever had in a while...(even topping Cole&#39;s chop house in Napa, CA).<br>We ordered the oreo cheesecake and the plain...my husband scarfed the plain by himself..while my daughters enjoyed the oreo cheesecake. They loved them both.<br>The only reason why I did not give this a 5 star is quite frankly the bill. We spent $130 including tip for a family of 4. (2 adults and 2 kids).<br>I could see them offering smaller portions and lowering the price a bit for the main courses..their cheesecakes for $6.95 a slice..heaven.

The hostess ruined the whole experience here. I&#39;ve NEVER in my life had someone some stranger become so catty towards me for no absolute reason. I came up to the hostess stand with my boyfriend and she automatically gives me a stank face. I asked for a table for 2 and she rudely says, &#34;Well there&#39;s a wait, what&#39;s your name?&#34; I told her just to put it under &#34;Jose&#34;. She rolls her eyes and then proceeds to tells me, &#34;yeah, we&#39;ll call you when your table is ready.&#34; Me and the boyfriend stood next to the stairs and my boyfriend even felt upset by the way the hostess talked to me. Mind you my boyfriend is oblivious towards a lot of things, but he even felt the how much of a b-word this chick is. We saw the couples in front of us get sat, so we thought we were up, but nope some group comes up from the stairs and get sat before us.... my thought was maybe the group had a reservation. A few other people come up from the stairs get sat before us and my boyfriend was fuming at this point. He was like let&#39;s go, because this b---- hostess does not like you and then when she saw my boyfriend and I glancing back and forth at her she calls us up. Mind you they  didn&#39;t say &#34;Jose, party of two&#34; they just said &#34;party of two&#34; meaning that horrible hostess didn&#39;t even bother putting our name down. I love the Cheesecake Factory, but if that hostess is working again if I go... wouldn&#39;t even bother dining. Oh, and the rudeness was directed towards me too, she was all smiles when it came to other patrons. She obviously didn&#39;t like me for some reason.

Yes, it&#39;s a little pricey...but the portions are humongous, so it makes up for it...always have leftovers! The food is always delicious, and the CHEESECAKE. You can&#39;t go wrong with a million varieties of amazing cheesecake! I love the way it looks inside, and it may always be crowded, but it&#39;s worth it! If you want to indulge yourself, go here!!

I always love to eat at the &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34;, but this last time, they had gnats real bad and the &#39;service&#39; was below average... What I do know, gnats usually come when a place is not thoroughly clean.. Hopefully they can get it together...

The service by Brittany was great- very cheerful and trying to make the experience the best. The bar beer tap was not functioning!  I will say the food was mediocre at best, somewhat overlooked and a bit disappointing. Maybe a bad day for Cheesecake Factory!  Great job Brittany
Tuna tataki appetizer! Nuf said. This is amazing and more of a meal than an appetizer.

This is a good place for a family dinner. A little on the noisy side, but in a fun way.  Surprisingly good food for a chain. I really enjoyed the black pepper shrimp.  I was dreading going here, but this is where the group wanted to go. I must admit that I was pleasantly surprised. The prices were reasonable, and we were immediately seated at 6pm on a Saturday night (party of 6 + toddler).  Be sure to valet park--otherwise you&#39;ll spend the whole evening looking for a space!

I have been to many different locations for cheesecake factory.<br>However- this one was the best.  I loved how the staff was very helpful.  I have a lot of dietary restrictions and they were very accommodating accommodating<br>As always- food at cheesecake factory is great!

We have been sitting here for 10 minutes and I finally had to get up and go ask the hostess if there was anyone serving our area because not one has approached us yet.  Based on this alone will probably never come back and we love the Cheesecake Factory.  So disappointing.  Update*order and appetizer, the fried cheese, and when we finally received it, they brought out fried Mac and cheese, when we told them, she went to get it fixed and came back about 10 min later to tell us the were out of the fried cheese.  We finally ordered our food about 40 minutes after we were seated, the food was ok, but overall this left a bad taste in our mouth and we won&#39;t be back.  There are much better restaurants in the galleria then this one.  Oh and the reason the staff isn&#39;t attentive is because everyone I looked for someone they were talking to each other, I saw some dancing, and some were even taking to what looked like friends that had come in.

Went to the Cheescake Factory in the Houston Galleria on Dec 23rd 2012 near closing time. Was seated quite promptly, even though the place was packed.<br><br>As a Norwegian who&#39;s recently relocated to Texas and who find most portions here to be insanely huge, the Skinnylicious menu at Cheescake Factory was a good option for me.<br><br>Our server, Joseph, was very courteous and professional, and made sure our needs were met.<br><br>Will definitely be coming back for more.

My future daughter-in-law and I went for lunch and a day of shopping this past Monday.  We were seated at a cramped little table right up against the hostess station even though there were plenty of other tables available.  Our server was very sweet which helped a bit.  We ordered a sandwich and piece of red velvet cheese cake to share.  Both of us had severe stomach pains and nausea about three hours later.  Mine lasted thru the night  and she developed a migraine to go with.  Probably will be a long time if I ever do go back. Sadly, the red velvet cheesecake was basically tasteless and such a let down.  I have always loved whatever I got there, but not this time.
Waitress was awesome and food good!! Awesome how its part of the galleria.  I love the steak diane with the salmon. Prices are pretty good as well! Will be back for more when in the area.

Delicious food! I ordered the grilled salmon with asparagus and spinach. It was probably the best meal I&#39;ve had from Cheesecake.  Our waiter was really attentive.  We were seated immediately, which I thought was weird since it&#39;s in the galleria, but we didn&#39;t go a little later, like 9:30pm.
